loans.name: Ruth Catalina

texts.es: Doña Ruth se dedica a la venta de cosmeticos por catalogo, adicionalmente la señora tambien es lider de su zona. Su mercaderia la distribuye en las oficinas a pagos, paralelamente la cliente tambien trabaja en Bancos de Emprendimiento, hasta la fecha no ha tenido ningun problema en el pago de sus cuotas.  La señora tiene estabilidad domiciliaria ya que vive en casa familiar de forma independiente, comparte su departamento con sus hijos y su esposo el cual le colabora con los gastos del hogar.  El crédito será destinado en la compra de cosmeticos que se encuentren en oferta.
texts.en:
Ruth's business is selling cosmetics from a catalog line, and she is the leader in her area. Her merchandise is distributed in local offices. She has also been working with other entrepreneurial banks, and she has never had a problem making her scheduled payments. Ruth has a stable home life, living independently in an apartment with her children and her husband, who also helps with the household expenses. The loan she is requesting will be used to purchase cosmetics which are currently available at a reduced price.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investing in merchandise at a reduced price

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita N. is from the village of Dimalco in Bonifacio Misamis Occidental. She is 52 years old. Rosita is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Rosita owns & operates a specialized retail store where she sells daily-use products, soft drinks, and dry goods in the local community. Rosita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Rosita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. Rosita is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Rosita's fourth loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for her children's tuition. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah T., 44, is a workaholic. She puts in a lot of time attending to her many businesses.  She lives in the heart of Dasmariñas, Cavite.
 
Sarah has been managing her general store for 10 years. In her spare time, she attends to her direct-selling business. She also embarked on selling electronic load credits for mobile phones – a hit additional source of income among Filipinos. All combined, she makes 15,000 Philippine pesos a month.
 
She became a member of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2008. She needs a new loan in the amount of P11,000 to purchase more cosmetic items and basic items for her general store. She also wants to purchase a bicycle she can use for daily transportation.

Sarah says she wants to see her family all together again, a dream she has grown up with. She now works hard to be able to expand her businesses. 

About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social-development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.  

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: Grocery items and bicycle for transportation

loans.name: Yovana

texts.es:
Yovana tiene 33 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en una casa arrendada.
Desde hace un año se dedica día a día a la atención de su tienda de comestibles. Su deseo de tener un negocio propio la llevó a determinar que este rubro sería rentable porque el local donde vende sus productos está ubicado cerca a un centro de estudios y eso garantiza sus ventas diarias, pues los estudiantes son sus más asiduos clientes.
Yovana atiende durante todo el día y todos los días de la semana, pues sólo así logra cubrir, no las necesidades de su hogar, sino también el pago del arrendamiento de su local.
Su deseo a futuro es tener un establecimiento comercial grande donde pueda vender diversos productos comestibles. 

Esta es la tercera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP y dentro de su banco comunal se le considera como la más puntual en sus pagos y en la asistencia a las reuniones de grupo. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de más mercadería en tarros de leche evaporada, golosinas y bebidas gaseosas.
texts.en:
Yovana, 33, lives with her husband and two children in a rented house. For a year she has run a grocery store. Her wish to have a business of her own led her to determine that this type of business would be very profitable because the site where she has her store is located near a school and that guarantees her daily sales because students are her most regular customers. Yovana tends to her sales all day, every day of the week because only thus can she earn enough to cover not only her household expenses but also the rental of her store. Her future desire is to have a large commercial esablishment where she can sell a wide variety of food items. This is her third loan with MFP. She is considered to be most punctual with repayments and with meeting assistance by her fellow group members. The funds requested will be used to buy stock items like jars of evaporated milk, sweets, and soft-drinks.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock inventory.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is thirty-one years old. She is married and has given birth to two children. Both are in school. She lives with the children and her husband in a rented apartment in Axim. Axim is along the coast in the western region of Ghana. Fishing is the major occupation of the people. Sarah trades in second-hand clothes. She buys from Accra and hawks to sell in her community. She also treks to sell in nearby communities. She has been in business for over twelve years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk.

loans.use: To buy goods in bulk to expand businesses.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria C. D., 49, is from the village of Catarman. She is married and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, Gloria runs a general store, selling a variety of products in the local community.  Gloria has been in business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 1999, Gloria joined PMPC to access financial services, improve her living situation and engage in business. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC to purchase additional products to sell.  Gloria is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase additional inventory. This loan will be her 15th from PMPC.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 
--------------------------------
About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: Purchase additional inventory to sell.

loans.name: Vicente Azael

texts.es: Vicente Azael de comunidad el Granadino Municipio el Coral, tiene un año de laborar para la  alcaldia del coral, es un hombre que le gusta superarse y ayudar a su familia ya que son de escasos recursos economicos, solicita su primer crédito a la institución de AFODENIC,  el que será invertido en mejoras de su vivienda, necesita ampliar su casa y así gozar de mejores condiciones de vida en su hogar en conjunto con la familia. don Vicente es un hombre trabajador en sus dias libre trabaja en la finca cuidando su ganado, también tiene buenas referencias personales de los vecinos de su comunidad.
texts.en:
Vicente Azael from the community of the Granadino Municipio el Coral has worked for the mayor's office for one year. He is a man who likes to improve himself and help his family, as they have limited economic resources. He is seeking his first loan from AFODENIC, which will be invested in home improvements. He needs to improve his house and in this way enjoy better living conditions in his home, together with his family. Don Vincente is a hard-working man and on his free days he works on his farm, looking after his livestock. He also has good personal references from his neighbours in the community.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvements

loans.name: Nadia

texts.es:
Nadia es socia del Banco Comunal Los Sauces.
Nadia es casada, tiene 30 años y 2 hijos, Nadia junto a su esposo se dedican al transporte de carga, tiene 2 carros, Nadia se encarga de las cobranzas.
Nadia necesita un préstamo de 1250 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de combustible.
Nadia sueña con ampliar su empresa, construir su casa y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Nadia is a member of the community bank "Los Sauces." She is 30 years old, and is married with two children. Nadia and her husband work in cargo transportation, and they have 2 vehicles. Nadia is in charge of collecting the funds.

She seeks this loan of 1250 Soles to invest in the purchase of fuel. Nadia dreams of growing her business, constructing her home, and providing a good education to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fuel

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 33 years old and married with two children, ages 4 and 1, who have yet to start school. He runs a mixed farm in the western region of Kenya, near the town of Kitale, where he has been farming for over ten years. He has diversified his production in recent years and now sells eggs, chickens, maize, beans and tomatoes in his hometown.

When not too busy with the farm, he also earns additional income by making and selling bricks. Overall, the main challenge that he faces is the risk of disease spreading through the area and infecting his livestock.

Joseph has successfully completed three previous loans with Juhudi Kilimo, and has now requested this loan for KES 30,000 to expand his stock of poultry. He says that the extra income from this loan will help take care of his family's basic needs, now and in the future.

In the coming years, he would like to continually expand his business and he hopes to acquire additional chickens, keeping both the local breeds and some new exotic types.

Joseph is optimistic for the future and he has high hopes that Juhudi Kilimo will uplift him from his current position to a more comfortable life.

loans.use: To expand his poultry project.

loans.name: Famila

texts.en:
Famila M. sells different kind of dishes. She is 56 years old, married and has five children. She rents a place to sell her goods which is located in one of the local markets. Famila has been running this business for seven years. Her main clients are brides who usually comes to her shop to purchase dowry before a wedding party. With only a couple of competitors in the market, she is doing well with her business. 

Today she is requesting a loan of 1606 AZN to purchase new dishes and increase her range of goods. Famila thanks everyone for supporting her and promises to be accurate with her loan repayments.

loans.use: purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora T. is 39 and married with 2 children (ages 9 and 11).  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Nora has 1 year of experience in this business.  Nora needs a loan of WST $1500 to invest in expanding the business.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2008, Nora joined SPBD.  This is her 2nd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Nora's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Nora T. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.87 out of 3
Level of Education:                              2 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         2 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Long's Group

texts.en:
Three people make up this group loA. and all live in Skul village in Takeo province. Each member will use the loA. for a different purpose.

Mrs. Long A. is the group leader who has been selected by all the members. She is a white wine maker in the local village and her husband is a farmer who owns 1 hectare (2.5 acres) of land on which he cultivates rice to support his family.

Although they try to work hard, they still earn less income thA. needed. Thus, in order to improve their family living conditions, Mrs. Long A. decided to seek a loA. to buy a cow for breeding.

Mrs. Long A. is the mother of three children, one of whom is a seamstress in a garment factory while the others are attending the local public school.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Sonata En Invierno Group

texts.es:
La alcancía Sonata en Invierno está integrada por 9 socias, quienes se dedican a diversas actividades.
La señora María  A. D. 61 años D. edad, emprendedora y entusiasta es casada  y tiene una hija.
Ella  comenzó a vender en su domicilio con una poca cantidad D. abarrotes  y gaseosas, con el transcurrir del tiempo a medida que su ingreso fue mejorando comenzaba  a surtir su pequeña tienda.
Su primer préstamo lo invirtió en la compra D.  mercadería compro  más cantidad D. abarrotes,  gaseosas, cervezas.
Su actual préstamo lo invertirá igualmente en su tienda  en la compra D.  más cantidad D. abarrotes, verduras,  golosinas y cajas D. gaseosas 
El objetivo D. María, es en la implementación D. su negocio, tanto en la ampliación como en el surtido D. sus  productos que pueda ofrecer al público en general
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Sonata en Invierno” (Sonata in Winter) consists of nine members who are dedicated to various business activities.

Sra. María A. is 61 years old, married, and has a daughter. She is an enthusiastic and enterprising woman who began selling small quantities of groceries and sodas from her home. Over time, her revenues improved and she was able restock her small store. Her first loan was used to purchase larger quantities of groceries, sodas, and beer.

María’s current loan will be used in the same manner to purchase large quantities of groceries, vegetables, candy, and cases of soda. Her goal is to solidify her business by enlarging it and expanding the range of products that she offers to the general public.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Florida

texts.en: Florida M. is from the village of Baliangao. She is 48 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children. Florida is engaged in selling rice and through this activity she is able to earn a monthly net income of 2,900 PHP. In 2001, Florida joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Florida is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for her rice-selling. This loan will be her 11th from PMPC. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her rice-selling businesses

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline S. is from the village of Danao. She is 28 years old, and married, with 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Caroline owns and operates a  fishing business, harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish. Caroline has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2005, Caroline joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Caroline has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. Caroline is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP to be used to expand the business. This loan will be the 9th loan taken out by Caroline from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth E., 49 years old, is a married woman who supports her family by running a butcher shop and by delivering meat to her customers. She lives in Barangay Miranda, Pontevedra, Negros Occidental, with her husband, Rodrigo, 52 years old, and their five children who are between 12 and 31 years old. Ruth has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2001 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her butcher shop business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of Php 20,000. Ruth is now borrowing Php 15,000 so that she will use as additional working capital for her butcher shop. This will be her 19th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of Php 15,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Ruth aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the “Dungganon” way. Ruth is shown in the accompanying picture posing by the mini-truck that she and her husband use in their meat deliveries. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her business

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce W., a 43-year-old married mother of four children, has been operating a catering business employing two people for five years to earn a living. Joyce hopes to build a café so that she can have a reliable business premise and therefore is requesting a loan of Kes. 40, 000 through Imani group in Faulu Kenya.  She dreams of buying a piece of land where she can build a hotel in the future.

loans.use: To build a café for her business.

loans.name: Irenea

texts.en: Irenea Y. is from the village of Doña Josefa, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 47 years old, married and has four children. To make a living, Irenea owns and operates a general store. Irenea has been engaged in her business for 15 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities. Irenea joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Irenea is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which she will use to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan is Irenea's first from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business. About PMPC Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her store.

location.town: Sindangan-Doña Josefa, Sindangan, Zamboanga del No

loans.name: Lorina

texts.en:
Lorina C. is from the village of Sittio San Martin, Manukan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 32 years old and is married with two school-aged children.

Lorina owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over fifteen years and earns approximately 6,500 PHP a month.

In 2009, Lorina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital.

Lorina is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used additional capital for her business. This loan will be her 4th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 


About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Vumiriya

texts.en:
Vumiriya is married and has three children who are all at school. She also takes care of additional family members. She owns a bar in Mengo Mackay selling all types of drinks ranging from crude local gin to beer and local brew. She has been in this business for over ten years. She sells to all categories of people both at retail and wholesale.  

She wants to use this loan to buy more crates of beer and jeryrcans of local brew and gin. Vumiriya works from her home and so doesn’t rent the business premises.  She buys crates of beer from delivery vans and jerrycans of local gin from suppliers who get them from the Kasese district in southwestern Uganda.  She works seven days a week. 

Her business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She is aspires to selling at wholesale only. She decided to join MCDT because she wanted additional capital.  Vumiriya resides in and rents a two roomed house and the family has no access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes food, rent, and school fees.

loans.use: buying beer and local gin

loans.name: Luzvilla

texts.en: Luzvilla B. is from the village of Rizalina, Rizal. She is 50 years old and is married with two adult children. Luzvilla owns a logging business, selling timber in the local community. From this activity, she's able to earn a monthly net income of PHP 2,300. In 2006, Luzvilla joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Luzvilla is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to redeem her pawned chainsaw. This loan will be her 9th from PMPC. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To redeem her pawned chainsaw

loans.name: Mawuena

texts.fr: Mme Z. Mawuena est née en 1980 à Gapé Afomekponawoé. Elle est mariée et mère de famille. Analphabète sans aucune instruction, elle s’est adonnée au travail de la terre. Ces cultures principales sont le maïs, du manioc et du haricot. Mariée et mère de trois (03) enfants, elle arrive à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille grâce aux revenus tirés de son activité agricole. Très dévoué et courageuse, elle a une grande expérience dans son activité et sollicite un financement qui pourra lui permettre d’agrandir son champ et par conséquent augmenter sa productivité et ses revenus agricoles pour mieux contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en: Mme Z. Mawuena est née en 1980 à Gapé Afomekponawoé. Elle est mariée et mère de famille. Analphabète sans aucune instruction, elle s’est adonnée au travail de la terre. Ces cultures principales sont le maïs, du manioc et du haricot. Mariée et mère de trois (03) enfants, elle arrive à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille grâce aux revenus tirés de son activité agricole. Très dévoué et courageuse, elle a une grande expérience dans son activité et sollicite un financement qui pourra lui permettre d’agrandir son champ et par conséquent augmenter sa productivité et ses revenus agricoles pour mieux contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: agrandir son champ

loans.name: María Betzabé

texts.es: La Sra. B. es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, se desempeña como profesora en la escuela de la comarca Valle San Antonio de dicho municipio donde tiene 14 años de laborar. Tiene dos años de trabajar con Ceprodel donde le han otorgado cuatro créditos consecutivos para mejorar su vivienda. El crédito lo solicitó para la compra de verjas para ventanas y puertas con el objetivo de seguir mejorando su vivienda.
texts.en:
Mrs. B. is from El Sucre.  She works as a teacher in the school in Valle San Antonio, a municipality where she’s worked for 14 years.

She has collaborated with Ceprodel for two years and has been granted four consecutive loans for home improvement.

This requested loan will be used to buy iron grates for her windows and doors to continue improving her home.

loans.use: To buy iron grates for windows and doors.

loans.name: Jargalsaihan

texts.en:
Jargalsaihan D. is 42 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian housing tent. Two of his children attend a local school. His eldest son mainly operates Jargalsaihan's coal trading and transportation business and his wife helps with this business.
Jargalsaihan works and lives in the countryside as a herder. He owns around 300 livestock. He runs his transportation business during winter months and herds livestock in the countryside in the summer months. He first went into business in 2007 by transporting and delivering coal and firewood using his own van in order to increase his family's quality of life. Over the years, he has built a stable and successful operation. For the future, he says, "I am trying hard to earn enough money to build a house and fence for my family". Jargalsaihan is requesting a 1,600,000 MNT loan to use to purchase necessary spare parts for his car (480,000 MNT) as well as more coal (1,120,000 MNT) for resale.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for his car, and coal for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Personal expenses

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Chan L., age 71, is a widow living in Phnom Penh. (She was not available the day of the photo, so her son is pictured instead.) Her husband suffered from dementia and died years ago. Chan L. is a homemaker and manages all the family's daily household duties such as cooking, washing, and managing cash flow. She is the mother of six children, three of whom are married. The income for the family comes from the three of her children who work at a garment factory and one daughter who has been tailoring from home for several years.

The daughter's tailoring business requires more materials, such as a new sewing machine. Chan L. is requesting a loan in order to buy a new sewing machine, a purchase which will enable her daughter to sew clothes more efficiently.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine for her daughter's tailoring business

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samwel is a resident of Kisii Town in Western Kenya. He is married with seven children, all adults. He has been in the farming business for 25 years, producing and selling tea, sugarcane, potatoes and milk locally. He has employed two farmhands.

He has applied for this loan of 90,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to expand his dairy farming and dairy products retail shop. He hopes this expansion will improve the family income and give them a better living standard. He aspires to have a van for public transport.

He faces the challenges of finances for family expenses and inputs like fertilizers.

loans.use: Purchase and insurance of a dairy cow

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora J. is from the village of Marapong, Sibutad. She is 58 years old, married and has 4 grown children. To make a living, Nora owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector planting assorted crops to sell. She has been engaged in her business for over 28 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2006, Nora joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nora has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC, which was used as additional capital for her business. She is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used as additional capital for rice production. This will be Nora’s 9th loan from PMPC. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for rice production

loans.name: Nelita

texts.en:
Nelita P., 50, is from the town of Banga. Nelita plants and harvests rice for sale. Nelita also grows pigs in her backyard. She fattens the pigs and sells them to her town's market.

Nelita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nelita has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. 

Nelita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos, which will be used to buy fertilizers and piglets. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and piglets

loans.name: Albina

texts.es: Albina, de 38 años, es una madre de familia muy laboriosa y responsable, vive en la casa de sus suegros junto a su esposo Tito (39) y sus dos pequeños hijos.Son 16 horas las que Albina pasa dentro de su tienda, ya que abre a las seis de la mañana y atiende todo el día de corrido hasta aproximadamente las 10 de la noche, su bodega esta ubicada frente a un colegio de la comunidad de Yurinaki (Comunidad  del distrito de Pichanaki) y es muy concurrida por los alumnos del plantel, como también por los profesores, a quienes además brinda el servicio de pensión. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes y enterarse de las cosas que suceden en la comunidad, ya lleva cuatro  años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda, sin poder salir a la calle. Con el tiempo, espera que su negocio crezca y le pueda brindar mejores ingresos económicos.Es su  sexto préstamo con MFP, y esta dispuesta a trabajar muy duro para pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, en su banco comunal es muy respetada por la puntualidad que demuestra.Albina tiene planeado invertir los  quinientos soles solicitados, en la compra de mayor cantidad de  productos que necesita para implementar mejor el stock de su tienda, de esta manera espera alcanzar el progreso.
texts.en:
Albina is 38 years old and she is a very hard working and responsible mother. She lives with her in-laws, together with her husband, Tito (39), and they two young children. Albina operates her store 16 hours every day, starting at 6 in the morning and closing at 10pm. 

Her grocery store is located in front of a school in the community of Yurinaki (a community in the district of Pichanaki), and it is patronized often by the students and teachers. She also offers pension services to them. What she most enjoys about her work is chatting with her clients and to keep up with the community news. She has four years in the business. The most difficult part of the job is to remain in the store all day, without getting a chance to go out.

In time she hopes to expand her business in order to improve her income. This is her sixth loan through MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and she is ready to work very hard to make her loan payments on time. She is a well respected member of her communal bank for the responsibility she demonstrates. 

Albina plans on investing the requested five hundred soles in the purchase of a large quantity of products that she needs to supply her store. This way she will be able to progress in her business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise to supply her store.

loans.name: Benkola Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Benkola sont toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 38 ans, 8 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Barouéli, préfecture de Barouéli; Région de Ségou (quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de produits cosmétiques, de tissus, de tubercules, des parfums, de tasses et de savons.                                                                                     
Les femmes du groupe Benkola sont à leur sixième prêt solidaire. 
ASSAN D. s’approvisionne en produits cosmétiques avec les grossistes qui partent au Burkina Faso. Elle revend au comptant et à crédit, au marché de Barouéli à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 60 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, prendre en charge les dépenses relatives à la santé, à la nourriture, aux frais scolaires des enfants et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Benkola group are all married and on average they are 38 years old. They each have 8 children and they live in traditional extended families in the city of Baroueli, located in the Baroueli prefecture in the region of Segou (fourth administrative region in the Republic of Mali). 

They are known through family, as neighbors and through friendships. They are involved in the sale of cosmetics, fabrics, tubers, perfumes, kitchen wares, and soaps. 

The women of the Benkola group are on their sixth group loan. 

Assan D. purchases cosmetics from the wholesalers from Burkina Faso. She resells her products in cash and credit at a market in Baroueli to a clientele made up of women and men. 

She expects to earn a monthly income of 60 000 FCFA which will be used to make the payments for  this loan, to pay for health care related expenses, to purchase food, and to pay for school  fees. The remaining portion will be used to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics.

loans.name: Thu

texts.en: Thu T. N. is 37 years old with 2 children who are at secondary school. Since her first loan from our Credit program in 2004, she has opened a small grocery shop. Her shop developed year after year, and now it is an agent to support smaller stores. Profit earned from this agent is 4,000,000 VND per month. To expand more, she would like to borrow 9,810,000 VND to buy more goods to meet the increasing demand of customers.

loans.use: To buy more goods to meet the increasing demand of customers.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita E. is from the village of Langcataon, Pangantucan, Bukidnon. She is 46 years-old. Juanita is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Juanita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily use products such as junk food, snacks such as rice cakes, and a variety of beverages including softdrinks and fruit juices in the local community. Juanita has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Juanita joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juanita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and to provide working capital. Juanita is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell such as junk foods and beverages. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Juanita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell like junk foods & beverages

loans.name: Bilkisu

texts.en: This is 26-year-old Bilkisu. She is single, and has one child aged seven years. She has three additional dependents: her younger brothers and sister. In 2007, Bilkisu established her plastic slippers business. She began her business because she told by her friend that the slippers business is very interesting and profitable. She opens her business six days a week and 10 hours a day. She would like a loan of Le 3,000,000. Bilkisu needs this loan in order to purchase more plastic slippers. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more plastic slippers for her business.

loans.name: Erika Paola

texts.es:
Erika de 26 años, una mujer  joven emprendedora que inicio hace un año en la venta por catalogo de Yanbal  y ventas de ropa Nivi. Su esposo trabaja en pintura de decoración y tiene tres hijos.

Ella trabaja de lunes a domingos por medios telefónicos a amigos y conocidos para promocionar sus ventas. su mayor dificultad en algunas ocasiones es en la cobranza a sus clientes ya que lo dejan a créditos y no le pagan a tiempo. 

Con el préstamo ella desea mejorar sus ingresos en las ventas de catálogos de ropa. Una sus metas es llegar a ser consultora y que su negocio crezca mas para así sacar adelante a su familia en lo más necesiten.
texts.en:
Erika is 26 years old and is an enterprising young woman. A year ago she started selling Yanbal products and Nivi clothing by catalog. Her husband works as a decorative painter and she has three children. 

She works Monday to Sunday calling friends and acquaintances to promote her sales. Her main difficulty on some occasions is collecting from customers that gives credit to and do not pay on time.

With the loan she wants to improve her income in clothing sales. Her goals are to become a consultant and that her business will grow so that she can support her family with what they need most.

loans.use: to purchase Nivi clothing and Yanbal products (cosmetics).

loans.name: Heng

texts.en: Heng C. is a 32-year-old married woman. She  lives with her husband and  four school-aged children and earns a living by planting various crops on their own farmland. Heng C. currently plants a potato crop, which she will harvest  when it  matures.  Heng C. says that she faces difficulties in traveling  anywhere. She and her husband hire a taxi or walk because they don't have their own vehicle. To solve this difficulty, Heng C. has requested a loan to buy a used motorcycle to provide transportation.

loans.use: to buy a used motorcycle to provide transportation.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: La señora Alicia se dedica a vender cosméticos, perfumes, trastes para cocina etc., por catalogo, ella tiene con este negocio 3 años y esta muy contenta de vender este tipo de producto dice ella “gracias a que vendo mis productos he conocido mas gente de mi población y de las localidades vecinas y he hecho mas amistades y así poco a poco me acliento mas y vendo rápido mis productos”. Doña Alicia surte sus productos por vía Internet y le llegan a su casa, ella esta muy agradecida por el préstamo por que así podrá tener en existencia productos. Ella esta casada con la señor Ramón el cual es chofer y tienen tres hijos uno estudiante de preparatoria, el segundo estudiante de secundaria y el tercero estudiante de primaria. La meta que tiene doña Alicia con su negocio es ser un distribuidor autorizado ya que en su localidad no lo hay.
texts.en:
Alicia sells cosmetics, perfume, kitchenware etc. through a catalog.  She has been in this business for three years and is very happy to be selling this type of product.  She says "thanks to selling my products, I have met more people in my town and in neighboring towns and I have made more friends.  I am gradually gaining more customers and I sell my products quickly".

Alicia stocks up with products through the Internet and they are delivered to her home.  She is very grateful for this loan because it will enable her to have products in stock.  Alicia is married to Ramón, who is a driver, and they have three children.  Their eldest child is in high school, their second child is in middle school and the youngest is in elementary school.  Alicia's goal for her business is to become an authorized distributor since there isn't one in her town.

loans.use: to sell cosmetics through a catalog

loans.name: Ana Milena

texts.es: Ana Milena de 29 años vive con su cónyuge y su hijo de 7 años en Mesolandia, barrio ubicado en el municipio de Malambo;  allí se dedica a la venta de carnes y bebidas frías como cerveza y gaseosas,  negocio que inició hace 4 años cuando vendía por encargos a sus vecinos, pero gradualmente fue evolucionando su capital y con ello compró una nevera para refrigerar y conservar sus productos, así empezó a  incrementar sus ventas porque agregó a su negocio el mercado de las tiendas que hoy aun le compran. Todos estos logros los ha conseguido con su esfuerzo y con los 3 financiamientos que ha tenido  con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo; su credikiva es el cuarto financiamiento con el cual comprará canastas de cervezas, hará adecuaciones locativas y comprará silletería y otros enseres, porque  ella cuenta que ahora tiene 2 negocios  y que ha hecho mejoras locativas solo a uno de ellos, sus negocios están ubicados en dos sitios diferentes,  pero uno de ellos  funciona solamente  los fines de semana y  que ella además genera otros ingresos como ayudante de una panadería. Su negocio gozan de una buena presentación y reputación y ahora  su sueño se concentra en tener una panadería,  para que su esposo aplique sus conocimientos y su vocación  al servicio de los ingresos familiares y este es obviamente su mayor desafío.
texts.en: Ana Milena is 29 years old and she lives with her common-law husband and their 7-year old son in Mesolandia. It is a district located in the municipality of Malambo. She sells meats and cold drinks such as beer and soft drinks. She started her business 4 years ago and she only sold by taking orders from her neighbors. But her capital funds gradually increased and with it she purchased a freezer to keep and conserve her products. Her sales increased when she joined her business to the market and the stores still buy from her. All of these achievements have been realized with her efforts and with the help of 3 loans she has had from Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo (Kiva Field Partner). Her Kiva loan will be her fourth and with it she will purchase boxes of beer, she will condition her store, and she will purchase a transportation harness and other equipment. She now has 2 businesses and she has reconditioned only one of them. Her businesses are located in two different locations but one of them only operates on the weekends. She earns an additional source of income by working as a helper at a bakery. Her business enjoys a good presentation and reputation and today her dream is to have a bakery. Her husband will be able to employ his knowledge and to work in his vocation to earn an income for the family. This is obviously her greatest goal.

loans.use: to purchase cases of beer, recondition her business, and to purchase tools.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John has been in the shoe-making and shoe-repair business for four years, and he earns a profit of KES 5,000 per month. 

He is 47 years old and married to Pricilla, and they have two children. 

His business is in Dandora, which is very highly populated area, and he is just few kilometers from city center.

He was introduced to KADET Ltd. by a KADET staff member and he is borrowing his first loan from KADET. He plans to use it to buy raw materials like thread and unprocessed leather for making shoes. The anticipated profits will be re-invested into the business.

He desires to grow his business and offer his children the best education.

loans.use: To buy  raw materials like thread and unprocessed leather for making shoes.

loans.name: Hernando

texts.es: Hernando  es un hombre  dedicado a los negocios, por un lado ofrece el servicio de alquiler de lavadoras, en su municipio San Jacinto en el departamento de Bolívar, desde hace tres años, después de ganar experiencia de negocio trabajando con un familiar en este servicio y como es una persona consiente de las oportunidades aprovecha al máximo su clientela y también le ofrece sandalias que compra en volumen y vende al detal mediante créditos y así mismo con su cónyuge, tiene otras inversiones como la venta de motocicletas a créditos, cartera que cobran mensualmente. Su negocio de lavadoras se ha fortalecido en cuanto a la clientela, pero sus lavadoras están necesitando reemplazo y por eso tiene como meta comprar otras maquinarias, con tal de responder a su clientela de la mejor manera y continuar generando utilidades para aumentar el  bienestar de su hogar;  Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a  la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará tres lavadoras  y también modernos diseños de sandalias,  que están muy de moda entre las mujeres de la población. Inversiones que planea serán exitosas, porque responden a pedidos y porque aumentarán sus posibilidades de atender nuevos clientes en el servicio de lavadoras, especialmente los días viernes, sábados, domingos y feriados cuando se quedan muchos clientes sin ser atendidos. Mientras Hernando construye sus sueños, se esmera trabajando para  aumentar su rentabilidad sobre las ventas que en la actualidad es no menor del 29%.
texts.en:
Hernando is a gentleman who is devoted to his businesses. One of them involves renting out washing machines in the town of San Jacinto, which is in the Department of Bolívar. He started this business three years ago after he gained experience working for a relative who provided this same service. Hernando is the type of person who is aware of opportunities and takes advantage of them to the fullest. He started another business buying sandals in bulk and selling them on credit. His wife takes part in this business. He has other investments, such as selling motorcycles on credit and collecting payments each month.

His washing machine rental business has been strengthened in terms of more customers, but the equipment needs to be replaced. For this reason, his goal is to buy more machines so that he can respond better to his customers and continue generating income to improve his family’s well-being. This Kiva loan is the first one he has received from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. Hernando will use the funds to buy three washing machines, as well as sandals that come in modern designs that will appeal to the local women. He foresees that his investments will be successful since he will be able to respond to service requests and increase his chances of attracting new customers who need to rent washing machines. His busiest times are on Fridays, Saturdays, Sundays, and fair days since many customers have no one else who can meet the demand on those days. While he continues to build his dream, Hernando strives to increase profitability. At the moment, the profit margin from his sales is a minimum of 29%.

loans.use: to acquire three washing machines for his rental business and to purchase sandals to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy repair tools and items for making tube light parts.

loans.name: Nelva

texts.es: Nelva nació en la ciudad de Pomocanchis del departamento del Cusco (Perú) y tiene 29 años de edad. Actualmente, Nelva vive en la ciudad de Cusco junto con sus dos hijos. Nelva se dedica a la venta de artesanía en el centro comercial “Inti Pakari”. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más mercadería como por ejemplo chompas y otras cosas más. Ya son varios años  que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. La socia es una persona responsable y trabajadora que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal la “Inti Quilla” de la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en:
Nelva was born in the city of Pomocanchis, Cusco Department (Perú).  She is 29 years old.  Nelva currently lives in the city of Cusco with her two children.  She sells crafts at the “Inti Pakari” shopping center.

On this occasion she needs the loan to buy more merchandise like sweaters, for example, and some other things.  She’s been in this business for several years now and does well thanks to the effort she puts into her work.  She is a responsible, hard working person.  Because of these qualities her companions invited her to participate in Asociación Arariwa’s “Inti Quilla” communal bank.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise, like sweaters, for example, and some other things.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a 43 year old married lady. Susan runs a food cafe in Mtwapa, Mombasa. Her business has been in operation for the last five years.

She has been a KADET client previously and this marks her first borrowing to finance her business. With this loan she plans to purchase sugar, rice, cooking oil, wheat flour and maize meal into her business. 

The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan. Her dream is to be a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: purchase sugar, rice, cooking oil, wheat flour and maize meal

loans.name: Rashid

texts.en: Rashid is a Ugandan male, aged 34 years, who needs a loan to buy fertilizer to prepare land for farming. He hails from Kyenjojo district. Rashid is a father of three children, living in a semi permanent house. He takes care of 5 people. For ten years he has been a farmer, mainly growing bananas. His dream is  to buy a vehicle for transporting farm products and he also looks forward to supplying his bananas beyond his district.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to prepare land for farming.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a businesswoman who owns and operates a cafeteria.  She started the business two years ago and has employed two people. Through Faulu Kenya, she has learned how to save money. She has also been trained in business management. This has helped her to run her business well. 
 
Regina hopes to own a big hotel in the future.  

She has requested a loan in the amount of 20,000 Kenya shillings in order to buy vegetables, sugar, and maize flour to use in food preparation.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, sugar, and maize flour to use in food preparation

loans.name: Mayra Alejandra

texts.es:
La señora Mayra Alejandra  desde hace 4 años se dedica al negocio sobre ruedas, en este momento su mayor afición es  la venta de ropa usada, zapatos y accesorios para el hogar. Este negocio es parte de su  fuente de ingresos por tal motivo desea invertir mas en el para seguir prosperando. 

Mayra se ven en la necesidad de pedir un préstamo para comprar ropa de temporada por que en esta época de regreso a clase; mucha gente busca ropa de segunda mano para sus hijos ya que alguna no cuenta con recursos para comprar nueva. Mayra ve la oportunidad para surtir su negocio ya que de esta forma podrá obtener mayores ganancia y así ayudar a su esposo con los gasto del hogar.
texts.en:
For four year, Mayra Alejandra has done business at traveling street markets. At the moment, she is most interested in selling used clothing, shoes and home accessories. This business is part of her sources of income, so she wants to invest more in it to keep doing well.

Mayra needs to ask for a loan to buy seasonal clothing because now, at back-to-school time, many people are looking for secondhand clothing for their children, and some of them do not have the resources to buy new clothes. Mayra sees an opportunity to stock her business so she can have higher earnings and help her husband with household expenses.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Luz Idalia

texts.es: Luz Idalia de 41 años de edad, reside en su humilde casa junto a sus 4 hijos. Luz posee un comedor en cual ofrece variedad de ricos platillos. Ha trabajado toda su vida para sacar adelante a su familia y poder darles el pan de cada día. Luz es una mujer trabajadora, desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana se levanta para tener listos los diferentes platillos que cada día ofrece a sus clientes. El negocio de Luz cuenta con la ventaja que está ubicado en una zona muy estratégica en la cual muchas personas transitan. Es muy conocida y famosa por sus ricos platillos los cuales son inigualables. Para ella lo más importante es que su familia y sus clientes estén satisfechos. Hace todo lo que esté en sus manos para ofrecer lo mejor a sus clientes ya que su sueño es poder ver su negocio florecer de tal manera que las personas  la prefieran cada día más y consuman su rica comida. Ha decidido hacer este crédito a INTEGRAL para comprar los insumos necesarios para la elaboración de nuevos y ricos platillos, tales como: pollos, carnes, verduras, bebidas y sazonadores. Todo con el objetivo de lograr una mayor demanda de sus productos y poder ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Luz Idalia, age 41, lives in a small home with her four children. Luz has an eatery where she offers a variety of rich dishes. She has worked all her life to get her family ahead and provide their daily bread. Luz is a hard-working woman who gets up every day very early in the morning to get her various dishes ready. Luz's business has the advantage of being located in a very strategic, highly trafficked zone. It is very well-known and is famous for its rich, unbeatable dishes. For Luz, the most important thing is for her family and customers to be satisfied. She does everything within her power to offer her customers the best, since her dream is to be able to see her business flourish so that people like it more and more every day and eat her rich food. She has decided to take out this loan from INTEGRAL to purchase the necessary ingredients for making new and rich dishes. These ingredients include: chicken, meat, vegetables, drinks and seasonings. Her goal is to provoke greater demand for her food and to be able to offer her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy the necessary ingredients for making her rich dishes: for example, chicken, meat, vegetables, drinks, etc.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with four children. 

Teresita has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Teresita is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Teresita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Najah

texts.en:
Najah is a 41-year-old married woman, a mother of four and she is from Madab, Jordan.

Najah is requesting a loan of 600 JD to purchase mobile prepaid cards in order to sell them on installments.

An aspiration of Najah's is to expand her business and improve her family's living conditions.

Due to culturA. issues, Najah refused to upload her picture, so her husband appears in the picture.

loans.use: To purchase prepaid mobile cards

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es: EL Señor Jaime, es una persona de 28 años de edad, de estado civil soltero, alcanzo a estudiar el bachillerato en humanidades, actualmente vive y su fábrica está en la casa de su padre y cuenta con un solo dependiente economico la cual es su pequeña hija. La actividad económica del cliente es la fabricación y venta de pelotas de futsal y futbol como anteriormente se mencionó en la casa de su padre y la comercialización de sus productos los realiza principalmente a los comerciantes minoristas de la ciudad de Cochabamba y algunas provincias de la misma. El señor Jaime manifiesta ser una persona responsable que tiene ganas de superarse y para tal efecto se ve en la necesidad de solicitar capital de reposición por la compra de un lote, donde construirá su propia vivienda y de esta forma poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Jaime is a 28 year old man and he is single. He achieved his high school diploma in the humanities. Her currently lives with his father and has a business in the house. His only economic dependent is his little daughter. His business is making soccer and futsal balls, and, as mentioned before, he does this in his father's house. He sells his products mostly to the small businesses in the city of Cochabamba and some of the provinces of the city. Jaime is a responsible person who wants to excel and for this reason he needs capital to buy a plot of land where he can build his own home and so improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a lot of land to build his home.

loans.name: Maximo

texts.en:
Maximo is married, with 4 children. Maximo is 60 years old and lives in Valconcha St Aguada, Ozamiz City.
To earn a living, Maximo has a boarding house business.  He has had this business for 8 years. Each month, he earns approximately PHP 20,000.  He has requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase equipment for his boarding house business.   Maximo has been a member of PMPC for 4 years.
In the future, Maximo hopes to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for his boarding house business

loans.name: Victor

texts.es: Víctor, de 41 años es un hombre trabajador. Se casó hace 10 años con, Hilda su esposa. Ambos tienen un hijo, Joel al que cuidan en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Pantipata. Su actividad económica se centra en la agricultura. La siembra de alverja, papa y maíz son los principales cultivos que tiene. En todo este tiempo pudo adquirir sus propios terrenos agrícolas; donde trabaja junto a su esposa. Además de compartir su tiempo en la crianza de toros, que engorda para luego venderlos a un mayor precio, ya tiene 4 ejemplares y desea para más adelante poseer más cantidad. “Obtengo buena ganancia en la crianza de estos animales”, comenta, “por ello quiero dedicar más tiempo a la ganadería”. Ahora espera paciente la época de lluvias para sembrar de nuevo. Él pertenece al grupo solidario “Tancar Puquio” y este es el quinto crédito con MFP, donde esta contenta, porque tendrá apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su trabajo. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación, porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Víctor de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de 4 a 5 toros para su negocio.
texts.en:
Víctor, 41, is a hardworking man.  He married Hilda, his wife, ten years ago.  They have a son, Joel, who they care for in their own house located in Pantipata hamlet.  He is a farmer.  His main crops are peas, potatoes and corn.  He managed in this time to acquire his own farmland where he works alongside his wife.  He also raises bulls that he fattens up to then sell at better prices.  He has four head of cattle and wants later on to have more.  “I earn good profits raising these animals,” he comments “that’s why I want to spend more time raising animals.”  He is currently patiently waiting for the rainy season to plant again.


He belongs to the “Tancar Puquio” communal bank and this is his fifth MFP loan.  He’s happy because he’ll have financial support so he feels surer that he’ll make progress with his work.  He commits to make his installment payments and he is pleased to be a member of his association because all the members are responsible, very mutually supportive people.  If Víctor were to receive your support, he’ll use the requested money to buy four or five bulls for his business.

loans.use: to buy five bulls.

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es: Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Generosidad, tiene 52 años, es madre D. 4 hijos, es dueña D. una Polleria. María es socia D. FINCA Peru desD. hace 6 años y le gusta el trabajo en unión que se da en su Banco Comunal, le encanta las capacitaciones porque le enseñan mucho a ahorrar, a ser responsable y puntual, gracias a los préstamos que sacó en Finca logró comprar varios utensilios D. diferentes modelos para su polleria, además le ayudó a cubrir los gastos D. salud cuando estaba mal. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra D. gaseosas y reparación D. su refrigeradora. Su meta es sacar adelante a sus hijos que aun no concluyen sus estudios superiores.
texts.en: María’s a member of the “Generosidad” communal bank.  She’s 52 years old and the mother of four children.  She owns a chicken restaurant.  María has been a FINCA Perú client for six years and she likes her communal bank’s teamwork.  She loves the training because they teach her how to save, to be responsible and to be punctual.  Thanks to the loans she got from Finca she managed to buy different brand utensils for her chicken shop and they also helped her cover medical expenses when she became ill.  The loan she requested will be used to buy soft-drinks and to repair her refrigerator.  Her goal is to move her children who have not yet completed higher education forward.

loans.use: to buy soft-drinks and to repair her refrigerator.

loans.name: Gulandom

texts.ru: Гуландом уже десять лет занимается торговлей. Она имеет торговую точку, где продает в оптом муку. Ей 46 лет. Она разведена. У нее двое детей. Гуландом берет кредит для покупки муки.
texts.en:
Gulandom has been engaged in trade for ten years. She has a store where wholesale flour is sold. She is 46 years old, divorced and has two children. 

Gulandom is taking a loan to buy flour.

loans.use: to purchase flour

loans.name: Ana Luisa

texts.es: Ana Luisa se dedica a la venta de comida, desde hace más de 6 años que tiene este medio de vida. Es una mujer luchadora y triunfadora que con el paso del tiempo ha logrado adquirir la experiencia necesaria. La mayoría de sus clientes se encuentran satisfechos con los diferentes platillos que ofrece. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de arroz, frijoles, aceite, refrescos, pan, bolsas, frutas entre otros.
texts.en:
Ana Luisa works selling food; she has had this means of earning a living for more than six years.  She is a hard-working and achieving woman, who with the passage of time has been able to acquire the necessary experience.  The majority of her customers are satisfied with the different dishes she offers for sale.  

The reason for the loan is to purchase rice, beans, oil, soda, bread, bags, and fruit among other things.

loans.use: to purchase rice, beans, oil, soda, bread, bags and fruit, among other things.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase "gari" (a cassava-based dough), fish, okra and tomatoes to sell

loans.name: San Rafael Group

texts.es:
El contacto para el inicio del presente comité fue la señora Jenny quién invito y organizo a sus amigas para formar parte del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras. Ellas son mujeres muy trabajadoras que desean poder salir adelante por medio del trabajo en conjunto de todas.
Jenny es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, ella tiene una pequeña despensa bien surtida, lo cual la ayuda a mantener su casa. Mediante su negocio y su arduo trabajo ha logrado salir adelante y seguir creciendo. Una de sus metas es poder seguir creciendo y aumentar su local, con lo que podrá seguir ganando un poco más de ingresos.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de bebidas, comestibles, lácteos, hortalizas, verduras y demás articulos de primera necesidad, con los cuales podrá abastecerse y cumplir con sus clientes.
texts.en:
Jenny was the contact person who started this group, having invited and organized her friends to become part of the “Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras” (Committee for Entrepreneurial Women).  They are very hardworking ladies who want to get ahead through their work as a team.

Jenny is a hardworking and enterprising woman.  She has a small, well-stocked grocery store, which helps to support her household.  She’s managed to get ahead and continue to grow her business though her hard work.  One of her goals is to continue growing her shop which will allow her to earn a bit more income.

She’s asking for this loan to buy drinks, food, milk products, fruits, vegetables, and other primary needs products so that she can stock her store and meet her customers’ demands.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Kuña Aty Group

texts.es:
El Comité Kuña Aty del programa Comité de Mujeres con un total de 13 mujeres de las cuales son todas amigas, vecinas y hasta parientes. Están en el tercer ciclo,  y comentan que cada una tiene su actividad respectiva, pero también hacen actividades en conjunto para poder fomentar su compañerismo.
Lorenza es una de las integrantes del grupo,  ella nos cuenta que tiene una modesta despensa, gracias a la cual ha podido sacar adelante a su familia  y cubrir los gastos de la casa.  Ella se define como una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora que siempre se esfuerza al máximo para poder ayudar a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de carnes, verduras, lácteos, bebidas y demás artículos de primera necesidad, con lo cual podrá surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
The “Kuña” committee of the Women’s Committee Program has a total of 13 women who are friends, neighbors and even relatives.  They are in the third cycle and they comment that each one of them has her own activity but they also conduct group activities to foster their companionship.

Lorenza is one of the group members.  She tells us that she has a modest grocery store thanks to which she’s been able to support her family and cover household expenses.  She defines herself as a very hardworking, enterprising person who always makes the maximum effort to be able to help her family.

She’s asking for the loan to buy meats, vegetables, dairy products, beverages and other basic staple items to stock her store.

loans.use: to buy meats, vegetables, dairy products, beverages and other articles.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Living in a rural area of the Cheung Prey district of Kampong Cham province, Sok is a 57 widowed mother of four children. To make a living, Sok has been farming rice and working for others for a fee for 37 years. The current business earns her about 46,000KHR per day to meet the family’s need. 
Sok has been with VisionFund for one cycle and now she is asking for a loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make more rice so as to better off her living’s condition.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Cleta

texts.en:
Cleta is 59 years old and married with seven children.

Cleta works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, etc.

Cleta has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 12 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Cleta aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, etc.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: A 43 years old experience traders, Mrs. Helen I. makes beverages available for people in her environment. To meet the demand of her customers, she needs $500.

loans.use: To buy more Beverages for sale

loans.name: Afi

texts.en:
Afi E. was born in 1972 in Dévémé. She is married and the mother of four. Her husband is a farmer who does not make a lot of money. This compelled Ms. E. into the corn trade. Although illiterate, she manages her business well and thus was able to repay her two previous loans without a problem. She is presently requesting a loan of $750 to stock enough corn in the hopes of selling it at a higher price during times of scarcity. She could then see clear to a good profit that will ensure her a degree of financial autonomy.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Née en 1972 à Dévémé, Madame E. Afi est mariée et mère de quatre (04) enfants. Son mari cultivateur ne possède pas un grand revenu, ce qui oblige Madame E. à se lancer dans le commerce de maïs. Analphabète, elle a une bonne gestion de ses activités ce qui lui a permis de solder ses deux précédents crédits sans incident. Elle sollicite un crédit de $750 pour stocker assez de maïs afin d’espérer le revendre plus cher en période de soudure et ainsi dégager beaucoup de revenus qui vont lui assurer une autonomie financière..

loans.use: To stock up on corn

loans.name: Diego Jorge

texts.en:
Diego is a 53-year-old native of Mérida, Yucatán. He is married and has four children: a son who is 27 and three daughters ages 25, 23, and 22. From an early age he has been active in business, a skill he learned from his dad. He left school at 15 to help him with his business. With much effort he was able to obtain a small storefront where he sells clothes and decorative framed art. His financial situation has prospered thanks to his dedication.

He is now in need of a loan of $925 for the repair and maintenance of his vehicle, an essential part of his business, for the transfer of merchandise and the delivery of large orders. Diego needs your help to continue working. He knows that with your support and his hard work he can take his business and his family further.

Translated from Spanish by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Diego tiene 53 años de edad, es originario de Mérida, Yucatán, esta casado y tiene cuatro hijos, un varón de 27 años, y 3 mujeres de 25, 23, y 22 años. Desde muy temprana edad, se dedica al comercio, ya que su papá le enseñó el oficio, abandonó sus estudios por ayudarle en su negocio desde que tenia 15 años, con mucho esfuerzo logró obtener un pequeño local donde vende ropa y cuadros decorativos, y ha visto prosperar su economía gracias a su dedicación.

Ahora necesita de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 925 dólares que utilizará en la reparación y mantenimiento de su vehiculo que es de gran necesidad en su negocio para el traslado de la mercancía, y para repartir grandes pedidos. Diego necesita de tu ayuda para poder continuar trabajando, él sabe que con tu apoyo y su trabajo podrá sacar adelante su negocio y su familia.

loans.use: Repair and maintenance of vehicle engine

loans.name: Valentina

texts.es:
Valentina lives with her two children who attend High School. Her husband has gone to Brazil to work in the clothing industry. Valentina has a grain mill business that brings in income for her family. She lives in the City of Alto Pasaje Maria Auxiliadora in the Villa Esperanza zone. She is requesting this loan to purchase grain (quinoa, corn, barley, etc.) in quintals, (a quintal is a 50 kg or 100 pound bag) for sale in the grocery stores in the cities of La Paz and El Alto. This will be her third loan through Impro. Her favorable payment record on her first two loans qualify her for a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer.

Valentina vive con sus dos hijos que estudian en la secundaria (high school); el esposo se fue a Brasil a trabajar de costurero. Valentina tiene una tienda de molino de cereales del cual genera ingresos para la manutención de su familia. Vive en la Ciudad de El Alto Pasaje Maria Auxiliadora Zona Villa Esperanza. El crédito que ahora solicita será para comprar cereales (quinua, maíz, cebada, etc.) por quintal( un quintal es una bolsa que pesa 50 kilogramos o 100 libras) para la comercialización en las tiendas de abarrotes de la ciudad de La Paz y El Alto. Este será el tercer crédito con Impro; los buenos antecedentes de pago en los dos primeros créditos le facultan para acceder a otro préstamo.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is a reliable client of LAPO who started her business in the year 2003. She hopes to be granted a loan of US$ 400 to enable her to expand her business and buy more provisions & food items for resale to her community.

Faith O. is 28 years old, married, and mother of 5 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She has been a LAPO client for 2 years.

loans.use: To buy more provisions & food items for resale

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lillian is a 45-year-old mother of four who lives in Vituka in Dar es Salaam. Lillian owns a shop and sells groceries as a wholesaler and a retailer. She sells maize flour, rice, wheat ,and beans.

She requests a loan of $750 to purchase more supplies to increase her business.

loans.use: Purchase supplies to sell

loans.name: Kemi

texts.en: Mrs. Kemi O. is 41 years old, married and has 4 children; she lives in Afromedia in Lagos state, Nigeria. She sells foodstuffs to people in her communities. She has been in this business since 2002 and needs a loan to buy more foodstuffs for sale.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs

loans.name: Gilda Sebastião

texts.pt:
Gilda Sebastião C. lives in Laulane. She is married with 4 children. She sells yogurt, cookies, and popcorn on foot. She entered the program March 14, 2007 with a loan of $130.00US and is currently on her 3rd loan cycle looking for $175.00US for 4 months. She orders her products from South Africa, and with this loan she wants to increase her inventory.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

Gilda Sebastião C., potadora do BI nº111282415Z,residente no bairro de Laulane , vive maritalmente mae de 4 filhos comerciante vende: yogurtes , palone bolachas pipocas e uma vendedora ambulante, entrou no programa a 14/03/07, tomando 3000 mt esta actualmente no 3º ciclo vai tomar o valor de 4000 mt a pagar em 4 meses ela trabalha na base de encomendas compra os produtos na Africa do sul com o valor quer aumentar o s produtos.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Petrona

texts.en:
Petrona M. is a thirty-eight-year-old woman married to Miguel Benitez. Together they have two young children in middle school. Her children help with the family business when possible, but Petrona always stresses the importance of school. Their family business is their store “Luz de Luna,” which means “Moonlight.” In her store she sells clothing, uniforms, shoes, and bags. The business is lucrative because children are always in need of uniforms and shoes for their various sports and club activities.
