To secure a sound future for her children and give them the greatest opportunities of education, she has worked hard to build her business. She is asking for a loan today to help her purchase more uniforms, bags, backpacks, and shoes.

loans.use: To buy uniforms, backpacks, and shoes.

loans.name: Xiomara Del Carmen

texts.es:
Mrs. Xiomara B. is a 37-year-old married mother of 4 who lives in the Laureles Sur settlement. Her husband is a gardener, but he does not generate enough income to cover all the family expenses. His wife, therefore, set up a mini market in their small home so that she could help move her family forward during the difficult times that the country is experiencing. Xiomara’s biggest sources of income are the ice cream and juices that she sells daily, with which she covers the household expenses. She and her husband wish to continue improving the family’s quality of life. Both parents’ incomes have allowed them to make repairs to their house to the best of their abilities, but they have not been able to finish the construction of the house due to lack of funds. For this reason, Xiomara is requesting a loan in order to build the back wall of their house, which is currently open and unsafe. She would like to close the back so that she may give her family more security and protect their belongings.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Xiomara tiene 37 años de edad, es casada, tiene 4 hijos pequeños, habita en el asentamiento de Laureles Sur. El esposo de la señora es Jardinero, siendo esta una actividad que no genera suficientes ingresos para cubrir todas las necesidades de esta familia, la señora empezó el negocio de una pulpería en su pequeña vivienda, para poder sacar adelante a su familia, ya que la manutención de sus hijos es costosa debido a lo duro que se encuentra la situación en el país. La mayor fuente de ingresos de este negocio es la venta de helados y refrescos naturales que a diario vende la señora, con lo cual hace frente a todos los gastos del día a día en su hogar. La señora junto a su esposo, desean ir mejorando la calidad de vida de su familia, ambos ingresos de estos padres les ha permitido ir mejorando las condiciones habitacionales de su vivienda, en base a sus posibilidades han ido acondicionando su vivienda, el cual no la tienen terminada debido a la falta de suficientes recursos. Es así que la señora solicita un préstamo para construir el muro de atrás de la vivienda, el cual se encuentra abierto e inseguro, por lo tanto la señora desea cerrarlo, ya que le dará mayor seguridad a su familia y cuidar así sus pertenecías.

loans.use: Buy construction materials to build the back wall of her house

loans.name: La Union Hace La Fuerza Group

texts.en:
Denise P. is the president of her Bank of Hope in the small community of Imbert, on the north coast of Puerto Plata. 28 years old, she is married with one child. Denise sells new clothing out of a small store, and takes pride in the fact that she sells good quality clothing. She attends a Baptist church in the area, and enjoys reading her Bible in her spare time. Her favorite foods are rice and chicken, but she also likes the “ducles” that people are famous for in the Dominican Republic. She hopes that one day she can buy a house and a car because it would make her life much easier.

This is the first loan that this community has applied for, and they are all very excited to improve and start their businesses. Many of the women in this bank are Haitian, and have come to the Dominican Republic in hopes of a better life and future. Esperanza hopes that every single one of these women will experience success and begin the process of lifting themselves out of poverty.

Oh behalf of this entire group, and Esperanza – thank you for your continued support and generosity!

loans.use: To invest in new clothing.

loans.name: Zaina's Food Vending Group

texts.en:
Zaina is 39 years old and is married woman with 2 children, ages 14 and 10 years old. Zaina owns a small food vendor store, which she started in 2003. Everyday, she works from 8am to 4pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $165 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Mwajabu, who has business dealing in food vending.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Vianey

texts.es:
Mrs Vianey is 31 years old, she only studied until 5th year of elementary school. She is married and a mother of three children. She lives downtown of Ticaraya of the district of Pomata in the province of Chucuito-Juli. She works in the agricultural industry and the commercialization of pigs, cattle and sheep. Her husband works in construction and when he has time he supports Vianey. At present she is a partner of Communal Bank Corazón Pampuyo. She decided to be a partner to be able to help in the economy of her home. With her first loan of $100 she started her own business, she bought 4 pigs, two big and two small ones; this way successively she has improved her income and was able to buy more pigs, sheep. With the loan of $350, which will be repaid over a period of 4 months, she will buy a bull to fatten up. In order to improve her knowledge on who to fatten the animals she is going to the institution Solaris Peru. Her vision is to have two capitals one for small cattle, and the other for big cattle. Now he is happy because her husband values her for her successful efforts.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Vianey tiene 31 años de edad, estudió hasta quinto de primaria es casada madre de tres hijos, domiciliada en el Centro Poblado de Ticaraya del distrito de Pomata de la provincia de Chucuito-Juli, se dedica a las actividades agropecuarias y comercialización del ganado porcino, vacuno y ovino. Su esposo se dedica a la actividad de construcción y cuando tiene tiempo la apoya. Actualmente es socia del Banco Comunal Corazón Pampuyo, decidió pertenecer par poder ayudar en la economia de su hogar, con su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, compro 4 chanchos dos grandes y dos pequeños para iniciar el negocio, así sucesivamente mejoro sus ingresos para comprar mas chanchos, ovejas.. Con el préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, el cual será pagado en 4 meses comprará un toro para el engorde. Ella para mejorar su engorde se viene capacitándose en el manejo de engorde en la institución Solaris Perú. Su visión es tener dos capitales uno para ganados menores, otro para ganados mayores. Ahora esta feliz porque su esposo le valora por sus esfuerzos logrados.

loans.use: Buy food for her cattle.

loans.name: Yet

texts.en:
Mrs. Yet S. is a farmer in the Sangkemeanchey Village, Siem Reap Province. She makes about US$1 per day. Mrs. Sameourn has twenty-nine years of experience in farming and has learned much from her parents who were also farmers. Her husband is a cook for weddings and other ceremonies in the area, earning about US$3 per day. Still, their combined income is not enough to cover the family’s expenses. Therefore, their two daughters work as cooks in a restaurant in Phnom Penh City to help pay for the schooling costs of their other two siblings. Now S. is asking for a loan of US$1,000 to purchase a motorcycle. This motorcycle will be used by her husband for taxi services as well as for family transportation. She hopes that the loan will help increase the family's income and reduce its transportation expenses.

* * * * About HKL * * * *

Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL) is one of Cambodia's largest and most successful microfinance institutions (MFIs). It is committed to helping its clients achieve their business goals by providing sound financial services, and thereby hopes to contribute to the social and economic development of Cambodia. HKL specifically targets women and poor families in order to help them achieve increased financial security and quality of life, by offering various credit programs and encouraging savings. In accordance with its mission and its commitment to operational and financial sustainability, HKL contributes part of its net profits every year to support social development in education and healthcare.

loans.use: Purchase of a motorcycle

loans.name: Thi Thanh's Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. N. Thi Thanh (ID Number 010012), 23 years old, has borrowed through the Kiva site once. This time, she would like T. borrow 4,704,000VND T. facilitate her sale of general goods. Mrs. Thanh and her husband conduct their sale everyday so it is easy for them T. repay the loan. Her group also consists of:
  • Mrs. T. Thi Thoa (ID Number 13010011), borrows 4,704,000VND T. invest in buying and selling general goods
  • Mrs. D. Thi Tham (ID Number 13010014), borrows 4,256,000VND T. invest in buying and selling general goods
  • Mrs. N. Thi Thu (ID Number 13010015), borrows 4,256,000VND T. invest in buying and selling general goods
  • Mrs. T. Thi Giang (ID Number 13010010), borrows 4,256,000VND T. invest in buying and selling general goods
  • The total amount requested is 1,325.00USD

    • Translated by Pham Yen Thanh, Kiva volunteer translator.

    Chị Nguyễn thị Thành năm nay 23 tuổi.MS 010012 ,chị đã vay vốn qua một chu kỳ vốn.Lần này chị vay mức 4.704000VND để buôn bán ,hàng ngày 2 vợ chồng chị đều đi chợ nên việc hoàn trả vốn rất tốt .
  • chị Trương thị Thoa MS13010011 vay mức 4.7040000 VND để đi chợ
  • chị Đào thị Thắm MS13010014 vay mức 4.256000 VND để đi chợ
  • chị Nguyễn thị Thư MS 13010015 vay mức 4.256000 VND để buôn bán
  • chị Tô thị Giang MS 13010010 vay mức 4.256000 VND để kinh doanh

loans.use: Selling general goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of clothing to keep operating her business

loans.name: Oisanam

texts.en:
A. Oisanam applied to MicroInvest in 2008 for the business development loan. She used the previous loan in order to improve her business terms because she was in a crisis situation. Thanks to the previous loan she improved the existing livestock business and started one more business in rice growing.

Now Mrs A. Oisanam applies to Kiva with a request for the business loan of 2800 STJ ($US825) for six months to purchase a pedigree bull.

loans.use: For pedigree bull purchasing.

loans.name: Nerida

texts.es: Nerida  acaba de cumplir 22 años, por el momento está conviviendo el con el padre de su hijo, nos dice que más adelante se casarán. En horas de la mañana, prepara los alimentos para sus hijos y esposo, y en horas de la tarde se dedica al negocio de la venta de verduras; primero, compra todo tipo de verduras a los agricultores, para después llevarlas al mercado una o dos veces por semana, con esta actividad lleva 5 años, esta vez que está llevando una carga completa de zanahorias al mercado de mayoristas de Tarma; este tipo de actividad le agrada mucho porque se siente muy independiente y colabora con los gastos de la casa.  La dificultad, es que cada vez que compra sus productos en la chacra los  transportistas cobran a sobre precio por saco, entonces esto le reduce su ganancia. El motivo de su esfuerzo y de su esposo, es que como familia, quieren tener su propia casa, porque hasta ahora siguen viviendo en la casa de su madre. Con el  dinero del préstamo piensa invertir en la compra de productos, con la finalidad de que esto le permita ganar mucho más, porque hasta ahora lo poco que invierte, le deja ganancia, por ello, tiene expectativas de invertir en mayor cantidad.
texts.en:
Nerida just turned 22 years old, and at the moment she is living her common law partner and father of her son. She says they plan on getting married. In the early mornings, she prepares means for her children and her husband, and in the afternoons she carries out vegetable sales. First she goes out and purchases all kinds of vegetables from farmers and then she sells them in the markets once or twice per week. She has been doing this for the last 5 years. This time she has a full load of carrots to take to the wholesale market in Tarma. She loves doing this kind of work because she feels very independent and she likes to contribute towards the household expenses. The difficulties lie in that each time she purchases her products the transport she takes charges her extra for every sack, and this reduces her overall earnings. The reason why she and her husband work so hard, is that they as a family would like to have their own house. They are currently living in her mother's home. With the funds from this loan she will invest in the purchase of products with the goal of having greater earnings. Until now, the little bit that she invests is the little bit that she earns. And so she needs to invest in greater quantities.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the purchase of vegetables to farmers, and to resell in the markets.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy lives in Agbara, Lagos State, Nigeria, Joy is 28 years old and married with two children. Joy is very happy because the festive season is fast approaching and the demand for her clothes will be high. Joy is a LAPO Microfinance client. She is requesting a loan amount of N100,000 ($850 USD) to purchase more clothes to sell. She says thank you to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Mariamu

texts.en:
Mambo (greetings) from Tanzania! This is Mariamu M., a 39-year-old woman from Mwanza. She is married and has four children, who are between the ages of 3 and 15 years old.

Mariamu has been running a tailoring business since 2006. She purchases vitambaa (materials), vitenge, and kanga (printed cotton fabrics, which often have a border along all four sides), and she makes them into clothing, primarily for women. She works at her business 8 hours per day and 6 days per week. By doing so, Mariamu is able to earn approximately $120 per month from her business operations. She is now requesting a loan in the amount of $425 in order to purchase three sewing machines. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Mariamu thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA: SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback micro-finance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are not considered to be credit-worthy by financial institutions because they lack tangible assets that can serve as collateral. As such, low income women in Tanzania typically receive poor financial support and in turn only limited access to basic needs and services. Fortunately, SELFINA has been a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women in Tanzania. Simply put, SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women through an arrangement called a sale and leaseback transaction. More specifically, when a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extends a loan to her to facilitate the transaction, and then leases the equipment back to her. As such, one of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use their equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing three sewing machines

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.es:
Desde muy jovencita, en el municipio de Nagarote de la ciudad de León, la señora Erlinda C. se ha dedicado a su negocio de elaboración y venta de tortillas las cuales son elaboradas por ella misma en su casa de habitación donde las comercializa. 

Actualmente ella atraviesa la necesidad de continuar con la elaboracion de las tortillas pero por sus escasos recursos ha tenido dificultades por lo que muy sabiamente ella ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito que le permita la compra de la materia prima para continuar elaborando las mejores tortillas del municipio de Nagarote en la ciudad de León.
texts.en:
In the Nagarote Municipality in the city of León, Señora Erlinda C. has been making homemade tortillas since she was very young. She makes, cooks, and sells the tortillas from her own home.

Señora Erlinda needs to continue making her tortillas, but has had difficulties due to her lack of economic resources. So she wisely came to Ceprodel and requested a loan so that she can continue to buy the ingredients she needs to make the best tortillas in all of Nagarote Municipality.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients to make tortillas

loans.name: Antoinette

texts.fr: Agée de 38 ans,dame H. Antoinette est originaire de Ganvié, village lacustre. Elle a trois enfants: Rosaline,Casimir, et Simplice.  Elle n'a jamais été à l'école et n'a apprit aucun métier.Mais,elle fut initiée à la vente de poissons frais par sa tutrice dans son adolescence.C'est cela qu'elle fit jusqu'à se marier.Il y a 5 ans,elle a diversifié son activité avec la vente de nourriture(riz, et pâte de maïs accompagnés de sauce).Actuellement,elle veut renforcer  cette dernière activité pour mieux satisfaire la demande  de sa clientèle.Elle compte s'approvisionner en riz, maïs  et gari.
texts.en:
Ms. Antoinette H., age 38, is from the lakeside village of Ganvié and has three children: Rosaline, Casimir, and Simplice. She never attended school nor learned a trade. But as an adolescent, she was initiated by her tutor in how to sell fresh fish. She did this until she got married. Five years ago, she diversified her business by selling prepared foods (rice; corn mash with sauce). Presently she wants to bolster her business to satisfy the demands of her customers better. She plans to gets supplies of rice, corn, and gari (cassava flour).

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: 2 sacks of rice, 1 sack of corn, and 60 measures of gari

loans.name: Debora

texts.en:
Debora has owned a small shop in the Usariver neighborhood of Arusha for 8 years.She belongs to Magadirisho "A" (group code 2001) loan group. She currently makes an average monthly profit of $350. Every day she works at her business from 7:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m.  She is requesting loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more items for her business. She is hopping that through this loan, her profits will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  

Debora is 31 years old, married, and has four children who age between 4 and 16 years.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.vi:
Chị Hoa 27 tuổi là thành viên của Quỹ Tình thương từ năm 2002. Ban đầu chị vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn, đến nay sau 7 năm tham gia Quỹ với việc  sử dụng vốn vay hiệu quả hiện tại chị đã là chủ  một trang trại chuyên chăn nuôi trâu và trồng chanh với thu nhập 4.500.000đ/ tháng. Bên cạnh đó hàng tháng gia đình chị còn có thêm nguồn thu từ lương xây dựng của chồng 2.000.000đ/ tháng
Vòng vốn tới chị Hoa mong muốn được vay 15.000.000đ để đầu tư mua  thêm trâu về nuôi
texts.en:
Ms. Hoa is 27 yrs old and has been a member with TYM fund since 2002. At the beginning, she borrowed money to invest in raising pigs. After 7 years with TYM fund, she is now the owner of a ranch specializing in raising buffaloes, and growing lemon trees, with income of 262 USD per month. In addition, her family has another source of income from her husband's construction job of 115 USD month. For her next loan, she wishes to borrow 875 USD to purchase additional buffaloes to raise

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising animals

loans.name: Tileneya. Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  Tileneya, constitué de  4 femmes mariées   avec une moyenne d’âge de 28ans ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogames à Ouayerma un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative de la république du Mali. .
Elles mènent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres la vente du bois de chauffe, du poisson et des médicaments.  
Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.
Avec ce  prêt, elles comptent acheter, 1 chargement de camionnette en bois de chauffe, 20 kg de poissons et 3 paquets de médicaments. Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de Sikasso ville et les localités avoisinantes. 
Les marchandises sont vendues, la plupart au comptant, de façon ambulante dans les quartiers, dans la famille ou sur commande et au marché de ouayerma, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes..
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 15.000FCFA dont une partie sera investie dans les activités et l’autre partie en épargne.
texts.en:
The Tileneya group, made up of 4 married women, with an average age of 28, have an average of 3 children. They mostly live in monogamous families in Ouayerma, one of the districts of the town of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali).

They have various activities, among others selling firewood, fish, and medicines. It is their first time working together with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with a goal of satisfying the needs of their clientele.

With this loan, they intend to buy one truckload of firewood, 20 kg of fish, and 3 packages of medicines. They buy their supplies in the big market of the town of Sikasso and in surrounding localities. The merchandise is sold mostly for cash, door-to-door in the neighborhoods, in their families, on order and in the market of Ouayerma, to a clientele composed of men and women. They each expect to make an average monthly profit of 15,000 F CFA of which part will be used for their businesses and the rest saved.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of various articles for re-sale

loans.name: Obidjon

texts.ru: Обидчон - мужчина 39 лет, который уже четвёртый год кредитуется в Микроинвест.Он закупает в Бишкеке товар и продаёт на рынках города Худжанда.В основном его товар состоит и товаров из меха и кожи, но т.к. сейчас не сезон этих товаров, он хочет пополнить весенний ассортимент мужской одежды.У него пока маловато весеннего ассортимента сорочек.Обидчону во время его отсутствия помогает торговать его жена, которая благодарна инвесторам за финансирование и доверие.
texts.en:
Obidjon is a 39-year-old man, who has been a loan customer of MicroInvest for four years. He buys goods in Bishkek and sells them in the Khujand city markets. Generally he carries fur and leather products, but since it is not the season for such goods, he wants to expand his assortment of men's clothing for spring. At present he does not have enough men's shirts. When Obidjon is away, his wife takes over the selling, and she is grateful to the investors for their trust and funding.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of leather jackets and men's clothing

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en:
X. Nguyễn Thị (205950774) is a 52-year-old woman living in the town of Sóc Sơn. She is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, X. owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising cattle for sale. X. has been engaged in this business for over 30 years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 1995, X. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. X. has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. X. is now requesting a new loan of 15,000,000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business. The loan will be her 12th loan taken out from TYM Fund. X. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Musharraf

texts.en:
J. Musharraf is 47 years old. She is married with two children. Musharraf is a devoted mother that struggles day after day to provide the best for her family. Fifteen years ago, she got the idea to start raising cattle to contribute to the family finances--taking advantage of the space she had available in her house for this business. Her son helps her with the business. With an endless list of requests, she has finally decided to increase the number of animals she keeps and for this reason she is requesting a loan of $800 USD.
Be an important part of the growth of Musharraf’s business!

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:
Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its epic mountain passes and its rich history which includes its place as a key post along the Silk Road and events at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has produced famous thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural productivity and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent viable business prospects. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
The woman pictured here is Rehana, a daughter of A.. She is a resident of Kabul, Afghanistan, and currently lives in the 12th district. She is married with 4 children, two daughters and two sons. All of them are students.

Rehana wants to assist her husband in his general store. They have a shared business and they would like to support each other in their daily life. Rehana requested this loan for 40,000 Afghani so she can advance the business by purchasing necessary materials and items that are in high demand from customers. She is thankful to the Kiva lenders for the worldwide support.

loans.use: To buy materials for her store

loans.name: Kalisizo South Nabufu Eva Group

texts.en: N. Eva is 40 years old and the single mother of three children, who are all schooling. For 14 years, she has operated a grocery business. She is using the loan for adding capital to her business by purchasing grocery items such as tomatoes, onions, Irish potatoes, yams, etc., to sell to her customers. She is an active businesswoman whose dream is to educate her children and construct a house.

loans.use: Purchasing grocery items such as tomatoes, onions, Irish potatoes, yams, etc., to sell to her customers

loans.name: Kafule B Sabika Catherine Group

texts.en: The leader of this group is 43-year-old S. Catherine. She is blessed with five children and also looks after one dependant who is in school. For 20 years, Catherine has dealt in bananas, purchasing them from villages and selling them in the town. She is using her loan to purchase bananas from the villages in much greater volume than she could previously. Catherine is an open-minded, hardworking businesswoman. Her dream is to obtain poultry to generate a side income.

loans.use: To purchase bananas in bulk

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth D. is from the village of Canibungan Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 42 years old, is married, and has four adult children. Elizabeth owns and operates a business raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting corn for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month. In 2004, Elizabeth joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. Elizabeth is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 16th from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Compra de materia prima para elaboración de alimentos.

loans.name: Madeleine

texts.fr: K. Madeleine est née en 1980. Madeleine est mariée et mère de trois enfants. Madeleine fut placée très tôt auprès d’une parente qui l'envoya en apprentissage de couture. Madeleine a fini sa formation et reçut son diplôme. Parallèlement à la couture, Madeleine faisait le commerce d'huile rouge, ensuite de tissus. Mais, l’activité principale de Madeleine aujourd'hui est la vente de tissus. En effet, Madeleine vend de façon ambulante ses tissus. Pour augmenter le volume de ses articles, Madeleine sollicite l’appui financier d’ALIDé.
texts.en:
K. Madeleine was born in 1980. She is married and the mother of three children. Very early on, she was placed with a parent who entered her into a sewing apprenticeship. Madeleine finished her training and received her certificate. Along with sewing, she used to have a business selling red palm oil, and then cloth after that. But her main business today involves selling cloth. Essentially, she hawks fabrics. To increase the volume of her goods, she’s requesting financial support from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ten 12-meter bolts of Hitarget cloth

loans.name: Emeliana

texts.en:
Emeliana T. is from the village of Mialem. She is 59 years old. Emeliana is married and has 5 adult-aged children.

To make a living, Emeliana owns and operates a sand & gravel retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling sand & gravel in the local community. Emeliana has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Emeliana joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emeliana has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Emeliana is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Emeliana from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Leycith

texts.es:
Leycith es una mujer que tiene 47 años, vive feliz con sus 3 preciosos hijos: Juan Carlos de 14 años, Charol de 13, y Daniel de 5 años. También cuenta con la compañía de su esposo (Amílcar), de 50 años, en una acogedora casa de un tranquilo barrio al norte de la ciudad de Lima.
Ella se dedica a la venta de lencería para damas, desde hace dos años, cuando descubrió lo rentable que era este negocio; ya que siempre son necesarias y muy buscadas las prendas interiores de buena calidad a un bajo precio. Muchas veces le hacen pedidos y en otras oportunidades ella misma compra la mercadería a su gusto y luego la vende a sus amistades y vecinos. 

A Leycith le gusta vender lencería porque se siente identificada con el rubro, ya que es mujer y sabe las necesidades femeninas. Adicionalmente, trabaja también en la preparación de comida en un comedor popular de su distrito, ya que esta actividad le favorece en el ahorro de los gastos de su hogar. 

Para el futuro le agradaría tener una tienda de ropa interior femenina en un mercado de alguna zona concurrida cerca de su casa.

Este es su tercer préstamo con  MFP y promete ser puntual, como siempre, en cada pago. Además se lleva bien con todas las integrantes de su banco comunal porque son amigas suyas y las conoce muy bien. Leycith piensa invertir el dinero que solicita en mercadería para lograr tener capital y así lograr tener un puesto en el mercado.
texts.en:
Leycith is a 47-year old woman who lives happily with her 3 beautiful children: Juan Carlos, who is 14 years old, Charol, who is 13, and 5-year old Daniel. She also has the company of her husband (Amilcar), 50, in a cozy house in a quiet suburb north of Lima. Two years ago she discovered that the sale of lingerie for women is very profitable, given that these items are always necessary and many people look to buy good quality undergarments at a low price. Ever since that time she has been engaged in this business. Many times she takes orders, but other times she just buys merchandise to her liking and later sells it to friends and neighbors. Leycith likes to sell lingerie because she can identify with the products, since she is a woman and knows what women need. She also works preparing food in a popular eatery in her district, since through this activity she can save to pay for household expenses. In the future she would like to have a lingerie shop in a busy market area located close to her home. This is her third loan from MFP, and she is committed to be punctual, as always, in her payments. In addition she gets along well with all of the members of her communal bank because they are friends of hers that she knows well. Leycith is going to invest the money that she is requesting in merchandise so that she can build up her capital and in this way acquire a stall in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase merchandise

loans.name: Judy

texts.en:
Judy G., 30 years old, grows vegetables and sells different kinds of fruits and vegetables in her village. She is married to Nelson G., also 30 years old, who works as a farmer in their village. Judy and Nelson are gifted with one child named Jonel. 

Judy plants vegetables in her fields and backyard for both subsistence and business. Judy also buys fruits and vegetables in different villages that have vegetable farms. She buys it wholesale and then sells it to different vendors in public markets. Her business needs major capital because when she goes to different villages, she rents a car to purchase vegetables and go to the market.

She is requesting Php 5,000 for additional capital to buy more kinds of fruits and vegetables to sell. She wants to maintain her business as her main source of income. She is giving her full time and effort in her fruits and vegetable farming and vending business because she believes that God will make a way to make her become successful.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables and fruits to sell

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna and her husband help each other to earn a living for the sake of their children's future. They work really hard to finance the education of their beloved children because they want them to be employed and become successful. They endure hardship and difficulties, hoping that their efforts will bear good fruit.

Lorna's husband cultivates their farm twice a year by planting rice and vegetables, while Lorna is engaged in hog raising to help her husband earn extra income. They want to improve their piggery and increase their crop production, therefore Lorna wants to borrow 15,000 PHP to acquire agricultural supplies to achieve these objectives. They believe that their business will be successful through their patience and hard work.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural supplies to increase crop production and improve piggery

loans.name: Martha Cecilia

texts.es:
La Señora Martha Cecilia B. es una pequeña vendedora de productos varios, su pulpería o ventecita se encuentra ubicada en la parte este de la capital de Nicaragua. Tiene 19 años de tener el negocio, cuyo monto de inversión inicial fue de C$ 200,000 córdobas que le regaló su hijo, cuando la moneda estaba devaluada en los años ochenta. Las condiciones del negocio en ese entonces era precaria en una mesita de madera donde vendía frutas y verduras, la tenía en el porche de la casa.

Ella tiene 55 años de edad, nos comenta que los precios actuales de algunos productos de su negocio son los siguientes: el frescos cuesta C$ 6, pan dulce C$1, sándwich C$8, platos descartables C$15, Papel de regalo C$3. Actualmente el negocio tiene su propio espacio en la casa, de piso, con buen techo en un área aproximada de 9 metros cuadrados, como activo fijo tiene una mantenedora, 2 vitrinas y una mesa donde coloca el pan.

Ella es una señora casada, no tiene persona a su cargo, su esposo es jubilado, y nos expresa que antes de tener el negocio ella lavaba y planchaba ropa. 
Ella espera crear un buen record crediticio en nuestra institución y está agradecida con CEPRODEL, ya que este préstamo le ha permitido surtir su negocio el cual tenía mucho tiempo de no invertirle y dice “Mi Negocio Ahora Está Bonito”.
texts.en:
Señora Martha Cecilia B. has a small business selling various products. Her store is located in the eastern part of the capital of Nicaragua. She has had her business for 19 years, and she started it with an initial investment of 200,000 córdobas that her son gave her when the currency was devalued in the 1980s. Her business conditions were unstable then, and she sold fruits and vegetables from a little table that she had on the porch of her home.

She is 55, and she tells us that the current prices for some of the products in her business are as follows: juices are 6 córdobas, bread is 1 córdoba, a sandwich is 8 córdobas, disposable plates are 15 córdobas, and wrapping paper is 3 córdobas. Currently her business has its own place in her home with a good roof. The area is approximately 9 square meters. She has one refrigerator, two display cases, and a table where she puts bread.

She is a married woman and doesn't have any dependents. Her husband is retired. She told us that she used to have a business washing and ironing clothing.

She hopes to have a good credit record with our institution, and she is thankful to Ceprofel since this loan has let her stock her business that she hasn't invested in for some time. She says, "Now my business is lovely."

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise like:  disposable plates, soft drinks, yogurt, toilet paper, juice, bread, sandwiches, wrapping paper, etc.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is thirty–eight years old. She has no children and lives with her husband in a rented apartment in Axim. Axim is along the coast in the western region of Ghana and the major occupation of people in this area is fishing businesses.

Hannah is a seamstress by profession and has three apprentices who are currently in training. She wants a loan to buy many kinds of fabrics and other sewing accessories to be able to better serve her clients. In addition, Hannah also sells provisions on a table top in front of her workshop. She has been in business for eight years.

loans.use: To buy fabrics and sewing accessories

loans.name: Mrs. Chhang Vanna Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank consists of 16 people who live in Dak Por village in Takeo province. All the members will use the loan that they have obtained for different purposes. Mrs. C. Vanna is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a farmer who owns a small field on which she cultivates rice for a living. Her husband, Mr. Bil Chantha, is a construction worker who can earn a small income to support the family. Although they try to work hard, they still do not earn enough income to support the family, so Mrs. C. Vanna decided to ask for a loan to buy more rice to keep in stock to resell at a better price. Mrs. C. Vanna is a mother of five children, one of whom is a garment worker, while three of the others are attending the local school and the youngest one, at the age of five, is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy more rice to keep in stock to resell at a better price

loans.name: Nyeupe Group

texts.en:
Mambo! Greetings from Tanzania.

Meet Bakari A. and the Nyeupe group from Dar es Salaam. The group's name means "white" in Kiswahili. Bakari is a 44-year-old father of two, aged 23 and 2. He is married and has been running a business selling livestock for three years in the Mlandizi district of Dar es Salaam. Bakari sells live chickens and goats from 6:45 am to 6 pm daily. He makes approximately $150 per month. 

This is Bakari's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, Ltd. He used the first loan to buy cement to make blocks because he is building a small house. He also used it for "kilimo" (agriculture) to grow "mpunga" (rice). Bakari will use this loan to buy cement to make more blocks, to continue growing rice, and to purchase more live chickens for his business.

In the photo, Bakari is sitting in the front row toward the left, wearing glasses. He will share this loan with the members of his group. They will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan on time. The Nyeupe group from Tanzania thanks you for your support!

loans.use: chickens, cement for blocks, and agricultural inputs to grow rice

loans.name: Benito

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Benito S. le esta haciendo falta reparar el techo ya que esta en muy malas condiciones. 
Solicita el préstamo para poder comprar el material y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de rapare el techo ya que tiene miedo que les pueda pasar algo a su familia.
Don Benito trabaja para una agencia aduanal en el departamento  de administración, con una parte de este ingreso planea pagar el crédito.
El señor Benito ya ha tenido tres préstamos con FVP los cuales ha pagado puntual mente.  
Las personas que aparecen en la foto es una de las hijas del señor y sus nietos quienes viven en la casa, ya que el señor Benito se encontraba en su trabajo el día de la visita.
texts.en:
The roof of Benito S.’s house needs repair because it is in very bad condition. He is asking for a loan to be able to buy the material and pay the person to make the repairs because he is afraid that something could happen to his family. Benito works for a customs agency in the administration department. He plans on using part of his earnings to pay the loan. Benito has had three loans with FVP, which he has paid back punctually. The people in the photo are one of his daughters and his grandchildren, who live in his house. Benito was working on the day of the visit.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Remodel the roof

loans.name: Srei

texts.en: Mrs. Srei T. is a 27-year-old villager who lives in Si Sla village in Takeo province.  She and her husband, Mr. Vutha Som, are farmers who own a small piece of land to grow rice. Aside from farming, they breed ducks for the eggs, which provides a small income to support their family. Mrs. Srei T. is requesting 2,000,000 Riels to buy 200 ducklings to breed. She hopes to increase her income to improve her family's living conditions with this loan. The couple has two children who are students in the public school.

loans.use: To buy 200 more ducklings

loans.name: Fidaa

texts.en:
Fidaa is a 40-year-old married woman and mother of 4 school-aged children. In 2005, she opened an accessories and make-up shop in her town after seeing a need for such services in the region. Her business developed automatically and she has started distributing her products to beauty salons and making a good profit. 

Today, Fidaa is requesting to borrow US$ 1,200 to buy the latest collections of products and accessories for the new summer season so as to be always up-to-date with the market.

loans.use: buy the latest collections of products and accessories

loans.name: Jessie's Group

texts.en:
Jessie T. is from the city of Biray, Ozamiz City. She is 38 years old and is the group leader of a six-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Jessie is single. She owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products like soft drinks, rice, sugar, shampoo, etc., in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Jessie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her first from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from his business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Nilukshi

texts.en:
Nilukshi is a 26-year-old married woman living in Panadagama, Akurassa, with her husband and one child.

Nilukshi has a business selling grocery items and her husband is also a partner in her business. They started this business in 2008. When her husband goes to buy grocery items for the shop, she works at the shop.

Nilukshi has asked for a 30,000 LKR loan from BRAC Sri Lanka in order to further develop her grocery business.

Nilukshi is honest and careful in the business. She hopes to provide a nutritious diet to her family through the additional income from her business.

loans.use: To develop her grocery business

loans.name: Beneranda

texts.es:
Beneranda tiene 50 años D. edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo en el distrito D. Santa Rosa, una zona cuya economía depenD. principalmente D. la pesca, se encuentra ubicada a 25 minutos D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Se dedica desD. hace mas D. diez años a confeccionar artesanalmente paños, fundas y fajas, ella confecciona los productos por pedidos y debido a la calidad con la que los diseña ya se ha vuelto conocida en el rubro, actualmente tiene un grupo D. clientes fijos que recurren a solicitar sus servicios, las prendas que confecciona son utilizadas por los lugareños en diversas fiestas y reuniones sociales.

Beneranda nos comenta que esta actividad le ha permitido ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento D. la economía familiar ya que, como pescador, el no percibe ingresos D. manera pemanente debido a las continuas temporadas D. veda.

Ella desea ampliar su negocio con la compra D. mas materiales (hilos y telas) con los cuales pueda ampliar su producción y percibir ingresos adicionales por ello se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles que le permitan realizar su objetivo.

Beneranda es una madre bastante trabajadora y que siempre ha luchado por sacar adelante a los suyos, en la zona donD. vive sus vecinos y conocidos la consideran una mujer responsable y D. confianza. En la fotografía nos muestra un paño recientemente bordado.
texts.en:
Beneranda, 50, is married and lives with her husband in Santa Rosa district, primarily a fishing area, located about 25 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For over ten years she has maD. woven crafts like wraps, scarfs and belts to order. Thanks to the high quality of her items she has become very well-known in the field and currently has a group of regular customers that repeatedly come by to ask for her services. Locals wear her items during social reunions and various fiestas. Beneranda tells us that this activity has helped her husband support the family because, as a fisherman, his earnings aren’t steady because of the continuous seasonal fishing bans. She wants to expand her business buying more fabric and threads so that production and earnings will grow. She is asking for her first, 1000 new sol, loan from Edpyme Alternativa to reach this goal. Beneranda is quite a hard-working mother who has always struggled to get her family ahead. In her neighborhood she is well known and her neighbors consider her to be responsible and trustworthy. In the photo she shows us a recently-completed embroidered scarf.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites A. is from the village of Northern Poblacion. She is 41 years old, married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Marites owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs to sell. Marites has been engaged in her business for over nine years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Marites joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marites has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as payment for her son's tuition fee. Marites is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for hog raising. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Marites from PMPC. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for hog raising

loans.name: Tuan

texts.en:
Tuan A. L. was born in 1975. He is married and has two children, a 5-year old daughter and a 2-year old son. 

Tuan A. owns and runs a Gas shop. His wife is a worker in Thang Long Industrial Park. Together, they have a monthly income of about 5,000,000 Vietnam Dong (VND). 

Tuan A. has participated in SEDA since 2009 and has repaid punctually. In this loan cycL., he wants to borrow 5,450,000 VND in order to expand his Gas shop.

loans.use: To expand his Gas shop.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 32 years old and is married with two children, 2 and 5 years old. His eldest child is currently attending school.

John is a farmer from Litein town in Rift Valley, Kenya, where he has been farming for ten years. His products are milk, which he sells to the tea estate, and tea, which he sells to Kenya Tea Development Authority. Before venturing into farming, he was operating a retail shop in the same area.

John’s major challenges in farming are a water problem, lack of enough dairy feeds, and lack of enough knowledge in regards to animal diseases.

John has requested this Kes 40,000 loan from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. This loan will help his family acquire an additional asset and increase their sources of income. The extra income will enable him to meet his family’s needs.

In future, John would like to acquire five high-yielding dairy cows and increase his production of milk from the current twelve liters to fifty liters daily.

John is grateful to Juhudi for the assistance and plans to request more loans in future.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Urunani Ii Group

texts.fr:
Aurea M. est une commerçante âgée de 45ans qui habite la Commune de Rugombo en Province Cibitoke  à l’Ouest du Burundi. Elle fait le commerce de haricots depuis quatre ans au Marché de Rugombo.Elle était cultivatrice avant de commencer cette activité commerciale. Elle a fait ses études jusqu’en 3e année primaire. Son mari, Léon Wereshi, est un cultivateur. Elle arrivait au 6e cycle dans le crédit communautaire avec Turame, mais maintenant elle commence le crédit solidaire. 

Elle est mère de 4enfants ; 2 garçons et 2 filles âgés de 18ans, 15 ans, 13 ans et de 9ans. Tous ses enfants étudient. 

Elle demande le crédit Kiva pour  diversifier les produits vivriers comme le riz et le maïs en plus du haricot qu’elle achète pour revendre aux clients. Elle a l’espoir qu’avec le crédit de Turame, elle  sera à mesure de supporter les frais de scolarité de ses enfants et acheter une parcelle pour construire sa propre maison. 

 Elle est une des membres du groupe  solidaire « Urunani II »
texts.en:
Aurea M. is a 45-year-old merchant who lives in Rugombo Commune in Cibitoke Province, in western Burundi. She has been doing commerce in beans for four years at the Rugombo Market. She was a farmer before starting this business. She reached year 3 of primary school education. Her husband, Léon Wereshi, is a farmer. Aurea was coming to the sixth communal loan cycle with Turame but is now going with solidarity loans. She is a mother of four children: two boys and two girls, aged 18, 15, 13, and 9. The children are all students. She is asking for a Kiva loan to diversify her staple foods, such as rice and corn, in addition to beans, which she purchases for resale to customers. With the Turame loan, she hopes to be able to support her children's schooling costs and to purchase a parcel of land for building her own house. She is a member of the solidarity group "Urunani II".

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Diversifying her staple foods to be sold to customers

loans.name: Set's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Set P. is 63 years old and is the group leader, having been selected by its four members located in Koh Chamroeun village, Kandal province. Each member of this group loan will use it to buy equipment, supplies and other items to support their different purposes. 

Mrs. Set P. and her husband are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate vegetable for a living. With this farm, they are also working very hard to support their family living. For this farm, Mrs. Set P. will use the loan that he has requested from AMK to buy fertilizer and pesticide to help cultivate rice. This couple has a child who is a seamstress in a garment factory.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.name: Melvie

texts.en:
Melvie G. is from the village of Dolores, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 32 years old. Melvie is married and has one infant. To make a living, Melvie owns and operates a retail clothing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing general clothing services to local community members. Melvie is just starting this business.

In 2007, Melvie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Melvie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Melvie is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Melvie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Suon

texts.en: Mr. Suon C. is highly skilled at building stone and wooden houses. He has a few physical laborers to help provide his service. He receives a lot of orders from his clients to construct their houses. He has another partner in his wife, who sells grocery inventories from home. Suon C. has two children who are students and dependent upon him. Suon C. sees that selling groceries is a profitable business for his family and he hopes to expand this activity. Thus, he is requesting this loan for his wife to accumulate a large quantity of inventory for their grocery store.

loans.use: To accumulate a large quantity of inventory for grocery store.

loans.name: Librado

texts.en:
Librado D. is from the village of Tigdok, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. He is 50 years old and married with two school-aged children. Librado owns and operates a fishing business. The main source of income for the business comes from harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Librado has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Librado joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Librado is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. This will be his first loan from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to supplement his family's income.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets

loans.name: El Arca Group

texts.es:
El grupo el Arca está con formado por tres mujeres trabajadoras y esforzadas  una de ellas es Rosa Emilia L. quien comercializa tropigas desde hace 20 años y desea aumentar su negocio.

Las otras integrantes del grupo son Rosa Argentina Caldera tiene un pequeño restaurante y Fátima del Rosario L. comercializa cosméticos, calcomanías y premios.
texts.en:
The Arca group is comprised of three hard-working and dedicated women. Rosa Emilia L. is one of them. She has been selling propane tanks for 20 years, and she wants to expand her business. Rosa Argentina Caldera, also a member, has a small restaurant. Fátima del Rosario L. is the third member. She sells cosmetics, stickers, and prizes.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy gas

loans.name: Silvio

texts.es: El señor Silvio G. B., tiene la edad de 40 años, con su esposa y sus 4 hijos menores  de edad, habitan en el barrio Laureles Sur, su esposa realiza las tareas del hogar y atiende una pequeña miscelánea en el porche de su casa, el señor G. labora como Guarda de Seguridad desde hace mas de 9 años aportando a la economía del hogar, el es un hombre humilde que a lo largo de su vida a tenido trabajos como jardinero, multiservicios domésticos y vigilante, por sus recursos económicos, habitan en una vivienda humilde, y es para su hogar que solicita un préstamo para la compra de zinc y perlines que le permitan entechar su hogar, puesto que con las fuertes lluvias de invierno y las tormentas que han golpeado al país, ha deteriorado la infraestructura amenazando con la salud y seguridad a sus hijos, seria para él de gran satisfacción resguardar a su familia en un lugar digno de habitar.
texts.en: Mr. Silvio G. B. is 40, and lives with his wife and 4 young children in the Laureles Sur neighborhood.  His wife is a housewife and takes are of the small convenience store that they have on the porch of their house.  For more than 9 years Mr. G. has been working as a security guard to support the family.  He is a humble person who has worked as a gardener, guard and doing work around houses.  Since he doesn’t make much money, they live in a simple house, and this is why he is requesting a loan.  He wants to buy sheets of zinc and beams so that he can put a new roof on his house. The heavy winter rains and the storms that have hit his country have weakened the structure and are threatening the health and security of his children. It will give him great satisfaction to assure that his family has a good place to live.

loans.use: To change the roof on his house

loans.name: Froiphe

texts.en: Froiphe P. is from the village of Cagay-anon, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 19 years old. Froiphe is single. To make a living, Froiphe operates a motorcycle/tricycle transport service. Froiphe has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 8,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Froiphe joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Froiphe has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Froiphe is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. This will be the second loan taken out by Froiphe from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase tires and other accessories

loans.name: Resty

texts.en:
Resty N. is 20 years old and lives in the town of Wobulezi in the Luweero region of Uganda. She is married and has three children. All of her children are currently in school. Resty has a business of a salon, which she has had for six years.         

To help expand her business, Resty has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase braids and treatment oil. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Resty hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself.  

In the future, Resty hopes to own a motorcycle. Resty is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her standards of living.

loans.use: Braids, treatment oil

loans.name: Sros

texts.en:
Mr. Sros S. (pictured above) and his wife, Mrs. Sithorn Bang, live in a suburb of Phnom Penh, about 20 kilometers away from the capital. They have three children--two sons and one daughter. Both sons are in school and the daughter is married and lives outside the family home.  

Sros has full-time employment, and his wife is a garment factory worker. He is asking for his first loan of US$ 1,000 to pay school fees for his son who is attending university.

loans.use: To pay school fees for his son who is attending university

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Elle est mariée et a 40 ans. Elle participe au foyer en exerçant  la vente de produits BB. Elle est née dans la préfecture de Wawa et réside à Lomé. Elle achète souvent à la Brasserie du Bénin Lomé et revend dans un  bar à Akodessewa. Le prêt demandé lui permettra d’acheter de nouveaux  boissons pour augmenter son commerce.
texts.en: Afi A. is married and 40 years old. She helps with household expenses by selling products from Brasserie BB Lomé, a local brewery. She was born in the prefecture of Wawa and lives in Lomé. She buys most of her products from this brewery in Lomé and retails them in her bar in Akodessewa. She applies for this loan to buy more drinks and increase her turnover.

loans.use: To buy products from a local brewery

loans.name: Laurence

texts.en:
Laurence is a thirty-five-year-old married man with five children. He lives in a semi-permanent house in the district of Kyenjojo, Uganda.

Laurence wants a loan to buy sugar, soap and cooking oil to sell at his shop. He dreams of becoming a wholesaler, having a permanent house and educating his children so that they can have a better future.

loans.use: To buy sugar, soap and cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Yos

texts.en:
Yos S. is a 34 year old woman and mother caring for three teenagers, and all them are single and students who study in public school in Kompong Tom Province. Yos S. can earn her daily income by working on staff in a local shop which sells soup from evening time until night time. She can receive revenue from this job averaging $2 a day. Her husband is a recycling seller.

Her house is not comfortable for her and her family to live in because it is getting old and is broken in some parts. She wishes to repair it, but her savings fund is not enough to mend it. To solve this problem, Yos S. is seeking for a loan to buy some pieces of wood to repair her broken house.

loans.use: To buy some pieces of wood to repair her broken house.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama P. is married and has 4 children. She has no formal education. Ama has been selling chilled mineral water and drinks in Abrafo, near Abura, for 5 years. Her husband is a supervisor. Ama is responsible for paying for her family's livelihood. Together with her husband, she also takes care of her children's school fees and books.

Ama's loan will be used to buy more mineral water and drinks to serve a greater amount of customers and increase her profit. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to further expand her business by buying more mineral water. She will also use this money to repay her loan and make sure her children get a good education.

loans.use: to buy more drinks

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of used clothes, milk, and car spare parts

loans.name: Teofreda

texts.en:
Teofreda is a married woman who lives in Bantayan, Cebu. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: a general store and a food vending business. Her husband, Rolando V., who is 58 years old, works as a vendor to earn his living.  They have four children who are 22 to  29 years old. Teofreda joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 12 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Teofreda has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 25,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 6,000,  uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 13th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 23,000, with which she intends to buy additional stock for her general store so that she can continue to save up for the future improvement of her business. Teofreda is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.
"

loans.use: Purchase additional stock for the general store

loans.name: Emelie

texts.en:
Emelie T. is from the village of Liong, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 43 years old. Emelie is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Emelie owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, coffee, detergents, canned goods, snack foods & toothpaste in the local community. Emelie has been engaged in her business for over 25 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Emelie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emelie is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods & snack foods. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Emelie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell like canned goods & snack foods

loans.name: Xaverina

texts.en: Xaverina is  49, widowed and has two children who are 23 and 19 years old. For the last 10 years, she has made a living selling food such as green bananas. She has applied for this loan to buy more bananas to sell to her customers, and hopes to use the money she earns to pay her children's school fees and continue expanding her small business.

loans.use: to buy more green bananas to sell to her customers

loans.name: Felizia

texts.es: Feliza, de 38 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Noe de 40 años y sus 4 menores hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Feliza es muy trabajadora, así que sus días lo dedica al cultivo, ella pone todo su esfuerzo para que sus cultivos tengan la mayor calidad posible, esta actitud ha hecho que sus cultivos de plátano, palta y café, sean muy solicitados en el mercado de la ciudad de Pichanaki, que es donde lleva a vender sus productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y lo hace con mucho esmero, lleva 13 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos ya que los sacos de cultivos son muy pesados. En adelante, espera comprar nuevas tierras para incrementar su producción. Son cuatro ya los préstamos que Feliza tiene con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus pagos y nunca ha tenido problemas con su banco comunal, en donde es la encargada de poner la cuota de alegría que mantiene a las demás socias muy felices. Con los dos mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más abono para fertilizar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Feliza is 38 years old.  She is a very kind and hard-working woman who lives in her own home together with her husband, 40 year-old Noe, and her 4 young children who she would like to provide with a better quality of life.  Feliza is very hard working and spends her days farming her land.  She puts all her effort into ensuring that her crops are of the best quality they can be.  This attitude has led to Feliza's banana, avocado and coffee crops being very much in demand in the market in the town of Pichanaki which is where she take her products to sell.

What Feliza most enjoys about her work is sowing her land and she does this with a lot of care.  She has been in this business for 13 years and she considers the most difficult part of her work to be transporting her products since the sacks of crops are very heavy.  In the future, she hopes to buy more farmland so that she can increase her production.

Feliza has had four loans from MFP.  She has been very punctual in making her repayments and has never had any problems with her community bank where she is in charge of injecting the happiness quota that keeps her fellow members very happy indeed.  Feliza will use the 2,500 Peruvian soles that she has requested to buy more manure so that she can fertilize her crops.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of manure

loans.name: Yen

texts.en: Yen S. was born in 1963 and is a married woman. Yen’s husband works as a chief-of-construction worker for a mobile construction service. Yen has built a pigpen behind her house where she raises pigs to earn a living. She has two children who are both employed in different jobs. Because they have no vehicle, Yen’s children need to hire a taxi to commute to work every day. Yen is requesting a loan to buy a motorcycle so that her kids can commute to their workplaces.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Antonia Digna

texts.es:
Antonia tiene su propio negocio, que inicio con el objetivo de poder traer ingresos para una mejor economía familiar. 
Vende en un tramo, los productos que ofreces son: gorras en variedad, fajas de dama y caballeros, bolsos, conectores para Dvd, entre otros.
Negocio que inicio con financiamiento que Afodenic otorgo mediante el préstamo, siendo de gran beneficio para el sustento de su familia, ya que su esposo trabaja en vigilancia, el cual no se ajustaba para todos los gastos.
Este es su cuarto ciclo, en donde invertirá en la compra de gorras, fajas, chinelas y zapatos deportivos, para aumentar las ventas.
texts.en:
Antonia owns her own business that she set up with the goal of making income to improve her family's finances.

Antonia sells her products from a stand.  She sells a variety of caps, women's and men's belts, bags, DVD connectors, etc.  She started her business with a loan from Afodenic.  It has been very useful in supporting her family since her husband works in the security business and his wages weren't enough to cover all their expenses.

This is Antonia's fourth loan cycle and she will invest her money in buying caps, belts, sandals and sports shoes so that she can increase her sales.

loans.use: to invest in buying caps, bags, sandals and sports shoes so that she can improve her sales

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel N. M. is fifty-three years old and married to a businesswoman. They have four children aged between eighteen and twenty-five years old. They live in Kakamega, a rich agricultural area in Kenya commonly known as the sugar-belt region because of its production of sugarcane. Samuel and his wife hope to give their children a good education up to the university level. He describes himself as a hardworking and visionary man.

Samuel operates a matatu (a minibus) which he uses to provide transport on the Kakamega-Kisumu route. He has been in business for the last three years and has managed to provide employment for two people. He says that while this business is profitable, his major challenge is competition; there are many people offering the same service as his, reducing the amount of profit he can make per day. Additionally, the poor roads in Kakamega become almost impassable during the cold season. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well.

Samuel is using this loan of 40,000 KES to buy new tires for his matatu so as to enable him to improve his business. He hopes to buy more transport vehicles in the future to service different routes. He also sees himself owning a plot of land where he will build a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy new tires for his matatu.

loans.name: Ismoil

texts.ru: Исмоил проживает в районе Восе. Ему 40 лет. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Он занимается торговлей на рынке. Имеет торговую точку, где продает мужскую одежду (футболки, рубашки, брюки). Этим видом деятельности занимается шесть лет. Кредит берет для покупки летних брюк и футболок.
texts.en: Ismoil lives in the Vose region. He's forty years old, married and has four children. He's a salesman at the market. He has an outlet where he sells men's clothes, such as: T-shirts, pants, jackets, etc. He's been doing this for the last six years and is asking a loan in order to buy some summer pants and T-shirts.

loans.use: to buy summer pants and T-shirts

loans.name: Frank Antony

texts.es:
Frank es un joven trabajador, con muchos deseos de superación, de 19 años de edad. Vive con sus padres en una comunidad rural perteneciente al distrito de Paiján en Ascope- La Libertad.

Frank es ayudante de construcción desde hace 3 años y las ganancias obtenidas, producto de su esfuerzo, sirven para ayudar a sus padres en lso gastos del hogar.
