Frank solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles que utilizará para construir su cuarto. Él tiene muchos deseos de mejorar su calidad de vida y este préstamo le sería de gran utilidad.

Frank ya ha trabajado con Kiva y ha cancelado sus pagos puntualmente. Este sería su tercer crédito.
texts.en:
Frank is a hardworking young man who has tremendous desire to excel. He is 19 years old and lives with his parents in a rural community in the District of Paiján, Ascope – La Libertad.

Frank has worked in the construction business as an assistant for three years. His efforts have resulted in income that goes toward helping his parents with the household expenses.

Frank is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 PEN so that he can build a room. He greatly wants to improve his quality of life, so this loan will be of great help.

Frank has already worked with Kiva and submitted his payments on time. This will be his third loan.

loans.use: to acquire materials for building a room.

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony is 30 years old and married, with 3 children. He has been practicing mixed farming for the last 5 years in his hometown in western Kenya. His  farm produces milk, maize and beans which are all sold locally. He is also a driver.

Anthony has made his second loan request of 60,000Kes through Kiva Partner, Juhudi Kilimo. He intends to use this loan to purchase a motorcycle to help transport his farm produce to the market. He says that this will enable him get access to the market without any problem.

His major challenge in the farming business has been unpredictable weather conditions, which affects his production. In the future, he would like to purchase a quality dairy cow that will help increase his milk productivity.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle to help transport his farm produce.

loans.name: David Antonio

texts.es: David, un joven de 27 años de edad, de la comunidad de la Hermita, San Rafael del Norte - Jinotega. Actualmente  con su esposa se encuentran con la bendicion de esperar un bebé, a sus seis meses de embarazo. Incio sus labores en la agricultura a la edad de doce años, con el apoyo de su papá, por lo tanto éste fue un impedimento para no terminar sus estudios llegando hasta el Sexto grado de primaria, donde aprendio a leer y escribir, sin darse cuenta la importancia que traeria la culminación de sus estudios para su futuro. Él solicitó su credito KIVA para el mantenimiento de seis manzanas de frijoles que abarca la compra de insumos y pago de mano de obra, lo cual comercializa su producto en la zona de Jinotega y Estelí con la ayuda de su hermano. Además de comercializar frijoles se dedica también a la compra y venta de ganado generándole ésto otros ingresos. Él desea seguir trabajando con la siembra de frijol durante Dios se lo permita y asi mejorar su cultivo cada dia. Entre sus metas se encuentran primeramente tener a su bebé saludable y comprar una motocicleta que le permita movilizarse para  mejorar sus gestiones para promocionar su producto.
texts.en:
David is a young man of 27 who lives in La Hermita community, in San Rafael del Norte, Jinotega.  He and his wife are currently blessed as they are expecting a baby.  His wife is six months pregnant.

David started farming when he was 12 years old, with the support of his dad.  This was an obstacle to him finishing his studies.  He reached sixth grade, and learned to read and write, but he did not realize the importance that completing his studies would hold for his future.

David requested a Kiva loan to maintain six 'manzanas' (one 'manzana' = 1.68 acres) of beans.  He will buy supplies and pay laborers.  He sells his produce in Jinotega and Estelí, with the help of his brother.  In addition to selling beans, David also buys and sells livestock which makes him additional income.  He would like to continue growing beans for as long as God allows and improve his crops every day.  His goals include, firstly, having a healthy baby, and buying a motorcycle so that he can get around and improve his ability to negotiate and market his produce.

loans.use: to maintain six 'manzanas' (one manzana = 1.68 acres) of beans, buying supplies and paying laborers

loans.name: Elmar

texts.en:
Elmar is 24 years old and married. He has a one-year-old child.

Elmar is a farmer who tills land located in Surallah, South Cotabato. He grows rice, corn and vegetables. Elmar sells his harvest at his town's local market. He works hard to improve his harvest and earnings.

This loan will be used to purchase corn seed, fertilizers and other farm inputs. Elmar hopes to earn more and to save for his family's future.

loans.use: to purchase corn seed, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Goireti

texts.en:
Goireti is a forty six year old widow. She has four children and she owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. 

Goireti has been dealing in second hand clothes for five years. She got her capital from farming. Her hardship has been bad debtors and theft. Her vision is to own a boutique in the future and to educate her children. Goireti intends to use the loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is from the village of Tuzi, Imereti Region, West Georgia. He is 38 years old, married and lives with his family: wife Nana, two daughters (3 and 1 years old) and parents (retired).

David is a joiner and performs different orders for clients. Along with his main job, he is involved in family agriculture. The family owns 2 pigs. They sell approximately 20 piglets per year. Also they own 1 hectare of land where various vegetables and fruits are grown. Along with the aforementioned, the family sells nuts harvested from 60 nut trees. The total average monthly income of the family is 600 laris. 

David requested credit to purchase a milk cow. He will produce cheese and sell it together with fruits and vegetables. The income of the family will increase and they will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Emaylin

texts.en:
Emaylin is 32 years old and married. She has a 5-year-old child. 

Emaylin is a farmer who tills a piece of land in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. She has been growing rice for four years. Emaylin earns about 5000 PHP per month from farming. Emaylin also sells dried fish to the people in her community. She works hard to support her family and save for her child's future.

Emaylin is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs. She hopes to uplift her family's life through her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Juan Marcelo

texts.es: El sr. Juan vive en casa familiar en la casa de sus padres, tiene un taller de tapicería, realiza tapizados de sillas asientos sofás y variedad de trabajos, siempre complaciendo al cliente como el dice, se dedica este trabajo desde hace 5 años, el sr. Es soltero, este crédito es para la compra de material de trabajo, compra de cuerina, esponja y otros, es un cliente antiguo de la institución, el es una persona responsable y trabajadora, le va muy bien en su trabajo tiene muchos clientes y es muy conocido por la buena calidad del acabado.
texts.en:
Sr. Juan lives with his family at the home of his parents. He has an upholstery workshop where he covers chairs, sofas, and a variety of other pieces. Juan says that his customers are always pleased with his work. He is single and has been in business for five years.

This loan will be used to buy materials for his work such as imitation leather, foam, and other supplies. He is a longtime client of Emprender. Juan is a responsible and hardworking person. He has done very well in his work since he has many customers and is well-known for the quality of his finished product.

loans.use: to buy imitation leather, foam, and other supplies.

loans.name: Dominga Elena

texts.en:
Dominga Elenais, a 43-year-old married mother of four children, lives in the Philippines where she has been operating a junk shop that buys and sells recycled bottles and metals for the past seven years. A new member of HSPFI, she has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy recycled bottles and metals to sell.

In the future, Dominga Elena hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy recycled bottles & metals to sell.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en: Lilian is a hardworking 47-year-old businesswoman. She is married and blessed with two children who are still in school. For the last nine years, Lilian has been selling fried groundnuts to earn a living. She previously sold fish. In the next 5 years, she wants to manage a cereal shop. Lilian is requesting a loan of 30,000 KES to buy groundnuts for her business. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has been able to embrace the culture of saving.

loans.use: To buy groundnuts

loans.name: Jacinta   Atieno

texts.en: Jacinta is married and sells fish to earn her living. Even though she still earns the same profit, she believes that with the increase in the amount of loan she has just taken she will get better returns. She repaid her previous loan so well, it has given us the confidence to lend to her again. Jacinta hopes to continue growing her business and be able to give the best education to her children.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Afliana

texts.en:
Afliana is a 56-year-old entrepreneur married to Daniel, a 63-year-old farmer. They have four children: Aryance, 35; Yuliana, 33; Moses, 31 (who are married) and Thomas, 25, (who is studying accounting at a local university).

Afliana has been engaged in a poultry business since 2004. The business enables her to assist her husband in generating more income for the family and supporting Thomas' education. 

She commenced the business by purchasing the chicks from the supplier. She raises them by feeding and providing them with water and vitamins for a three-week period. Afliana usually sells the chicks to her customers. 

Afliana intends to expand the business by adding more chicks to raise so she will be able to generate more income. Afliana said that she needs a lot of money to finance Thomas' education at the university. To solve that problem, Afliana and husband decided to seek a loan of IDR 5,000,000 from TLM. She plans to purchase more chicks, fodder, and vitamins and to build a water tank for the chicks. She is hoping that TLM will approve her loan application.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks, fodder, and vitamins and to build a water tank for the chicks

loans.name: Juice Group

texts.es: Carmen, es la presidenta del grupo JUICE (“Juntos Unidos Iremos al Camino del Éxito”) el grupo está conformado por 11 miembros que a su vez son amigos y vecinos que tiene como objetivo alcanzar metas en conjunto. Entre ellos  está la presidenta Carmen de 35 años de edad casada y madre de dos hijos. Carmen  es profesora de educación y también se dedica diariamente a la venta de productos de belleza y a la par venta de lencería,  gracias a las ventas de ambos productos  ha podido generar  una economía estable en su hogar. Con el reciente préstamo piensa invertirlo en la compra de más productos de belleza como son cremas para la piel y lencería para la venta para la campaña navideña. En el futuro le gustaría poder inaugurar  una tienda de productos de belleza y expandir sus ventas a diversas zonas de la ciudad. Así como Rosa cada integrante del grupo, tiene una meta en particular, que es el éxito y la mejoría económica de sus negocios y  la estabilidad económica para sus familias.
texts.en:
Carmen is the president of the "Juice" (Juntos Unidos Iremos al Camino del Éxito) communal bank. The group is made up eleven members who are both friends and neighbors, and whose aim is reaching their goals together.  Among them is Carmen, the president, who is 35, married, and the mother of two children. 

Carmen is a teacher, and also works every day selling beauty products and lingerie. Thanks to sales of both products, she has been able to generate steady income for her household. She intends to use the recent loan to buy more beauty products, such as skin creams, and lingerie to sell during the Christmas shopping season.  

In the future she would like to start a beauty products store and expand her sales to different areas of the city. As with Carmen, each member of the group has their own particular goal, which for them means success, improving their business finances, and financial stability for their families.

loans.use: To buy beauty products and lingerie to sell during the Christmas shopping season.

loans.name: Maria Elva

texts.es: la señora Elva se dedica a la elaboración y venta de papas fritas desde hace siete años  conoce muy bien el negocio de las papas fritas, solicita el monto para compra de insumos ( papa, aceite, sal y bolsas con impresión ) debido a que para la época de fin de año dichos insumos suben de valor en el mercado y la señora desea almacenar dichos insumos antes de que suban de precio, además que en el mes de septiembre su hijo se caso y la señora Elva aporto económicamente para dicho evento lo cual disminuyo su capital de trabajo vive en domicilio propio con su esposo e hija quien también colabora en la actividad  de venta de papas fritas, vive en domicilio propio esta es la octava vez que solicita crédito en la institución demostrando fidelidad con la institución y responsabilidad en el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Sra. Elva has been preparing and selling French fries for seven years and knows the business very well. The amount she is requesting will be used to buy supplies such as potatoes, oil, salt, and printed bags. Toward the end of the year, the prices of these supplies at the market increase. Sra. Elva wants to stock up on these supplies before the prices increase.

In September, her son got married and she had to contribute toward this event. This diminished her operating capital. Elva lives in her own home along with her husband and daughter, who help her with selling French fries.

This is the eighth time she has requested a loan from Emprender. Elva has demonstrated her loyalty to the organization and her responsibility when submitting her payments.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, oil, salt, and printed bags.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 48 years old. She's married and has 8 children.

Anita works in her business selling lavalavas ("bottom-half" skirt-like wrap-around print cloth worn by both men and women).  She has 3 years of experience in this business. Anita needs a loan of WST 2,000 to invest in expanding the business by purchasing fabric, threads, needles, and an elei printing board (decorative printing method used to embellish fabric).  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Anita joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Anita's 3rd loan with SPBD. 


*SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers.  Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale out of 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is) and these are averaged for the "overall social metric score." For example, a 3 out of 3 on "level of education" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university.  

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  "

loans.use: to purchase fabric, threads, needles, elei printing board.

loans.name: Libia Maria

texts.es: Libia  es la propietaria de una peluquería en la ciudad de Cartagena , ella es casada y tiene un hijo en la edad de 12 años, con su negocio apoya la gestión de bienestar de su hogar y en él ofrece servicios de mejoramiento de la imagen personal y profesional, realizando tratamientos de cabellos, cepillado, manicure, pedicuro, actividades que desarrolla directamente en sus instalaciones y también a domicilio a clientes de su barrio y en toda la ciudad de Cartagena, mediante la modalidad de crédito y contado.  Su esperanza de crecimiento es inmensa,  porque trabaja permanentemente y hasta en horarios extendidos con el fin de lograr salir adelante. Esta es justamente la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará materiales de consumos, como champo, cremas capilares, esmaltes en mayor volumen, para lograr descuentos que disminuyan sus costos y provisionarse para responder efectivamente,  a la época de mayor movimiento mercadológico del año. Así mismo comprara una silla de peluquería para que sus clientes estén cada día mas cómodos y disfruten del ambiente confortable, con el que ella sueña lograr.
texts.en:
Libia owns a beauty shop in the city of Cartagena.  She is married and has a 12 year old son.  Her business helps the well-being of her household.  

In her business she offers services to improve the personal and professional image.  She does hair treatments, blow-outs, manicures, and pedicures.  These services take place in her facilities and also at the houses of customers from the neighborhood and all around the city of Cartagena.  Her services are for cash and credit.

Her wish to grow is immense.  She works constantly and even in extended hours so that she can manage to get ahead.

This is exactly the reason that she turns to a Kiva loan.  This is her first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use the loan to buy consumable products like shampoo, hair creams, and nail polish.  She will buy in greater volume in order to get discounts that reduce the cost.  She will also do this in order to have reserves to effectively respond to the season that has the greatest movement in the market of the year.  She will also buy a hair dresser’s chair so that every day her customers are more comfortable and enjoy the comfortable atmosphere that she dreams of achieving.

loans.use: to buy consumable products like shampoo, hair creams, and nail polish in greater volume and to buy a beautician's chair.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa is married to a farmer and has three children. She has received junior high education. She assists her husband in the general upkeep of the home. 

Theresa sells different kinds of fruits at Enyinase, near Elmina. On the table seen above, Theresa has displayed some bananas and oranges. She will use her loan to buy other kinds of fruits to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy land.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits to sell.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is married and has 6 children.  She is 49-year-old and lives in the Philippines. 

Merlyn is a farmer.  She plants, harvests and sells banana to earn a living.  She has been doing this for 4 years and every month earns PHP 3,000. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase fertilizer such as manure. 

In 2007, Merlyn joined GDMPC to access financial services to improve her business and living situation.  In the future, Merlyn hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Kenia Elizabeth

texts.es: Kenia es una joven estudiante, cursando la carrera de Arquitectura, está en el último año, y por cursar los módulos para acceder a su título, el préstamo será usado para pagar los módulos de graduación. Sus padres le han apoyado económicamente para que ella pueda finalizar su carrera. Dentro de 5 o 10 años espera formar una mediana empresa , trabajar en diseño de interiores y diseños arquitectónicos y así empezar a mejorar la economía familiar. Le inspiran el deseo de superación de poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Kenia is a young student who is pursuing a degree in architecture.  This is her final year, and she needs to take some final course units in order to be eligible for her degree.  She is going to use the loan to pay for the classes that she needs to graduate.  Her parents have supported her financially so she can finish her degree.  Within 5 to 10 years Kenia hopes to establish a medium-sized business specializing in interior design and architectural design, which would begin to improve her family’s economic situation.  Kenia’s parents have inspired her desire to get ahead so she can improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to pay for classes so she can graduate.

loans.name: Success

texts.en: One of LAPO group leaders, Mrs. Success E.. A trained fashion designer is 28 years old. She is energetic, zealous and optimistic in all her dealings. She needs the above amount to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more sewing machines

loans.name: Doudou Madi

texts.en: K., married and father of one child, has been a vendor since 1998. He started his business with $100, selling electric items. K. works very hard and loves to see his business prosper. He has a plan with a loan of $500 to diversify his business by adding clothing. He operates an open-air shop in the local market. His long term plan is to move from an open-air shop to a shop indoors. K. has a dream that his business will one day become large and prosperous.

loans.use: To diversify his business by adding hardware supplies as well as various articles of clothing

loans.name: Frozhan

texts.en:
Frozhan lives in district 15 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is an educated woman. She is widow. Her husband died of cancer 5 years ago. Her children are small she is the only one to support her family.

She has a bakery. She wants to take a loan to complete all the necessary things to expand her bakery and find more clients. This will help her provide for her family's education and solve their economic problems to solve. She is very happy now that she can support her family better by taking this loan .

loans.use: To enlarge her bakery

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase inventory of soft drinks

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.es:
Adelaida is a merchant of woolen baby clothes. Her merchandise is sold in the popular zones of the city of El Alto. Her husband works casually as a porter and thus wins his principle income with which they cover the basic expenses of their three children, who are of school age. Adelaida lives in Tahuantinsuyo zone in the city of El Alto. This loan is marked for the purchase of merchandise, so as to be able to increase her family's income. This is her first loan with Impro. The evaluation process permitted Impro to approve the amount of the loan asked for by Adelaida.

Translated from Spanish by Eric Strader, Kiva Volunteer

Adelaida es comerciante de ropas de lana de bebes; su mercadería la comercializa en las zonas populares de la Ciudad de El Alto; el esposo trabaja eventualmente como portero y así logran sus ingresos principales con los que cubren la manutención de sus tres hijos que están en edad escolar. Adelaida vive en la zona Tahuantinsuyo de la Ciudad de El Alto. El crédito lo destinara para comprar mercadería, para de esta forma incrementar sus ingresos familiares. Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le permite acceder al préstamo solicitado por la prestataria.

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Amivi

texts.fr:
Miss Amivi G., who was born on Nov. 29, 1976 in Lomé, Togo, sells medicines and is responsible for three persons. The income from her business is quite meager because she is not always able to make sales through lack of inventory. Miss Amivi has great difficulty fulfilling her financial responsibilities. She is asking for a loan of US$ 800 to pay for a motorcycle taxi which will be available for errands for her every day. This will allow her to pay back the loan in the usual fashion and improve living conditions for her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Mlle G. Amivi née le 20 novembre 1976 à Lomé est une revendeuse de médicament et a trois personnes à charge. Le revenu de ce commerce étant très faible, parce que la vente n’est pas régulière faute de manque de stock. Mlle Amivi arrive difficilement à assurer sa responsabilité. Elle sollicite un prêt de $800 pour payer une moto taxi qui lui fera les comptes tous les jours. Ce qui lui permettra de rembourser le crédit normalement et d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use:
purchase of a motorcycle for use as a taxi

Achat d'une moto taxi

loans.name: Ratna

texts.en:
Ratna is 30 years old and a mother of one child, aged 7. She sells clothes on credit and also sells a variety of vegetables in her stall. She can earn up to $5 per day. Her husband, S., works at a repair shop and earns $3 per day.

Ratna is requesting $75 to expand her and her husband's business. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business and her husband's business

loans.name: Tabu

texts.en: Tabu, age 28, lives with her parents and supports her 3 year old child with her cafe business. She started this food vending business in 2006 and now makes a monthly profit of about $160. Each day, Tabu works from 7am to noon, serving a variety of breakfast snacks. Tabu now requests a loan to buy more food stock to increase her cafe's business.

loans.use: To buy food stock for cafe

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es:
Since María del Carmen’s husband did not earn enough income to raise their 3 children, ages 13, 12, and 4, she decided to sell sandwiches in March of 2003. She fashioned a little table on which to prepare her sandwiches, and she would heat the meat and bread in her own oven. Little by little, her business prospered, so she was able to buy a sandwich cart that she parked in front of her house, placing tables and chairs around it so that her customers could eat their sandwiches comfortably. Gradually, her neighbors and passersby realized what she was selling.

However, she currently does not have enough products to be able to make her sandwiches, which is why María del Carmen is requesting a loan of $475.00 USD that she is willing to repay within 5 months. She will be able to buy the ingredients needed to prepare a wider variety of sandwiches with this loan. With your support, María del Carmen will help both her business and her family move forward.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Debido a que lo que gana el esposo de María del Carmen no es suficiente para pagar los gastos de sus 3 hijos de 13, 12 y 4 años. Comenzó en Marzo del 2003, vendiendo tortas en una mesita que acondicionó para poder elaborar las tortas y el pan y la carne la calentaba en la estufa de su casa, pero poco a poco le empezó a ir mejor y pudo comprar un carrito tortero en buenas condiciones el cual ubicó en el frente de su casa con unas mesitas y sillas para que sus clientes pudieran comerse las tortas de manera cómoda. Poco a poco sus vecinos y personas que pasan por su casa se dieron cuenta de lo que estaba vendiendo.

Sin embargo Actualmente no cuenta con material suficiente para poder elaborar las tortas. Es por eso que María del Carmen está solicitando un crédito de US $475 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 5 meses y con este dinero María del Carmen podrá comprar el material necesario para poder elaborar las tortas y comprar otros ingredientes para crear un repertorio de tortas mayor. Con tu ayuda María del carmen podrá sacar adelante su negocio y con este a sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase of sandwich ingredients

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
Esther knows the activities of agriculture and cattle farming very well due to the fact that since she was very young she was linked to this labor through her family. When she constructed her own home the necessities pressured her and the small earnings that her husband earned away from the city were not enough to supply the necessities of their children, it was in this moment that she decided to take the reins of her home and begin to grow potatoes, corn and alfalfa, this last product gives daily nutrition to the little cows that she acquired later on; she has been dedicating herself to this labor for 10 years and things in her home have gotten better, her husband continues working outside the city and her children have not left their studies and they are able to receive daily sustenance thanks to their mother’s efforts. With the desire of increasing the production of her fields she solicits a loan to acquire a better quantity of manure fertilizers to obtain a harvest of better size and quality next season.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

Esther, conoce muy el trabajo en la actividad agrícola y ganadera debido a que desde muy niña ha estado vinculada a esta labor por su familia.Cuando construyó su propio hogar las necesidades la apremiaban y el pequeño sueldo que percibía su esposo fuera de su ciudad no era suficiente para abastecer las necesidades de sus pequeños, fue este el momento en el que ella decidió tomar las riendas de su hogar y empezar a sembrar papa, maíz y alfalfa, este último productos para otorgarles alimento diario a las pequeñas vaquitas que adquirió poco tiempo después; lleva dedicándose a esta labor diez años y las cosas dentro de su hogar han mejorado notablemente, su esposo sigue trabajando fuera de la ciudad y sus pequeños no han dejado de estudiar y de percibir el sustento diario gracias al esfuerzo de su mamá.Con el deseo de incrementar la producción de sus campos solicita un préstamo para adquirir mayor cantidad de abonos y fertilizantes a fin de obtener esta próxima cosecha alimentos de mejor tamaño y calidad.

loans.use: To purchase manure and fertilizers.

loans.name: Ni Putu Sutarmi

texts.id:
Sutarmi lives a simple life. Her house is made of dried leaves. Her husband is an ordinary farmer. She works to earn additional income to support her family. She has 4 piglets which she feeds 3 times a day. From this activities she can earned up to IDR 1.8 million per 6 months period (around USD 205). She uses this profit to buy more piglets so she can earn more.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Sutarmi dalam menjalani kehidupan kesehariannya sangat sederhana dan rumah tempat tinggalnya pun sederhana terbuat dari gedeg, karena suami Sutarmi hanya seorang petani biasa. Sutarmi semangat untuk berusaha agar bisa membantu dalam memenuhi kebutuhan rumah tangganya. Sutarmi memelihara 4 ekor babi penggemukan yang dibeli dari saudaranya. Usaha ini sangat cocok untuk Sutarmi karena Sutarmi hanya tamat SD. Babi yang dipelihara sangat gemuk, karena dalam 1 hari Sutarmi memberi makan 3 kali. Juga diberikan makanan tambahan berupa dedaunan dan batang pisang. Setiap pagi, babi peliharaannya dirawat dengan cara kandangnya dibersihkan dan juga babinya dimandikan agar segar dan sehat. Keuntungan yang didapat dalam 6 bulan Rp.1.800.000,- Keuntungan ini digunakan untuk modal lagi agar bisa memelihara lebih banyak dan keuntungan juga lebih banyak diterima. Dengan dana pinjaman yang didapatnya, Sutarmi berencana untuk menambah populasi babi peliharaannya agar keuntungan yang diperoleh lebih meningkat.

loans.use: To buy piglets (Membeli bibit babi untuk menambah populasi ternaknya)

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina M. is from Kyela Mbeya, Tanzania.  She is 28 years old and married with a two year-old child. She also cares for a dependent, who lives with her because he is an orphan.  In 2004, Amina established her own tailoring business with the help of Selfina, an organization that works towards the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through sale and leaseback agreements. She now requires a new loan of $325 in order to buy more cloth for her boutique.

loans.use: To buy more cloth for her boutique.

loans.name: Karen

texts.es:
Karen is 28 years old, single, and has an 8-year old son.

She owns a hairdressing business that she has operated from her home for the last ten years. She says that she had to make many sacrifices in order to start her business; in the past she worked as a domestic servant, just managing to pay for her hairdressing studies with the small amount of money that she earned.

Afterwards she got work in a friend’s salon, where she managed to put by enough money to be able to open her own salon. Today she has a well-established clientele and a well-equipped hairdressing business.

Right now she needs a loan to buy creams, hair dyes, shampoo etc. She is also planning to use the money to buy stock for a small shop that she has built next to her hairdressing salon.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer.

Karen tiene 28 años, es soltera y tiene un hijo de 8 años de edad.

Posee una peluquería que funciona en su casa hace 10 años.Comenta que inició dicha actividad con mucho sacrificio debido a que anteriormente trabajaba como empleada doméstica, logrando costear sus estudios de peluquería con los pocos ingresos que obtenia de dicho trabajo.

Luego consiguió trabajo en la peluquería de una amiga, donde logró juntar un poco de dinero con el que pudo montar su propia peluquería. Hoy día cuenta con una clientela bien formada y una peluquería muy bien equipada con todo lo necesario para realizar sus trabajos diarios.

En esta oportunidad necesita de un préstamo para la compra de cremas, tinturas, shampoos,etc. y además con el dinero que le sobre cargará de mercaderías un salón que ha construido con el fin de montar en el una pequeña despensa al costado de su peluquería.

loans.use: To purchase shampoo, hair dye, creams etc.

loans.name: Thi Linh

texts.vi:
Born in 1976, Mrs. T. Thi Linh joined the TYM Fund in 2007. Despite being very young, she and her husband are very sensitive and quick in doing business and improving their family's economy. Her hometown's traditional occupation is making mats, so she used the first loan T. purchase materials T. make more mats. In 2008, her family decided T. invest in buying machines for the mat production instead of making mats manually like before. Mrs. Linh does not just use the machines for her family's own production but also lends it out T. other villagers. Because of this, her family's income is increasing. She has three school-going children. This time, she wants T. borrow 9 millions VND (550USD) T. purchase more raw materials for the mat production. Her family's average monthly income is 4 millions VND (about 258USD).

Translated from Vietnamese by Pham Yen Thanh, Kiva Volunteer.

Sinh năm 1976, Chị Tô Thị Lĩnh tham gia Quỹ Tình Thương năm 2007, mặc dù tuổi đời còn rất trẻ nhưng vợ chồng chị rất nhạy bén trong làm ăn và phát triển kinh tế, tai địa phương chị với nghề chuyền thống người dân trong đia phương chủ yếu là dêt chiếu, vòng vốn đầu tiên gia đình chị sử dụng vào mua vât liệu làm chiếu. Năm 2008 gia đình chị đã mạnh dạn đầu tư mua máy vò và máy lồng loại máy để dệt chiếu thay thế cho việc làm thủ công trước. Máy đựơc phục vụ sản xuât của gia đình và dịch vụ cho các hộ có nhu cầu thuê. Từ việc kinh doanh này kinh tế gia đình chị ngày một phát triển, chị có 3 con hiện đang đi học. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 9.000.000đ đầu tư vào mua vật liệu dệt chiếu. Thu nhập bình quân. 4.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Mr. Ly S., 27, is a father of one little child and works as a motor-taxi driver, making around $3 each day. His client base is mostly at a market near his town. His wife works as a gardener and can make only $1 each day.

Mr. Ly S. and his wife are concerned about the small amount of income they make compared to recent inflation. He mentioned that previously the income of $4 per day was enough to cover his family’s expenses such as utilities, food and gasoline, but today everything is very expensive, especially rice and gas, so their income is barely enough and it is pretty hard for them.

In order to overcome their obstacles, Mr. Ly S. is asking for a loan amount of $1000 to build a stand for his wife to sell meatballs and food products to the people in her area. With any leftover money, S. will replace his old motor-bike which is often broken and costs him a lot of money.

loans.use: To open a stand for his wife to sell meatballs and food products.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.es:
Amalia C. L. lives in Armenia, in the municipality of Sonsonate. Like many Salvadorian women, Amalia is a single mother of five children that live with her and for whom with much courage and sacrifice she has managed to get ahead. 25 years ago Amalia started a hair cutting business that became the cornerstone of her life and with which she could bring food to her children's table. With a firm vision of progress, Amalia expanded her business and opened a small Cosmetology academy, with the aim of covering her growing expenses due to her extensive family. Unfortunately, two years ago the C. family suffered a tragedy that would cloud her future. Like many Salvadorians, Amalia was the victim of a whim of nature. losing all of her furniture in the latest earthquake in El Salvador. The earthquake ruined all of her furniture and caused severe damage to her business and house. Amalia didn't give up and with enormous maternal instinct, she pulled strength from weakness and decided on picking herself up, requested a loan to restart her business, buying cosmetology (dyes, shampoos, combs, etc.) that will allow her to get back on track, which she has been on for more than 25 years.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

Amalia C. L. vive en Armenia, municipio del departamento de Sonsonate. Como muchas mujeres salvadoreñas, Amalia es madre soltera de cinco hijos, que viven con ella, y a quienes con valor y sacrificio ha logrado sacar adelante. Desde hace ya 25 años, Amalia inició un negocio de corte de pelo, que se volvió la piedra angular de su vida, y con el que pudo llevar diariamente pan a la mesa de sus hijos. Con una firme visión de progreso, Amalia amplió su negocio y abrió una pequeña academia de Cosmetología, con el fin de cubrir sus gastos acrecentados por su extensa familia. Lastimosamente hace ya un par de años, la historia de la familia C. sufre una tragedia que nublaría su futuro. Como muchos salvadoreños, Amalia fue víctima de un capricho de la naturaleza, perdiendo todos sus muebles en el último terremoto en tierras salvadoreñas. El terremoto arruino todos sus muebles y causo severos daños a su negocio y casa. Amalia no desiste y con un enorme instinto maternal, saca fuerzas de flaqueza, y se encuentra decidida a levantarse, solicitando un préstamo para reinicar su negocio, comprando productos de cosmetología (Tintes, Shampoos, Peines,etc), que le permitan recuperar el buen camino , en el que desde hace ya 25 años lleva firmes de su mano, a sus cinco hijos.

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetic products (Dyes, shampoos, combs, etc.)

loans.name: Maua's Tupendane Group

texts.en:
Maua J. is 25 years old and is single. She has been a clothes seller since 2005. Every day, she works from 7 am to 6 pm at her business, and she can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

Maua is now looking for a loan to buy more clothes for resale to expand her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Tatu F..

loans.use: To buy more clothes for resale to expand her business

loans.name: Ethelvina

texts.es:
La señora de nombre Ethelvina Hernández con la edad de 62 años, su estado civil es casada, tiene 2 hijos sus nombres son: Humberto Francisco Palacios tiene 35 años de edad es soltero y es ingeniero industrial, lamentablemente no trabaja le ayuda a su papa en la agricultura su otra hija es Maryori Palacios tiene 32 años de edad y es Lic. En biología trabaja en la universidad de león y es casada, el compañero de vida de Doña  Ethelvina es agricultor ya que tiene una pequeña finquita con su ganado. Las aspiraciones que ella tiene es poder ampliar su negocio, y acondicionar un pequeño lugar en su casa donde instalar su pequeño negocio de productos lácteos.

La señora Ethelvina  tiene 15 años de poseer el negocio, la actividad económica del negocio es de ventas de productos lácteos como leche, crema y queso fresco,  esta ubicado en su casa de habitación que es donde fue la proquinsa   1c.oeste 1/2c. al norte, en león, dando inicio en este negocio, como una opción a poder obtener otros ingresos ya que la mayor parte de su vida la ha dedicado al magisterio es decir a impartir clases de primaria  en la escuela hermita de dolores de san Felipe y de este modo forma a sus 2 hijos y ahora esta jubilada, anteriormente entregaba la leche en la finca pero la vendía a bajo precio después se decidió a trasladar a su casa y vender estos productos como son: crema, queso y borona ella piensa usar el financiamiento para comprar mas concentrado para su ganado y de mejor calidad ya que  este le generaría mas rendimiento en su producción, razón por la cual requiere de los financiamientos.
texts.en:
The lady named Ethelvina H., 62, her civil status is married, she has two sons whose names are Humberto Francisco Palacios, who is 35,single and an industrial engineer who unfortunately doesn't work and helps his dad with agriculture; her other child is Maryori Palacios, who is 32. She works in biology in the University of Leon and is married. Ehelvina's husband is a farmer now that he has a small plot from hisearnings. The aspiration she has is to grow her business and condition a small place in her house where she can install he small dairy business.E

Ms. Ethelvina has had her business for 15 years, which is to sell dairy products like milk, cream, and fresh cheese, it is located in the house which is located at 1c west, 1/2c north in Leon. Starting this business as an option to be able to get another source of income, after devoting the majority of her life to teaching, which is to say that she taught primary school classes in the Dolores de San Felipe school and this is how she raised her two children. Now she is retired. Before she sold milk in the estate, but she sold it for lower prices later she decided to move the business to her house and sell the products which are:cream, cheese and she is thinking of using the financing to buy more food for her livestock and to improve the quality now that she is more dedicated to her production, which is why she needs financing.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac N. is a 40-year-old married man with three children, all of whom are in school. He owns and operates a grocery shop in his neighborhood, where he sells items such as sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, pastries, powdered milk, and biscuits.

He is now seeking a loan so that he can increase his store's inventory by purchasing more crates of assorted drinks, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, and boxes of biscuits. In turn, he hopes to increase his savings to support his children while they are in school.

Isaac belongs to the Trust group known as the God is Good Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee each other's loans as social collateral (i.e., if one member does not promptly repay his or her portion of the loan, then the other members are responsible for curing the arrears), and they provide support for one another to repay their respective loans.

loans.use: To increase his store's inventory by purchasing additional foodstuffs (e.g., assorted drinks, sugar, bottled mineral water, and biscuits)

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary B., 40, is married and has six children. Three of her children have completed senior high school and the oldest is now in the second year of university studies. She is a very resourceful wife and mother who works hard to support the family. Mary supports her husband in providing for the household by selling used clothing. Selling used clothing is a very big business in Ghana because brand new clothing is too expensive for the poor. Mary wants to use the loan to buy more bales of used clothing to increase her inventory. She is member of the group called Liberty Trust Group. Her picture was taken at a group meeting. In this group, members provide social collateral for one another to guarantee the repayment of loans. She is grateful for the assistance.

loans.use: To buy bales of used clothing

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
“I started selling chicken barbeque along the highway of Lun Padidu, Malapatan, a small village in Sarangani Province with only PHP 2,000 from my pocket," says Aileen T., a married 28-year-old in our interview with her during her loan request.

She never minds the labor and how hard she has to prepare all the ingredients just to ensure that she has enough money to save for her future family. Her husband’s income as a motorcycle driver is not enough, so she needs to earn money to suffice their growing needs as a couple. Since they are starting a family, Aileen knows how important it is to have an established source of livelihood. So, she decided to join CEVI and learn something about having a business. 

Aileen needs a loan to purchase more meat ingredients for her barbecue business. In the past, she tried to utilize her own native poultry animals, but now that she has more customers, she has to scout for other suppliers to better accommodate them all. She is also interested in looking for some other possible ways to augment their income.

Since she is a CEVI client, Aileen enjoys availing the credit assistance, trainings, as well as the insurance coverage that it offers.

loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients and food items to sell

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Cuando Maria Elena se separó de su esposo se vio en la necesidad de trabajar en lo que fuera con el fin de mantener a sus cuatro hijos y los gatos de la casa. En un principio lavó ropa a personas desconocidas y limpió en casas adineradas.

Luego de varios años y gracias a unas amigas le nació la idea de poner un negocio. Como no tenía dinero pensó en vender productos de limpieza. No disponía de mucha capital por lo que su mercadería empezó siendo mínima. Poco a poco y gracias a su esfuerzo ha podido crecer y cumplir sus propósitos.

Hoy en día maneja su puesto de venta de productos de limpieza pero en un puesto propio en el mercado de su casa. Dentro de un tiempo quisiera abrir una tienda en su propia casa.
texts.en:
When Maria Elena separated from her husband she found she needed to work to support her four children and her housecats. At first she did laundry for people she didn't know, and cleaned in well-to-do households. After a few years and thanks to some friends, she came up with the idea of going into business. Since she didn't have a lot of money she decided to sell cleaning products. She didn't have much capital, so her inventory was small at first. Little by little and by virtue of her own efforts, she has been able to grow, and achieve her goals. Nowadays she has a cleaning products stand, but it's located in the market near her house. After a while she would like to open a store in her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: New merchandise

loans.name: Mrs. Chanthy Long Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan has been requested by 16 people living in Kampong Tuol village in Kandal province, and they will use the loan for various purposes. Bank president Mrs. Chanthy L. owns a small soup restaurant. Since her business is doing well, she wants to increase profits by purchasing more ingredients so she can make more soup. She is 35 years old and has three children: one little one and two who are enrolled in the local school where her husband, Mr. Kuth Boramey, is a teacher.

loans.use: Purchasing more ingredients in order to increase profits at a soup restaurant.

loans.name: Husniya

texts.ru: Рахмонова Хусния проживает в районе Гиссар. Возраст 28 лет, незамужем . Живет с родителями. Уже около восьми лет занимается торговлей. Имеет магазин по продаже продуктов питания . Магазин имеет своих клиентов , но Хусния хочет увеличить ассортимент товара , который позволит ей привлечь новых клиентов. Для этого в данный момент она планирует получить кредит , сроком на 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Husniya R. lives in the Gissar region. She is 28 years old, not married. She lives with parents. She has been in the retail business for about eight years. She has a store where she sells food. Husniya has many customers, but wants to increase the variety of goods which will in turn attract new customers. For this she plans to get a loan for a 12 months term.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase commodity circulation

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Having recently joined GHAPE, Naomi is taking out her first loan to purchase bean, vegetable and corn seeds, as well as to pay for labor for her farm, and also to buy oil for her shop in the market. Naomi hopes to have a good harvest this year and she believes that bringing her produce to the market will help the community. 

With the profits from her farming and market business, Naomi plans to expand her farm further by purchasing additional seedlings so that she can take even better care of her family. Naomi is married with six children and two of them are under the age of fifteen. 

Naomi has faced adversity in her life, like deep poverty and sickness, but with the help of this loan, she will be able to pay for her children's school fees and help her community in general through her business.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account, and most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Bean seeds, vegetable seeds, corn seeds, and oil

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida B. is 48 years old, married, and has eleven children. They live in the town of Sto. Niño, Pagadian, Zamboanga Del Sur. She started her business 3 years ago with the help of her daughter when she bought three computers.

And now she has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 for the maintenance of their business. At present, her business is still growing and, because of that, she would like to buy more computers to gain more income from her business.

She has a vision of having a concrete house someday and another vision for the future of her children finishing their studies.

loans.use: To buy more computers for her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: purchase of processed seafood and woodland produce (fruits and palm oil)

loans.name: Geronima

texts.en:
Geronima P. is 66 years old. She is a widow; her husband died because of illness. What she is doing now is managing a small sari-sari (store). She wants to grow her business even more. She is working so hard to help her children who are already married.

She would like to ask for a loan of Php 9,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase school supplies to sell. Enrollment is near and people will eventually buy notebooks, pencils and other school supplies for their children.

CEVI provides financial services in the community. CEVI gives not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase school supplies to sell.

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en:
Meriam M. is a 43-year-old married mother of two school-aged children and is from Oroquieta City. To make a living, Meriam owns and operates a 'sari-sari' ('various kinds') store business in the retail sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Meriam has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2007, Meriam joined Kiva partner, PMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Meriam is now requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase additional inventory and for use as working capital. This loan will be her sixth from PMPC. Meriam plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for use as working capital

loans.name: Muhiddin

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Мухиддин, мужчина , который занимается куплей и продажей скота.Он в основном продаёт и покупает коров и быков.Как раз на снимке он с быком в сарае.Мухиддин утверждает , что благодаря кредитам у него хорошо продвигается жизнь семьи получая прибыль с бизнеса.Он благодарит инвесторов за понимание и финансирование.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Muhiddin is a man who buys and sells cattle. He mainly buys and resells cows and bulls. On the photo he is with a bull in the shed. Muhiddin confirms that thanks to the loans his family's life is good because of the profits from the business. He is thanking the lenders for their understanding and financial support.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell cattle

loans.name: Nsozibiri A Atima Fina Group

texts.en: A. Fina is the group representative; she is a 30-year-old businesswoman, married, and blessed with three children. Two of her children are going to school. She is also taking care of one dependent who is also in school. A. Fina has a silver fish business and she has been operating her business for four years. She is using the loan to purchase silver fish, adding capital to her business for much profit. She is an encouraging businesswoman whose dream is to increase her farm productivity.

loans.use: To purchasing silver fish to add capital to her business

loans.name: Mohammad Aslam Group

texts.en: M. Aslam is the group leader of M. Aslam group. There are three members in this group. Each of them would like to take a loan for his or her business. M. Aslam would like a loan for his general store. Mahy Gull would like a loan for her tailoring business. Farzana would like a loan for her husband who has a fruit and vegetable shop. So, they are requesting a group loan of 15,000 Afghani. They are very happy with this loan process in Afghanistan.

loans.use: Inventory for their businesses

loans.name: Silvia Janneth

texts.es: Silvia Janneth Gonzales B. tiene 45 años. Ella tiene 3 hijos a su cargo y como toda madre responsable está en la obligación de proporcionarle estudios y alimentación. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es ofrecer servicio de decoración. Hace más 6 años que se dedica a este negocio, la ubicación es en su casa de habitación y en algunas ocasiones tiene que realizar la decoración servicio a domicilio. Su marido ayuda a realizar aportes para la familia el labora como docente en un colegio privado y juntos han podido salir adelante. A pesar de lo pocos ingresos que obtienen viven con las comodidades necesarias. Ella solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de materia prima, como piñatas, pega, lápices de colores, festones, globos y cintas. El sueño que tiene es muy humilde ya que solamente desea seguir adelante con este negocio.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a member of the Amani borrower group in Kinyanambo, Iringa. She is 28 year old woman, she is married and a mother of 1 child. Her child is 4 years old.

Grace has owned a pharmacy business selling medicine for 5 years, she works 12 hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 150,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Grace`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount  of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more Medicine for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Grace hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more medicine

loans.name: Alma

texts.en: Mrs. Alma P., 37 years of age, married is a resident of Migcanaway, Tangub City. She is blessed with 6 children all are in their teens and minor age. Her husband is a skilled fisherman equip with their own fishing nets and fishing boats. To help her husband in the support of the family, she engaged in fish vending activity from the catch of their fishing activity and also buying from other fishermen in the area. Presently, they were earning an average net income of not less than P6,000.00 a month from all this activity. As a new member, she is applying an amount of P4,000.00 to finance the repairs of their fishing boat and fishing nets. She is thankful to PAGLAUM MPC because of the trust given to her even if she is a new member and also for the trainings and education program of the coop.

loans.use: Repairs of fishing boat and fishing nets

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn G. is a 50-year-old farmer in Norala, South Cotabato. She generally receives a good income from her one-hectare rice field, but sometimes not, due to pest attack. She has 6 children; the eldest is 27 years old. She sustains her children's education through her farm.

Most of the farmers in their area are helped in financing through Community Economic Ventures, Inc., and she joined in May, 2008. Now she's requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP. With this she will be able to sustain her business and provide the basic needs of her family.

loans.use: Financing

loans.name: Teo

texts.en:
Teo is a 50 year old married woman with nine children, who are between 13 and 25 years old. Five of her children go to school. She resides in and owns a seven room house, in which she is staying with twelve people. The family doesn’t have access to electricity or running water. Teo also takes care of additional family members. 

Teo has a stall selling vegetables, bananas and firewood. She pays for transport costs to and from Kalerwe Market. On average she receives approximately 20 customers a day. She has been in this business for thirty years and with MCDT seven years. She is currently servicing her thirteenth loan with the same group mates. Her monthly expenses include feeding the family, accommodation and medication. Her business challenges include transportation and the rainy season, which prevents her customers from coming to her. Teo wants to use this loan to buy more boxes of tomatoes, cabbages, sacks of bananas and firewood. She wants to see her business grow and start buying directly from farmers.

loans.use: purchasing boxes of tomatoes, cabbages, sacks of bananas and firewood

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en:
Rogelio B. lives in Barangay Buliwao, Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 49 years old and is married to Emily B.. They are blessed with two children. Being a responsible father, both of their children have finished their degrees and are now working abroad.

The common source of their living is farming. They help each other to cultivate their farm by planting rice and vegetables. Since harvesting takes a long time, Rogelio engages in the buying and selling of charcoal and vegetables from their village. The products are then sold at Solano Public Market through retailing. He can able to earn a net income of PHP3,000 a month, which he uses to acquire their daily basic needs and is able to save some income for the families' future. Since his business is profitable, he wants to continue it and acquire more products but his capital is not sufficient. He plans to borrow from KIVA lenders an amount of PHP9,000 to further develop his capital and income.

loans.use: additional capital in buying and selling of charcoal

loans.name: Exarita

texts.es:
La señora Exarita, pertenece al Banco Comunal “10 de Agosto II”,  Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 67 años y es madre de 07 hijos, 01 que aun depende de ella y esta estudiando.

Exarita, mujer empeñosa y trabajadora, sus ganas de salir adelante y cumplir parte de sus sueños, le ha valido para implementar su propio negocio de venta de adobes, ubicada en su misma casa, un ambiente especialmente para colocar sus adobes y brindar a sus clientes, una buena atención.

En la actualidad cuenta con una clientela ya fidelizada, que vienen de otras zonas a realizar sus pedidos y compras de su producto, nos cuenta que es muy responsable con sus cuotas de pago y piensa seguir así e implementarse en otro tipo de negocio. 

Con este préstamo de S/ 800.00, comprará tierra amarilla en bolqueteadas y algunas herramientas, para cambiar lo antiguo, por unos nuevos. Parte del dinero también invertirá en el pago de sus peones, que semanalmente trabajan, para poder cumplir con los pedidos, que sus clientes lo solicitan.

Exarita, se siente con mucha fortaleza para continuar trabajando y seguir adelante y asegurarse una vejez tranquila y  agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Exarita, 67, is a member of the "10 de Agosto II" communal bank which is in he Tarapoto district, San Martín province, San Martín department. She is married and has 7 children, one of whom is a student and still dependent on her. Exarita, a hard-working, enterprising woman, in her desire to get ahead in life and have her own business, sells adobe bricks in her home from an area specially equipped to display and sell the bricks and offer good customer service. She has a steady, regular clientele that come from other areas to place their orders and buy the product. She tells us that she is very responsible with her loan repayments and intends to continue thus and set herself up in another type of work. With this 800 sol loan she will buy blocks of yellow dirt and some tools to replace some outdated ones. Part of the money will be used to pay her laborers who work weekly to fulfill her orders. Exarita feels strong to continue working and to go forward to insure a tranquil old-age for herself. She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for contributing to her meeting her goals and dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy blocks of yellow dirt.

loans.name: Susanian

texts.en:
Susanian K. sells maize flour in the market and is requesting a loan to buy bags of onions and more flour to sell. Susanian is 37 years old and is married to a soldier. She has four children who are all in school. With the profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a maize flour store.

About BRAC: BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services. The programs are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock bags of onions and more flour to sell

loans.name: Analyn L.

texts.en:
Analyn L. M. is from the village of Napurog, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 22 years old. Analyn L. is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Analyn L. owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of products in the local community. Analyn L. has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month through the business.

In 2088, Analyn L. joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Analyn L. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Analyn L. is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and to provide working capital. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Analyn L. from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to provide working capital

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa is 38 years old and married with two children—one newborn and one in school. Her husband s a trader in the community where she lives.

Theresa has owned and operated a grocery store for eight years, selling items such as rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, body and hair creams, and skimmed powdered milk. She also sells cereals like maize in the community market.

Theresa sees an opportunity to grow her business and wants the loan to expand her inventory to include other items frequently in demand by customers. Improved sales would enable her to save more for her children's education. She hopes to pay back the loan on time.

loans.use: To expand her inventory

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita M., age 52, is a married woman who lives in Brgy M., Calatrava, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by making native handicrafts such as bags, wallets, and fruit baskets from pandan leaves. Teresita’s husband Gregorio, age 50, helps run the business. They have six children between the ages of 13 to 25 years old. Two have their own families, two help her in the business, and one is currently attending school.

Teresita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the family's quality of life. With the help of the loans she has received from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income by making and selling her native handicrafts. Now she earns an average monthly income of Php 4,800 from her business activities.

Teresita is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of Php 10,000 was used to fund operations of her business, and it had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is applying for her tenth loan in the amount of Php 11,000, which she intends to use to support her business. Teresita is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. ("Dungganon" is a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable.") Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress away from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their most ambitious dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a community member who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Topurchase materials for making native handiwork products for sale

loans.name: Sarorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarorn V. (pictured here), is 31 years old and her husband, Mr. Sokra In, is 41 years old. They live in a small village across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1995 and have two children: one son and one daughter. Both of them are in school.   

Sarorn has been a silk weaver for seven years, a skill she learned from her mother. Her husband is a silk weaver as well. They sell their finished products to a middleman who then takes them to re-sell in Phnom Penh market. Sarorn is requesting her first loan of US$ 250 to purchase silk materials for her waving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Las Vegas Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “LAS VEGAS”, actualmente se encuentra en el V ciclo y esta conformado por 13 personas trabajadoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos, es un banco comunal conformado por socios que viven en la provincia de Cusco del departamento Cusco.  Cusco es una cuidad que se caracteriza por su Centro Histórico, sus paisajes, su historia siendo una ciudad encantadora de la Región Sur del país. 

Las actividades económicas de los socios a las que se dedican son el comercio como por ejemplo venta de productos de construcción y venta producto de belleza y otros brindan servicio de docencia, servicio de llamadas de forma ambulatoria, servicio de administración de las discotecas “Las Vegas” y  “El Palacio del Folklore”, servicios de azafata en la discoteca Las Vegas, servicio de recepcionista y servicio de biología. El banco comunal tiene vaR. ciclos de funcionamiento, como manifiestan las socias, se encuentran contentas y satisfechas con los servicios de crédito, ahorro y capacitación, por el tiempo de permanencia en el banco comunal un aspecto de valoración es el ahorro por la posibilidad de capitalización que les brinda este servicio. 

Kathia es socia nueva del banco comunal Las Vegas, tiene 36 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene tres hijos. La socia Kathia vende producto de belleza y venta de ropa. La socia Kathia nos cuenta que ella trae la ropa de la ciudad de Desaguadero y la ciudad de Tacna y loS vende a personas conocidas y también a instituciones. La socia requiere el crédito para aumentar el negocio de venta de ropa y cosméticos y también para la educación de su hija mayor. La socia pide que sigan dando este tipo de créditos pues le da oportunidad para incrementar el negocio. Sobre todo ella nos cuenta que hay muchas mujeres que no tienen donde trabajar de forma independiente porque como mamas necesitan estar al cuidado de sus hijos y tener un ingreso adicional. 

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
The “LAS VEGAS” communal bank is in its fifth loan cycle; it’s made up of 13 hard-working members who are always searching for opportunities to get ahead in life and to provide a better future for their children through their daily efforts. This is a communal bank composed of members who reside in Cusco province, Cusco department. Cusco is a city that is renowned for its historical city center, its scenery and its history; it is an enchanting city in the south of the country. The members are involved in a variety of commercial activities. For example: sales of building materials and beauty products; some are teachers and others sell phone services. Another administers the “Las Vegas” and “El Palacio del Folklore” discotheques while another is a hostess at the Las Vegas discotheque. One is a receptionist and another provides biological services. The communal bank has had several loan cycles. The members state that they are happy and satisfied with the credit services, the savings and the training received. They are particularly pleased with the savings that they can accrue by leaving their funds in a common account over time. Kathia is a new member of the Las Vegas communal bank. She is 36 years old, lives with her life partner and their three children. She sells beauty products and clothing. She tells us that she brings the clothing from the cities of Desaguadero and Tacna and sells them to acquaintances and to institutions. She needs financing to increase her stock and also to pay her oldest daughter’s school costs. She asks that she continue to receive this kind of loan so that her business can grow. Above all, she tells us that there are a lot of women who are unable to work independently because, being mothers; they must care for their children and have additional income. The members in general are grateful for the opportunity offered and pledge to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing and cosmetics and for her oldest daughter's school costs.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace D. V. is from the village of Canituan, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 33 years old. Grace is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Grace owns & operates a business venture in the food sector, butchering and selling meat in the market. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from butchering & selling pork in the market. Grace has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Grace joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Grace has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Grace is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Grace from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

location.town: Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Lilliam Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Lilliam Del Socorro tiene 40 años, es casada y tiene dos hijos, con edades entre 11 y 15 años de edad. La señora tiene en su casa un negocio de carpintería, generalmente elaboran sillas abuelitas, comedores, roperos, y en general todos los artículos de madera. Ella dio inicio a este negocio desde hace 5 años, cabe señalarse antes el negocio era manejado por su esposo,  pero él tuvo que ir a otro país en busca de mejorar su condición, sin embargo en ese tiempo ella quedo a cargo de mantener a flote el negocio ya que tienen todos los clientes solo de entregar los productos. Este crédito será invertido en la compra de materia prima, ya que actualmente tienen bastantes pedidos de camas matrimoniales de madera y de sillas abuelitas. Ella generalmente entrega sus mercancías a personas que vienen de Managua a encargarle sus productos, vende generalmente varios artículos a la vez, por lo que se le podría denominar como mayorista. Su sueño en el futuro, es comprar nuevas maquinarias para el negocio, buscando que este siempre se mantenga activo y brinde la estabilidad económica que ella y sus hijos necesitan.
texts.en:
Lilliam Del Socorro, 40, is married and has two children, who are 11 and 15 years of age. She has a carpentry shop in her home. Her usual products are rocking chairs, dining sets, armoires, and generally all kinds of wood items. She started this business 5 years ago; her husband used to run it. However, he had to move to another country seeking better work opportunities and she had to be in charge of the business and keep it solvent because they had customers that needed their products delivered. She will use these funds to buy raw materials because she has several pending orders for wood double beds and rocking chairs. Her usual customers are residents of Managua that come to her to order items. She sells several items at once so one could say that she is a wholesaler. Her dream for the future is to buy new machinery for the shop so that it will always be active and provide the economic stability that she and her children require.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy carpentry raw materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand her grocery store.

loans.name: Osmonalieva Guljahan Group

texts.ru:
Гулжахан, 58, замужем. Ее супруг работает преподавателем по математике, зарплата составляет около $70 сом. Ее сын студент в ОшГУ, учится на первом курсе. Клиент занимается выращиванием и реализацией пщеницы. Клиентка более 20 лет занимается сельским хозяйством получает хороший доход. На второй урожай планирует посеять осеннюю капусту. Клиентка по профессии учительница. На кредит она планирует закупить минеральныее удобрения и ГСМ для культивации урожая.
