Паридахан, 48, замужем. Ее супруг работает учителем кыргызского языка. Сама также работает в школе Бостон учительницей начальных классов. Кроме этого у них есть семейный бизнес: Животноводство, откорм и перепродажа бычков. Клиентка хочет купить 2-х бычков по 10 000 сом, на 5000 сом корм для живности.

Садибархан, 52, замужем. Супруг частный водитель. Ее единственный сын находится на заработках в РФ, ежемесячно высылает минимум 200 долларов. Клиентка по профессии учительница, работает в школе Бостон, преподает узбекский язык, дополнительно занимается животноводством: откорм и разведение овец. На кредит клиент планирует закупить овец и минеральные удобрения.

Мунисхон, 51, замужем.  Супруг работает строителем. Бизнес клиентки семейный - Животноводство, откорм и перепродажа бычков.  Клиентка как и другие участники группы работает учительницей работает в школе Бостон, учительницей начальных классов, зарплата 50 долларов. Кредит будет использован на закуп строй материалов для стройки дома, уже построили фундамент.

Дилдорахон, 50, замужем. Супруг занимается извозом пассажиров - он частный водитель. У нее 3 детей: сыновьям 23,11 и 17 лет. Старший сын строитель, средний занимается животноводством, младший ходит в школу. Клиент разводит овец. На кредит планирует закупить овец для откорма и разведения, также потратить для стройки дома.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Guljahan is 58 years old, married. Her husband works as a mathematics teacher, whose salary is about 70 dollars. Her son is a first-year student at the Osh University. The client is involved in growing and selling wheat. Guljahan has been involved in agriculture for over 20 years and earns a good income. She plans to sow autumn cabbage for the second harvest. The client is a teacher by trade. She plans to use this loan to purchase mineral fertilizers and fuel for harvest cultivation. Paridahan is 48 years old, married. Her husband works as a Kyrgyz language teacher. She also works as a beginner-grade teacher at the Boston school. Besides this work, they have a family business of animal husbandry, fattening and sales of cattle. The client wants to buy 2 bulls at 10,000 som and livestock feed at 5,000 som. Sadibarhan is 52 years old, married. Her husband is a private driver. Her only son works in the Russian Federation and sends home a minimum of $200 monthly. The client is a teacher by trade and works at the Boston school, teaching Uzbek language. In addition, she is involved in animal husbandry – fattening and breeding sheep. She plans to use the loan to buy sheep and mineral fertilizers. Munishon is 51 years old, married. Her husband is a construction worker. The client’s business is a family business. They are involved in animal husbandry – fattening and resale of cattle. Just like the other group participants, the client works as a beginner-grade teacher at the Boston school. Her salary there is 50 dollars. The loan will be used for the purchase of construction materials to build a house. They already finished the foundation. Dildorahon is 50 years old, married. Her husband is involved in passenger transportation. He is a private driver. She has 3 children: sons are 23, 11 and 17 years old. The oldest son is a construction worker, middle is involved in animal husbandry, and the youngest is in school. The client breeds sheep. She plans to use the loan to buy sheep for fattening and breeding and also to build a home.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of mineral fertilizers and fuel

loans.name: Solo E Nekesa Joyce Group

texts.en:
Joyce N. is a 37-year-old, married woman with two children. In addition, she looks after four dependents, all of whom are school-age children.

To earn a living, Joyce works in the produce sector. She has been engaged in this line of business for ten years. She is now seeking a loan to purchase produce, including peas, ground nuts, and beans, for re-sale purposes. She is determined to stock more produce and to thereby expand her business. She explains that she is a hard-working businesswoman whose dream is to prosper and to construct her own house.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional produce (e.g., peas, nuts, and beans)

loans.name: Roth

texts.en:
Mr. Roth M., 30, and his wife, Mrs. Sreymouch Chorn, 30, live in a small village outside Phnom Penh. Mr Roth M. is shown in the photo. They have been married for ten years and have two children: one son and one daughter. Both of them are in school.       

Roth was hired by a relative to sell groceries. His wife has been a garment factory worker for five years. He is asking for his first loan of $200 to build a fence around his house.

loans.use: To build a fence around his house.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.fr:
Jacqueline L. B., Maman Jacky par ses amis, est une commercante âgée de 52ans, mariee et mère de 4 enfants dont l'âge varie entre 36ans et 16ans.

Elle a commencé dans la vente du poisson salé depuis 1996 avec un capital de 35000francs. Maintenant, elle est vendeuse au marché de plateau depuis 15ans. Par jour, elle vend 10000 a 25000 francs minimum.

Ce prêt va lui permettre d'élargir son activité en achétant: 2cartons de sole, 2cartons de thon, 2cartons de capitaine, et 1 carton de krovin.

Elle fait toujours un meilleur choix de la qualite de sa marchandise pour attirer ses clients et ses produits de bonne qualite ont des prix acceptables.

A l'avenir, elle veut générer plus de bénéfices afin d'epargner pour  soutenir ses enfants dans leurs etudes universitaires  et devenir femme d'affaire  en important a l'etranger et faire la vente en gros
texts.en:
Jacqueline L. B., known to her friends as Maman Jacky, is a 52-year-old retailer, maried and the mother of 4 children whose ages vary between 16 and 36 years old. She began in 1996 with a working capital amounting to 35,000 francs. She has been selling at the Plateau market for the last 15 years. Each day, she sells 10000 to 25000 francs at minimum. The loan will allow her to add to her stock by buying: two cartons of sole, two cartons of tuna, two cartons of flounder, and one carton of kronvin fish. She has always chosen good-quality merchandise to attract clients, and her good-quality stock is sold at acceptable prices. In the future, she would like to make more profits to save in order to support her children's higher education and becime a business woman who imports from abroad for wholesale.

Translated from French by Kathy Guis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Achat de cartons de poissons sale; comme sole, capitaine,Krovin; Thon.....

loans.name: Kroch

texts.en:
Kroch V., 36, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for Pre-Angkorean Temples. She sells food for an income of USD 3 per day, while her husband, a construction worker, earns an income of USD 3 per day.

Kroch is requesting a loan of USD 400 to purchase a place at a national tourist site in her province from which to sell her food. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a place at a national tourist site from which to conduct food sales

loans.name: Roda

texts.en: Roda, the wife of a plumber and mother of two children ages 13 and 16, has been operating a charcoal selling business for the last three years.  She sells in a shop as well as from her home to food stall operators, neighbors, and passersby. Roda faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business, and therefore has decided to request a KSH 30,000 loan from Yehu to start a cereal shop for which she must purchase a sack of rice, beans, and peas.  Her major goal is to open a wholesale shop in future. She rents a house with piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, rent, and electricity.  Her children both attend the local school.

loans.use: To purchase a sack of rice, beans, and peas.

loans.name: Hajara

texts.en:
Hajara owns a stall in Kalerwe market, selling bananas. She buys bunches of bananas from villages in Masaka District and uses public transport to and from making these purchases. She would like to use this loan of 1,000,000 to buy more bunches of bananas. In addition to her banana vending business, Hajara also owns motorcycles for hire and offers rental rooms. 

Hajara sells her wares to all categories of people, both in retail and wholesale. She works six days a week and makes her purchases once a week. Her business challenges include problematic transportation and dealing with the rainy season, which often makes village roads impassable. She hopes one day to own a delivery van.  

Hajara and her husband, who works as a spare parts dealer, have five children, all of whom attend school. She also takes care of her elderly parents. They live in a four-roomed house. The family has access to electricity but has no piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees, medications, and food. She aspires toward educating her children to university level. 

She decided to work with MCDT because of the low interest charged.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 31 years old and is married with two children.

He owns a furniture gallery that he took over from his immediate family and this is what has made him well-known in his local area. He has a good reputation and good manners.

He is requesting a loan of $3,000 from Kiva partner CHF-ACSI that he wants to invest in renovating his business place. He is planning to expand his business in the future.

loans.use: To invest in renovating his business place

loans.name: Virginia Elizabeth

texts.es:
Virginia de 46 años, trabaja con su esposo haciendo carreras en su camión, vive en una zona periurbana llamada “Duran” este lugar esta caracterizado por su ecología en disolución.  

Para tener un ingreso mas sostenible para su casa, Virginia y su esposo invirtieron sus ahorros en un camión para hacer carreras y fletes. Poco a poco han podido solventar su hogar, trabajan desde muy temprano hasta el anochecer. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar materiales de construcción como cemento, pinturas y bloques y así readecuar el cuarto de sus hijas. En el futuro quiere tener mas clientela para darle una mejor vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Virginia is 46 years old, and works with her husband making the rounds in his truck. She lives in an area on the urban fringe known as Duran, an area in decay. In order to have more income to maintain their household, Virginia and her husband invested their savings in a truck to make deliveries and haul freight. Little by little, they have been able to pay for their home. They work from early morning until nightfall. With the loan, she wants to buy building materials, such as cement, paint, blocks, and renovate her daughters’ room. In the future, she hopes to have a larger customer base in order to provide a better life for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cemento, pinturas, bloques

loans.name: Juan Bacilio

texts.es: El  Sr. C. es originario del municipio de Achuapa, se desempeña como técnico del mined con dos año en este cargo pero con  25 años de impartir clase en el municipio en cuanto al financiamiento es el primer crédito el cual lo  utiliza para mejoramiento de su vivienda lo que le permitirá estar en mejores condicione su familias.
texts.en: Mr. C. is from the Achuapa municipality.  He has worked as a teacher in the Ministry of Education for 2 years, but has been providing classes in the municipality for 25 years.  This is his first loan, and he intends to use it to make some improvements to his home so he and his family can live in better conditions.

loans.use: To purchase construction supplies.

loans.name: Nelma's Group

texts.en:
Nelma G. is from the village of Caluya, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is 44 years old. Nelma is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 'Calachuchi'.

Nelma is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Nelma owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling breads, cakes and cookies to the local community. Nelma has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Nelma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nelma is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the first loan taken out by Nelma from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Moyran Del Carmen

texts.es:
Hace 10 años Moyran una mujer casada y con tres hijos en las edades de 5 a 17 años, logró iniciar su emprendimiento llamado “Nuevo Milenio”, una tienda que surgió producto de la experiencia que vio en su madre  y de la necesidad de generar ingresos para salir adelante, pues  ella  y su familia, dependientes económicamente de su esposo afrontaban una crisis, pues este había quedado desempleado. Así fue como inició comprando a crédito todos su equipamiento y enseres y también los productos que vendía, siendo este su mayor desafío pues debía pagarlos en un término de quince días; La gran capacidad de trabajo y disciplina , de ella y de su esposo fueron importantes  para que desde ese mismo momento les fuera muy bien en su tienda y hasta lograra comprar la casa donde no solo Vivian sino que tenían su tienda,  el ingreso principal del hogar y el puesto de trabajo de la pareja,  que aun trabajan juntos,  y en algunas ocasiones son apoyados por su hijo mayor,  que ya  se encuentra estudiando en la universidad. Su amabilidad y buen servicio es tal, que sus clientes vienen diariamente desde muy lejos, para comprarle los bienes y mercancías que Moyran y su esposo ofrecen en su tienda y que en su mayor parte son parte de la canasta familiar y articulos de miscelanea.
Este es su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y con ello aspira a aumentar la compra  y la oferta de sus productos de contado,    pues más adelante aspira a tener su propio un local donde instalar su tienda, pues    en la actualidad funciona en la parte delantera de la casa y quiere separar su actividad productiva de su vida familiar.  Con su credikiva comprará ranchos,  víveres  licores en gran volumen, preparándose para inyectarle este capital en una época de incremento de las ventas y está contando con lograr mayores utilidades.
texts.en:
Ten years ago Moyran, a married woman with three children whose ages range from 5 to 17 years, managed to start a business called “Nuevo Milenio” (New Millennium), a store that arose from her mother’s experience and the need to earn income to get ahead because she and her family, who depended economically on her husband, were facing a crisis when he lost his job.

This is how she started out buying all her equipment, shelves and products on credit.  This was a huge challenge because she had to pay them off in two weeks.  Her capacity for work and discipline, as well as her husband’s, were vital for them to start doing well with the store immediately so much so that they even managed to buy the house they lived in and where the store was situated.

The store is their main source of income and the couple’s place of employment; they still work together.  Sometimes their oldest son helps out because he’s studying in the university.

Her kindness and good customer service is such that customers come daily even from far away to buy goods and merchandise that Moyran and her husband have in stock in their store and which, for the most part, constitute basic household items and miscellany.

This is her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and she hopes to use it to increase stock inventory taking advantages of discounts offered for cash purchases.  Later on she hopes to have a location for the store since it currently operates in the front part of her house and she’d like to separate work from family life.

She will use her Kiva funds to buy snacks, foodstuffs and liquor in large amounts preparing to inject capital during this season of higher sales hoping thereby to earn higher profits.

loans.use: She will buy snacks, foodstuffs and liquor in large amounts to inject capital during this season of increased sales.

loans.name: Antonina

texts.en:
Antonina B. is from the village of Poblacion, Aurora Zamboang Del Sur. She is 46 years old. Antonina is widowed and has 6 adult-aged children. To make a living, Antonina owns a business venture operating a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Antonina has been engaged in her business for over 28 years and earns approximately 22,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Antonina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Antonina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 40000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Antonina is requesting a new loan of 50000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the ninth loan taken out by Antonina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Ancilla

texts.en:
Ancilla is 46 years old and is married with eight children between the ages of 8 and 26. She also takes care of two dependents, who are 4 and 8 years old. Ancilla has been struggling to provide for her large family by selling drinks she makes from sorghum.

Although Ancilla has thirty years of experience in this business, her earned profits are still too low to care for her children and dependents. She has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business.  With this loan, she will purchase a large quantity of sorghum, which will help her increase the sales of her drinks.

loans.use: To buy a large quantity of sorghum to make more drinks to sell.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys C. is a 56-year-old mother from Centro Poblacion, Culasi, Antique, Philippines. She is married to Raul C., a barangay secretary. Through their industry and courage, and with the support of ASHI, some of their children have already finished college.

She is presently engaged in a piggery project. This project has helped her especially with the educational expense for her children. The effort and money that she and her husband had invested into the education of their children is worth it because they are very diligent in their studies. One of her children graduated from college with flying colors.

Gladys never tired in supporting her husband in providing for the needs of the family because she believes that someday they will reach their dreams. 

She is a pioneered member of ASHI Antique North Branch.  In addition to that, for almost 11 years of membership she has maintained good performance.  That is why she has been nominated as an outstanding member of that branch.

Presently, she has successfully paid her last loan and is now requesting a new loan of Php. 30,0000. This amount will be used to purchase piglets and feeds. She wants to have many pigs because she wants to earn more income for the future of her children who are still studying.

Her greatest dream in life is that all of her children will finished their college studies so that they will get a decent job someday. She also want to own a concrete house free from floods.

loans.use: To buy piglets and feeds

loans.name: Winifride

texts.en:
Winifride owns a restaurant and bar and has had this business for 13 years. She is 36 years old, married and has five children. All her children go to school except the youngest. Her husband works as a mason. 

Winifred will use this loan to buy more drinks, both soft and alcoholic. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to increase the sales for business growth. She wishes to be a distributor in the future.

loans.use: To buy more beer and food to use in the restaurant.

loans.name: Eduardina

texts.es: Eduardina, de 37 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Julio (38)  y sus cinco pequeños  hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida.El cultivo de plátano y café es la actividad que realiza diariamente Con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado que sus tierras sean muy productivas, lo cual ha generado que sus cultivos sean muy bien apreciados en la ciudad de Pichanaki, que es donde traslada a vender sus productos naturales. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos, lleva tres  años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos, ya que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados y la cansan mucho. Para más adelante tiene planeado  comprar nuevas tierras, para poder sembrar más.Es  el segundo préstamo de Eduardina con MFP y espera ser muy puntual en sus cuotas, puesto que no quiere darle problemas a su banco comunal, en el cual se siente muy contenta, pues sus integrantes son muy solidarios y responsables.Eduardina tiene planeado invertir los  mil soles solicitados en la compra de cantidad de  abono que necesita para mejorar la productividad de sus chacras, de esta manera espera mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en: Eduardina, age 37, is a very simple and hard-working woman. She lives in her own house, together with her husband Julio (38) and her five young children, whom she would like to provide with a better quality of life. Growing bananas and coffee is her daily work. With great effort, she has been able to make her lands very productive, so that her crops are well appreciated in the city of Pichanaki, the place where she takes her natural products to sell. What she likes most about her work is caring for her crops. She has done this work for three years, and she thinks the most difficult aspect of it is transporting her products, since the sacks she carries are very heavy, and they make her tired. For the future, she plans to buy more land so that she can expand her plantings. This is Eduardina's second loan with MFP, and she plans to be very punctual with her payments, since she does not want to cause any problems for her communal bank. She feels very happy in her communal bank, because the members are very responsible and have a strong sense of solidarity. Eduardina plans to invest the thousand Peruvian soles she is requesting in buying fertilizer in bulk, which she needs to improve the productivity of her fields, and thus she hopes to improve her earnings.

loans.use: Buying fertilizer to improve her crops

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more cosmetics

loans.name: Alphonsine

texts.fr: Aphonsine W. est  née  en RDC, elle a 45 ans, et elle est veuve.   Elle a 5 enfants, entre 24  et 12ans  les 5 de ces enfants vont à l’école.  Son niveau d’éducation est secondaire, et elle a une expérience  de remboursement des prêts, car le prêt qu’elle sollicite est le cinquième prêt.  Elle va acheter 5 fenêtres métalliques ,4 portes de planches et 1 porte métallique ,6sacs de ciments et main d’œuvre. Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire de finissage de sa maison en vue de faire la location de sa maison d’habitation.  Elle voudrait aider ses enfants à terminer ses études, et assurer le bien être de sa famille dans les temps à venir.
texts.en:
Aphonsine W. is a 45 years old widow who was born in the Democratic Republic of the Congo. She has five children, aged 12 to 24. All five attend school. She herself studied up to middle school.

She's now seeking her fifth loan, to buy 5 metal windows, 4 wooden doors, one metal door, 6 sacks of cement, and to pay for the labor. He strategy for growth is to finish building her house, in order to rent it. She would like to help her children complete their studies, and ensure the well-being of her family for the future.

loans.use: To buy 5 metal windows, 4 wooden doors, one metal door, 6 sacks of cement, and to pay for the labor

loans.name: Lycheilyn

texts.en:
Lycheilyn Q. is from the village of Tupsan, Mambajao in Camiguin Province. She is 23 years old. Lycheilyn is married and has 4 small children. To make a living, Lycheilyn sells seafood products, including fish like sardines and milkfish, in the local community. Lycheilyn's husband is a fisherman who catches fish for their business. He also trades fish as a wholesaler. Lycheilyn has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2011, Lycheilyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lycheilyn is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional fish to sell, like mackerel and salmon. This loan will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fish to resell

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel is 26, married, and has two children, ages 2 and 4. Her husband is a motorcycle taxi driver. 

For the past 3.5 years, Rachel has owned a shop where she sells household goods and food. With this loan, she will be purchasing additional rice, oil, sugar and drinks to sell. Since opening her business, Rachel has been able to buy her own home. She hopes to reinvest any profits she sees from this loan in growing her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional rice, oil, sugar and drinks to sell

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.es: La señora Maria Ester se dedica a la venta de artesanía hace más de 5 años, tiene 45 años tiene 1 hijo, menor a su cargo. Se dedica al comercio de artesanía, como jarrones, floreros, adornos entre otros. Su forma de venta es en un kiosco en donde transitan una gran variedad de clientes y también vende en su casa. Trabaja todos los días, sus productos los deja a crédito y de contado. Su mercadería la realiza diariamente y también la compra a ciertos artesanos del lugar. El financiamiento es para la compra de barro, pinturas y compra de más artículos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Ester has sold crafts for more than 5 years.  She is 45 years old and has one minor child in her care.  She sells various handicrafts, such as vases and decorations.  She sells them from a kiosk where a large variety of customers come through and also from her house.  She works every day, and sells her products by credit and cash.  She makes products herself every day and also buys it from some artisans from the area.

The loan is for the purchase of clay, paints, and to buy more products.

loans.use: Purchase of clay, paints, and more products.

loans.name: Van

texts.en:
Van, 56, is a mother of four children, one of whom is a seamstress in a garment factory, one is employed in a private company, and the others are studying in the local public school. She and her husband, Chea, are farmers who own a two-hectare plot of land where they can grow both rice and vegetables to sell to earn some money to support their family.

In the fields it is time to plow, but Van does not have enough oxen for plowing. So to solve her problem, she is applying for a loan to buy another ox.

loans.use: To buy an ox

loans.name: Reymundo Ricardo

texts.es:
Reymundo de oficio zapatero, con más de veintiún años, dando sus servicios, a sus clientes, que gracias a las experiencias ha logrado la captación de sus clientes, a si como las mejoras  a su negocio ya que, no solo repara zapatos, también hace. y gracias a Dios día a día le llega trabajo.
Ha invertido en su negocio y en mejoras a su vivienda con financiamiento que Afodenic ha dado mediante el préstamo, lo que está contento por lograr el objetivo para un bienestar familiar.
Con este nuevo préstamo hará una cera y reparación del techo, el cual cambiara catorce laminas de zinc, compra de madera, cemento, bloques, arena para comenzar la obra.
texts.en:
Reymundo is a shoemaker by trade, with more than twenty one years experience offering his services to his customers. He has been able to build up a customer base and improve his business where he not only repairs shoes, but makes them. Thank God, he gets work day to day. He has invested in his business and in home improvement with the loan that Afodenic has given him. He is happy to achieve his goal for his family's wellbeing. 

With this new loan, he will make a sidewalk and repair the roof, where he will replace fourteen zinc sheets. He will buy wood, cement, blocks, and sand to start the work.

loans.use: to invest in home improvement, in building a sidewalk, and putting on a new roof.

loans.name: María Alicia

texts.es:
Dejar su pedacito D. tierra acompañada D. su esposo, sus 4 hijos y nada más que lo que llevaban puesto, fue la situación que María Alicia C. tuvo que enfrentar cuando grupos armados los obligaron a abandonar su terreno, en el que trabajaba ella y su familia. 

Después D. esta situación y con la esperanza D. recuperarse D. este duro golpe, esta emprendedora mujer inició con su esposo un negocio propio D. verduras, productos D. la canasta familiar, snacks y hasta venta D. minutos a celular. Es así como éste se ha convertido en su única fuente D. sustento y aunque María Alicia no olvida su procedencia considera que ha sido bendecida por poder seguir adelante. 

María Alicia sueña con ampliar su negocio hasta ser vendedora mayorista, así mismo con tener una vejez tranquila en la que la parte económica no sea una limitante. Para lograrlo y seguir luchando, esta emprendedora necesita D. un préstamo para realizar algunas adecuaciones locativas en su negocio y comprar mayor variedad D. verduras, dulces y productos D. la canasta familiar que le permitan incrementar sus ventas y mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Having to leave her small plot of land, accompanied by her husband and four children, with nothing more than what they had on their backs, was the situation in which María Alicia C. found herself when armed gangs forced her to leave the land that she and her family worked on.

Following this situation, and with the hope of being able to recover from this hard blow, this enterprising woman, together with her husband, set up her own business selling vegetables, basic household groceries, snacks and even cell phone minutes.  This has now become her only source of support and, although María Alicia doesn't forget how her business came about, she considers herself to have been blessed as she has been able to move on and get ahead.

María Alicia dreams of expanding her business and becoming a wholesaler.  She also dreams of a peaceful old age in which she is not restricted by her financial situation.  In order to achieve this and continue fighting, this entrepreneur needs a loan so that she can make some structural changes to her business premises and buy a wider variety of vegetables, sweet treats and basic household groceries which will allow her to increase her sales and improve her income.

loans.use: to make some structural changes to her business premises and to buy a wider variety of vegetables, sweet treats and basic household groceries

loans.name: Marsel

texts.en:
Marsel was born in Ljevan City in 1982. He is married and has a five year old son and a two year old daughter. His wife stays at home and takes care of their children.  

Since 2000 Marsel has been running his own business. He produces shoes in his home’s basement and sells them in the Ljevan market and distributes his shoes to other businessmen. Also Marsel takes orders for shoes production. He sells ready-made shoes from a rented stall in the Ljevan market. Marsel purchases materials and domestically produced shoes from Yerevan.  

Thanks to his business profit Marsel has able to keep his young family and he bought necessary furniture for his home. This is Marsel’s 5th loan from Nor Horizon and now he is asking for a 750.000 AMD loan to buy shoes assortment to resell and to buy materials (leather, shoe soles, etc.) for his shoes production.

loans.use: To buy shoe assortments to resell and to buy materials (leather, shoe soles, etc.) for his shoes production.

loans.name: Gloria Elena

texts.es:
Gloria es una madre de familia de 38 años de edad, ella tiene  03 hijos menores de edad a su cargo. Vive en casa propia con su esposos e hijos, dicha casa está ubicada en la Caserío Pueblo Libre, en el distrito de Tambogrande en Piura. Gloria vive en la parte rural de este distrito y no cuenta con los servicios básicos.

Gloria se dedica a la venta de ropa, la cual compra en Tambogrande, dicha mercadería la vende desde su domicilio a sus vecinos de su caserío y de los alrededores. También se dedica a la crianza de animales menores, los cuales al alcanzar tamaño y peso ideal los comercializa en el mercado local. Cuenta con una experiencia de 2 años en este rubro.

Gloria está solicitando un préstamo de  500 nuevos soles para que pueda comprar mercadería en otra ciudad a mejores precios, de esta manera ofrecer sus productos a precios más bajos, de esta manera ella desea captar más clientela, para lograr mayor margen de ganancia.

Gloria es una mujer bastante trabajadora y que se esfuerza a diario por salir adelante y tener una mejor calidad de vida. Las personas que lo conocen le consideran una persona  amable y siempre dispuesta a ayudar a los demás.
texts.en:
Gloria is a mother who is 38 years of age and has three young children under her care. She lives with her husband and children in their own home in the village of Pueblo Libre, which in the District of Tambogrande in Piura. Gloria lives in the rural section of the district and does not receive basic services.

Gloria sells clothing that she purchases in Tambogrande. She sells this merchandise from her home to her neighbors in her village and from the surrounding areas. Gloria also raises small animals. Once the animals have reached the ideal size and weight, she sells them at the local market. She has two years of experience in this trade.

Gloria is requesting a loan in the amount of 500 PEN so that she can buy merchandise in another city at better prices. This will allow her to offer her products at lower prices, attract more customers, and generate a higher profit margin.

Gloria is a hardworking woman who strives each day to move forward and improve her quality of life. The people who know her consider her to be a friendly person who is always willing to help others.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married. For the past three years, Rosemarie has operated a shop where she sells eggs, noodles, and detergent. 

Rosemarie has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. She is requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages. In the future, Rosemarie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Adela

texts.en: Adela lives in the town of El Paraiso in southern Honduras with her husband and school-age daughter. She has operated a small bakery for 11 years, making and selling cakes, breads, cookies, and pastries. Adela is requesting a loan of 10,000 Honduran lempira (HNL) to purchase cooking ingredients.

loans.use: to purchase eggs, milk, butter, sugar, yeast, cornmeal, and flour

loans.name: Asela

texts.en:
Asela is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a "trisikad" transport business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy tools and equipment for her "trisikad" transport business.

Asela has been in this business for three years. She earns more income from food vending.

Asela has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy equipment for her "trisikad".

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
From Uganda, Janet is married and has three children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of her elderly parents. Janet rents her home. She has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food for the family.

Janet sells charcoal at the market. She has done so for over ten years, and she works six days a week. Transportation and seasonality are her main challenges.

Janet has requested a loan of 1,300,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a delivery van, to sell on a wholesale basis only and to buy a plot of land so that she can build her own house .

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Puma Group

texts.en:
A., who is in his mid-20s, is married and has one child who is going to school.  He has been selling second-hand clothes for three years now. He works from 5:30 am to 7:30 p.m daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be his 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which he wants to use to buy more second-hand clothes to sell door-to-door. His dream is to one day own a shop where he can sell new clothes and shoes.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Puma" which has a total of 19 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy more second-hand clothes to sell

loans.name: Gantsetseg

texts.en:
Gantsetseg is a 21-year-old young woman who lives with her family, including her father, mother, a younger sister and a younger brother all together in their own house in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 

While she could not get an education related to business, Gantsetseg has a sensitivity of successful business activity. Therefore she is planning to open a grocery store beside her house. It is absolutely beneficial and important to her family income. She is going to manage her store with her mother together. Gantsetseg requested a loan to purchase the food commodities necessary to start the activity of the store.

loans.use: to purchase the food commodities necessary to start a store.

loans.name: Moises

texts.es:
Moises  tiene 37 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de San José que pertenece a la provincia de Chiclayo.  Esta zona la actividad que desarrollan es la pesca, agricultura y ganadería.

Moises desde hace varios años se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado vacuno (vaca), su corral se encuentra en la parte externa de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada y pastos naturales para que tenga una buena producción de leche, la que ofrece a los mismos pobladores de la zona o lo lleva a vender al mercado de Chiclayo y Lambayeque, cuenta con clientela fija por la buena calidad de leche que tiene, con sus ingresos solventa sus obligaciones familiares.  

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3000 nuevos soles para comprar más alimentos balanceados y realizar algunos arreglos en su fundo, al estar bien alimentadas se incrementará la producción de la leche de vaca y así podrá ofrecerlo aun mejor precio para poder cubrir su crédito otorgado y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Moises es una persona trabajadora y responsable que lo único que quiere es que con el negocio que tiene poderle brindar a sus hijos otras oportunidades académicas.
texts.en:
Moisés, 37, lives with his wife and children in his own house, which has only electricity and is located in the rural area of the district of San José, in the province of Chiclayo.  The activities in this area are fishing, agriculture, and livestock.

Moisés has raised cattle for several years.  The pen is outside his house.  He feeds the animals balanced feed and natural grasses so he will get good milk production.  He offers the milk to the residents of the area or takes it to the market in Chiclayo and Lambayeque to sell.  He has a steady clientele because of the good quality of his milk.  With his income he pays for all his family obligations.

Moisés has requested a loan of 3000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa to buy additional balanced feed and to make some repairs on his farm.  When the cows are well fed, the milk production will increase.  In this way he will be able to get a better price to be able to cover his loan and improve his family's quality of life.  Moisés is a hardworking and responsible person who, with his business, only wants to be able to offer his children other academic opportunities.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for his animals and make some repairs on his farm.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is 25 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 
Tessie has a retail shop where she sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell.
Tessie is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Tessie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr:
Ablavi est une femme âgée de 43 ans. Elle est divorcée et mère de 3 enfants.
Ablavi travaille comme une revendeuse depuis 2004. Elle est à la fois restauratrice, revendeuse de maïs et d’haricot à toutes les personnes nécessiteuses dans un quartier.  Elle achète ses produits auprès des grossistes de Lomé. Son véritable problème du moment est sa faible capacité financière.
Ablavi a requis son troisième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des sacs de maïs et d’haricot, des produits nécessaires à la restauration. Elle pense utiliser les profits supplémentaires de ses activités pour offrir une bonne éducation aux enfants. 
Dans les prochaines années, Ablavi voudrait agrandir son commerce. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit  rendre sa famille heureuse.
texts.en:
Ablavi is 43 years old,  divorced and the mother of 3 children. She has been working as a retailer since 2004, selling corn and beans to customers in her area, and also owns a restaurant. She buys her products from the wholesalers in Lomé but is currently suffering from a lack of adequate funds.

Ablavi is requesting her third loan from WAGES in order to buy bags of corn and beans that she needs for her business. She plans to use any additional profits she earns to pay for her children´s education. Over the next few years, she wants to expand her business and plans to use the profits to make her family happy.

loans.use: to restock on cereal, etc.

loans.name: Fatima Del Rosario

texts.es: Fátima Del Rosario tiene 44 años, su actividad es la venta y destace de cerdo. Hace más de 10 años que tiene este negocio, ella tiene ciertas dificultades como es el tiempo pues tiene que realizar los quehaceres del hogar además de esto tiene que dedicarse a su negocio pero la amplia experiencia obtenida le ha brindado la ayuda para mejorar cada día. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de cerdos.
texts.en: Fatima Del Rosario is 44 years old, and she has a business butchering and selling pigs.  She has had this business for more than 10 years.  She faces certain difficulties, such as managing her time, because she must carry out the household chores as well as dedicating herself to this business.  However, the ample experience that she has obtained in this line of work helps her to improve each day.  The reason she is taking this loan is so that she can buy some pigs.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is married, with 4 children. Maribel is 30 years old and lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental.  Maribel has a general store and has had this business for 2 years. Each month, she earns PHP 3,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 30,000PHP  to purchase stock for her general store.
Maribel has been a member of PMPC for 2 years.  In the future, Maribel hope to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase stock for her general store

loans.name: Yasmin Elizabeth

texts.es:
Yasmin, vive con un hijo, con su madre y una hermana, Yasmin administra una sala de belleza, atendiendo en el local y a domicilio, no tiene un horario definido, todo depende de la demanda.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de tintes, esmaltes, labiales, maquillajes, tratamientos para el cabello, una maquina de cortar cabello, con este préstamo podrá mejorar la capacidad que en la actualidad tiene el negocio, dejándole una mayor rentabilidad y mayor preferencia de los clientes.
Las aspiración de ella es convertir su negocio más amplio, capacitarse más en este oficio para mejorar los servicios a la clientela, por su familia espera proveerles lo necesario y velar por que su hijo tenga lo necesario para su desarrollo.
texts.en:
Yasmin lives with a son, her mother and a sister.  Yasmin runs a beauty salon taking care of customers both in the salon and in their homes; she does not have a fixed work schedule, everything depends on demand.

She’s asking for a loan to buy hair color, nail polish, lipstick, make-up, hair treatments and a hair clipper.  With this loan she’ll be able to improve the business’ capacity producing higher profits and more preference by the customers.

Her hope is to expand the business and to train more in this occupation to improve the service she provides customers.  She hopes to provide her for family and see that her son has everything needed for his development.

loans.use: to buy hair coloring, nail polish, lipstick and make-up.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es:
El señor Raquel, tiene 58 años de edad, tiene 4 hijos,  reside en  una Comunidad rural del Municipio de Siguatepeque, Comayagua.
Su núcleo familiar esta compuesto por su esposa y sus 4 hijos (25, 22, 18 y 13 años),, actualmente 2 de sus hijos están estudiando la educación primaria y secundaria.
La actividad económica a que se dedica es a la agricultura (producción de maíz y frijoles), desde joven aprendió a trabajar la tierra con sus padres.
Ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de insumos (fertilizantes y productos para el control de plagas y enfermedades).
 Piensa que brindándole un buen manejo a sus cultivos, la cantidad de cosecha será mayor y aumentaran sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Raquel, 58, has four children.  He lives in a rural community in Siguatepeque Municipality, Comayagua.  His nuclear family is composed of his wife and four children (25, 22, 18 and 13 years old).  At present, two of his children are attending elementary and secondary school.

His economic activity is farming (bean and corn production). He learned to work the land from his parents when he was still a boy.  He has asked for a loan to buy farm supplies (fertilizer and products to manage pests and illnesses).  He believes that by providing better management to his crops harvests will be larger and so will his income.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies (fertilizer and pesticide).

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is a married mother. She is 56 years old and has 7 children.

Susana owns and operates a business venture, selling a variety of different products in the local community.  She has 5 years of experience in this business. Susana needs a loan of Samoan Talas (WST) 2,700 to purchase additional products to sell.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 WST or US $125 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Susana joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Susana's 6th loan with SPBD. 



*SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers.  Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale out of 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is) and these are averaged for the "overall social metric score."  For example, a 3 out of 3 on "level of education" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university.  

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Karla Johana

texts.es: Karla está solicitando el préstamo para pagar un programa de especialización de su carrera de administración de empresas, el programa de especialidad es en dirección de Marketing. Su mamá la apoya con los gastos de escuela. Por el apoyo y fortaleza que su familia ha representado es que ella ha podido luchar para terminar su carrera. Es una joven con sueños, anhelos, con espítiu de empresaria, y espera en un futuro poder dar empleos a jóvenes que también lo necesitan, ya que sus planes son poner una pequeña empresa que lepermita tener un mejor nivel de vida
texts.en: Karla is asking for this loan in order to pay for a business management course in marketing.  Her mother helps her with her school expenses.  The support and encouragement she gets from her family have allowed her to work hard to finish her studies.  She is a young woman with dreams, desires, and entrepreneurial spirit, and she hopes to be able to create jobs for young people who need them in the future.  She plans to set up a small company that will allow her to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to pay tuition for a marketing course.

loans.name: Nelson Jesus

texts.es: Nelson Jesús, tiene la edad  de 19 años, está soltero y  vive con sus padres actualmente. El con el crédito pretende comprar los insumos como abonos y herbicidas para la asistencia de su cafetal. El actualmente alquila un terreno sembrado de café en producción y necesita una pequeña mejora para poder cosechar en óptimas condiciones este año. El quiere sacarle al terreno el máximo de provecho y poder generar ganancias para salir adelante con el crédito y mejorar su estabilidad económica y a su vez establecer un ahorro para su futuro. También quiere ayudarles a sus padres con los gastos del hogar.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Nelson Jesús, 19, is single and lives with his parents. With this loan he plans to buy inputs like compost and herbicides to help his coffee plantation. He currently rents a piece of land that is planted with coffee and it needs some improvements to be able to have an optimal harvest this year. He wants to get as much from the land as he can so that he can earn money to pay off the loan and improve his financial stability. He also wants to start saving for his future, and to help his parents with their household expenses. 

This is his first loan from FUDECOSUR. He hadn't ever received a loan from a bank before, but FUDECOSUR made it easy to get one, and the interest rate was much lower.

loans.use: to increase his coffee plantation's production.

loans.name: Lourdes Yanina

texts.es:
La señora Lourdes tiene 42 años de edad, esta casada y tiene dos hijos, Lourdes se dedica desde hace 2 años a la venta de golosinas como ser: tacos, enchiladas, tajaditas, yuca, y pastelitos, su negocio esta ubicado en una zona muy transitada, tiene muchos clientes ya que sus golosinas son sabrosas y los precios son muy buenos, ademas esta el trato especial que ella les da a sus clientes.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar los alimentos para la preparacion de sus deliciosas golosinas.
Su sueño es graduar a sus hijos de la universidad.
texts.en:
Lourdes is 42 hers old, is married, and has two children.  Lourdes has been selling treats for two years such as: tacos, enchiladas, fried plantains, yucca, and cakes.  Her business is located in a busy area.  She has many customers since her treats are tasty and the prices are very good.  Besides, she gives her customers special treatment.
She will use the loan to buy ingredients for the preparation of her delicious treats.
Her dream is for her children to graduate from the university.

loans.use: to buy tortillas, yucca, plantains, potatoes, meat, chicken, lard, oil, condiments, cabbage, onions, tomatoes, and limes

loans.name: G5 Group

texts.fr: G5 est un groupe  est composé de quatre personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Edith, la représentante du groupe(celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 35 ans n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Edith est mariée à un boucher nommé Sylvain. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Edith vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les différentes charges de ménage sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Edith vend des savons et des pâtes alimentaires de façon ambulante depuis dix ans. Edith s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire sa clientèle, Edith sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe G5, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des savons et des pâtes alimentaires.

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en:
Roseline lives in the town of Chitungwiza, north of Harare, together with her husband who works as a local transport operator.  They have 5 children, the 3 eldest of whom have now started school.

Roseline is determined that her children will have access to a good education. In 2013, she established a tuck shop in her local community, to supplement the family income to cover school fees and other expenses. 

The shop has been doing well, given its excellent location close to many homes and businesses. But Roseline can see great potential for expansion, especially with the rapid growth in the local area. 

With her loan, Roseline will invest in stock for the business: groceries, fresh produce and toiletries, which she is confident will be popular locally. In due course, she also plans to purchase poultry to produce eggs for sale in the shop.  Roseline's business will make a critical contribution to paying for her children’s education and supporting the family.

loans.use: To purchase stock for her tuck shop such as groceries, fresh produce and toiletries in order to expand the business

loans.name: Emmah

texts.en:
She grew up in her rural village in Kisii County, Western Kenya. The 23 year old, she is the second born in a family of six siblings. Her dad passed on when she was in lower primary and her mother took her to a local public school where she pursued her primary education. Her uncle supported her in her secondary education before he retired and he could not be able to support her any further. Her mother practices farming in their small piece of land which is not even enough to produce food for the family. Being a single a mother she was not able to raise school fees for the whole family which forced other siblings to drop out of school after primary Education.   

Her’s dream is to become a teacher. She began her first job in Digital Divide Data (DDD) after completing her secondary Education where she works as a Data Management Operator.  She Works in the morning at DDD where she gets her salary for her up keep and receives partial scholarship of 350 dollars from DDD which is not enough to cover for her school fees. She requires a loan of 500 dollars which will enable her complete her Degree course by the end of 2018.

She acknowledges the value of Education for it will enable her to better her life and support her siblings to continue with their Education. She also want to empower community members through education especially the girl child.

loans.use: TO PAY FOR TUITION FEES

loans.name: Boris

texts.en:
Boris J. is 55 years old. He has worked as a mechanic in a machinery-construction plant for over 25 years.

After the plant was closed Boris started an own business. He found a machine repair workshop. Four years later Boris J. bought a hall which he set as a grocery and this became his main business. The grocery is situated right to the city bus station. Boris’s wife has own business. She runs an accounting office.

For full equipment of his grocery Boris J. needs two professional refrigerators and air-conditioning. The loan amount is $ 2 000

loans.use: To buy two professional refrigerators and air-conditioning

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice has been running her business since 1993, having dropped out of school due to a lack of school fees. She is married and has four children who are going to school. She started her business with $100 of capital. She has been trained in business management and loan use by Rafode. 

Given the funds, she wants to buy wholesale stock to reduce the cost, as buying them at retail leaves a small profit margin. This will enable her to also serve other surrounding markets, thereby increasing her income.

loans.use: business expansion

loans.name: Dan

texts.en: The father is blind and his daughter just work as a day laborer. They must provide food and school fees for 4 family’s members.Their per capita monthly income is low at $9, so they want to borrow $75 to buy a steer to raise  and they will pay back this money  during 7 months.

loans.use: cow husbandry

loans.name: Nohemy

texts.es:
Señora P. is married and a mother of two school-aged children. Education is very important to her and she has created a library where many kids come to learn to read and write and begin using computers. She is requesting a loan because she wants to buy more books so the kids can have a great variety of readings. She plans to invest the other part of the loan in the purchase of two computers and seats, in order to offer more comfort to her clients. She hopes that the loan will allow her to increase her income and attract more clients to her library.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

La Sra. P. es casada y madre de 2 niños en edad escolar, para ella es muy importante la educación y ha creado una biblioteca a la que asisten muchos niños para aprender a leer y a escribir y para iniciarse en el uso de las computadoras. Está solicitando el crédito ya que quiere comprar más libros para que los niños cuenten con una gra variedad de lectura y también piensa invertir otra parte en la compra de 2 computadoras y asientos para brindarle mayor comodidad a sus clientes. Espera que el crédito le permita incrementar sus ingresos y atraer más clientes a su biblioteca.

loans.use: Books, computers, and furniture for her library

loans.name: Josefa Patricia

texts.es:
Josefa is a 23-year-old married mother of two. She and her husband have had a carpentry business making doors and windows with designed iron and wood for the past seven years. Their customers live in San Cristóbal and the surrounding areas. On top of that, Josefa also makes crafts like tablecloths, napkins and embroidered blanks that she sells to downtown vendors who then resell the items to tourists. With the loan, she plans to purchase wood and iron for the carpentry business and thread and fabric for her handicrafts.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

JOSEFA, esta casada , tiene 23 años , 2 hijos ,junto con su esposo tienen un negocio de balconería y carpintería ( hacen puertas , ventanas de hierro con diseños y de madera ) desde hace 7 años , sus clientes vienen de la ciudad de San Cristóbal y alrededores además ella realiza trabajos de artesanía tales como manteles , servilletas , mantas bordadas y los vende en el pueblo mas cercano a los mayoristas quienes después se lo revenden a los turistas de la zona. Pertenece al grupo Fátima 5. Con el préstamo espera invertir en la compra de madera y hierro para la balconería y además hilo y géneros para sus artesanías.

loans.use: Purchase wood, iron, fabric and thread

loans.name: Victorious

texts.en: Mrs. Victorious A. is 38 years old, married with a child, and lives in Benin City, Delta State. She sells cloth and ceramic plates. She started her business in 2005 and is applying for a loan of $1175 to enable her buy more cloth and plates for sale. She is a dedicated member of LAPO and is grateful for your help.

loans.use: To buy more cloth, ceramic plates for sale

loans.name: Sokheng

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokheng C. (age 49) and her family live in a small village across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers north of Phnom Penh. Sokheng and her husband (age 53) have been married since 1976 and have six children, four of whom still live at home. The two younger ones study in secondary school in the village and two older ones study in college in Phnom Penh.

Sokheng is requesting this, her first loan from Maxima, to purchase thread for weaving; to buy finished cloth from other weavers for re-sale in Phnom Penh; and to help her son expand his jewelry business. She has been weaving, a skill she learned from her mother, for about thirty years. Five years ago she started buying finished cloth from other villagers for re-sale at the large markets in Phnom Penh.

Sokheng's son (see photo) learned to make jewelry in Phnom Penh. He now produces it at home and sells the finished pieces to middlemen in Phnom Penh. Their main goal is to continue growing their businesses so the remaining kids in school can go on studying. Sokheng also wants to continue saving so they can buy a semi-automatic power loom.

loans.use: To purchase materials for weaving; to buy finished woven cloth for re-sale; and to buy tools and materials to expand her son’s jewelry business

loans.name: Agness

texts.en: Agness, age 20, is married with 2 children, ages 3 and 6. She has a business selling fruits which she started 6 months ago. She sells fruits from 1pm to 9pm daily and now makes a monthly profit of about $80. She requests a loan to buy more fruit stock.

loans.use: To buy fruit inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Javier wants to invest in clothing and appliances for his and his wife's businesses

loans.name: Miguel De Los Santos

texts.es:
Miguel is a 33-year-old man that lives in Ticuantepe, where he harvests pineapples and bananas. Miguel had the fortune to marry a woman of the region. She is hard-working and with an obvious impetus to succeed. When Miguel and his wife do not have harvests of their own, his wife purchases produce from other farmers and using her wicker basket she sells the products from house to house, and even at the local market. The couple has two children, who do not lack school education or the example of hard-working parents. As good farmers, Miguel and his wife know that this is the time to give the adequate maintenance to their crop in order to assure the quality of their product, and this is why they need this loan, to buy the necessary supplies for the maintenance of their pineapple harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Antonella Sacconi, Kiva Volunteer.

Miguel es un hombre de 33 años de edad que habita en Ticuantepe donde cosecha 1 manzanas de piña y dos de plátano. Tiene la fortuna de estar casado con una mujer de la región, trabajadora y con ímpetu de superación por lo que cuando no tienen cosecha propia su esposa compra a otros productores y sale a vender en canasto de casa en casa, de venta en venta y hasta en los mercados. Tienen 2 hijos preadolescentes a quienes no les falta para sus educación escolar ni le falta ejemplo de trabajo de sus padres, como buenos agricultores saben que esta es la época de darle mantenimiento a sus cosecha para tener calidad en su producto por lo que necesitan este préstamo para comprar los insumos para mantenimiento de piña.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizers

loans.name: Joan

texts.en: Joan has a 15-year-old crafts shop in Crafts Africa on Buganda Road, where she sells art and crafts to her customers, who are mostly foreigners and the community people. She is 62 years old with 5 children, as she caters to grandchildren and cousins as well. She needs a loan to enable her to buy more crafts, although she makes some of them herself, as well as help to look after her home. She is a member of Committed Women in Development, a lending group that has helped in instilling the discipline of saving and teamwork among its members.

loans.use: Joan needs a loan to enable her to buy more crafts for her shop, as well as buying the material for the crafts she makes herself, to enable her look after her home.

loans.name: Mwajuma's Tujibe Moyo Group

texts.en:
MwaJ. is divorced and takes care of her three children (ages 10, 7 and 5). She makes a living by selling food at her small cafe, where she works from 8 A.M. to 5 P.M. daily. From this business, which she started just 8 months ago, she makes a monthly profit of about $70.

MwaJ. hopes for a loan to purchase more food items for her cafe. She will share this loan with her subgroup, members of loan group Tujibe Moyo. The members of this loan group guarantee one another in paying back their loans. .

loans.use: To buy more food items for her cafe

loans.name: José Santos

texts.es:
Jose Santos is a man who has for many years worked very hard to improve conditions for himself and his family. He has attempted to do so by improving his home, which for some years has been in a state of disrepair and today requires immediate reconstruction.

We can't ignore the fact that Jose Santos has begun to reconstruct his home and has done part of his construction already but he is not yet done with the roof and walls. It is for this reason that he is seeking assistance from Ceprodel, so that he can get the credit necessary for the purchase of construction materials and thus continue the reconstruction of his house. Actually, he has already possessed three loans from Ceprodel, all of which were paid in time as established by the agreement.

Translated from the Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

José Santos es un caballero que desde hace varios años ha laborado muy fuertemente con el propósito de mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su humilde familia por medio del mejoramiento de su vivienda el cual desde hace varios años ha estado muy maltratada y hoy en día merece ser reconstruida de inmediato.

No podemos pasar por alto que el señor José Santos ha iniciado a reconstruir su casa de habitación y ha avanzado con parte de su construcción pero aun le hace falta en lo referente a techo y pared. Es por este motivo que él acude a Ceprodel para recibir el crédito necesario para la compra de sus materiales de construcción y de esta manera continuar con su reconstrucción de su vivienda. Actualmente posee tres créditos con Ceprodel pagados en tiempo y forma de acuerdo a lo establecido.

loans.use: Purchasing construction materials

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia O. sells provisions, food products and soft drinks. She has been in business for the past three years, having learned the skills by herself. Lydia is 47-years-old and has six children.

She has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past two years. This loan will enable her to buy more food products and soft drinks to increase her sales and grow her business.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and food products

loans.name: Rehema's Hidaya Njema Group

texts.en:
Rehema is a married woman with 4 children aged 13, 11, 9, and 5. She began selling charcoal, firewood, and coconuts in 2002. Every day, she works from 7am to 10pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Rehema now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal, firewood, and coconuts for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses selling clothes and bricks.

loans.use: To buy more inventory.

loans.name: Seng

texts.en: Mrs. Seng S. is a villager in Preak Ta Ong Ti Pie Village in Kandal Province. She is a mat maker and her husband, Mr. Ong Saophornarith, is a teacher who makes $30 per month.  Mrs. Seng S. faces a problem with her business because she does not have a sewing machine, which she needs to sew the edge of the mats. Therefore, Mrs. Seng S. has decided to ask for a loan to purchase a sewing machine. Mrs. Seng S. is 43 years old and the mother of four children who all attend high school. Her husband is to the right of the photo.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine to sew the edge of the mats.

loans.name: Las Unidas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se conformó en fecha 04 de agosto del 2008, resultado de promociones hechas por la asesora en la zona. Dicho grupo fue organizado gracias a que la Sra. Delia González de González, quien se dedica a la venta de comidas, se comunicó posteriormente con la asesora, comunicando que logró conformar un grupo de 15 mujeres, quienes ahora se encuentran trabajando con el programa del Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras.

El grupo eligió el nombre de “Las Unidas”, ya que todas ellas son amigas y vecinas.

Las integrantes del Comité “LAS UNIDAS” se dedican a diferentes actividades tales como se detallan a continuación:

1-Esmilce González. Venta de productos de limpieza.

2-Delia de González. Venta de comidas.

3-Norma González. Venta de comidas.

4-Clara García. Venta de ropas.

5-Estelvina González. Venta de remedios refrescantes.

6-Rocío González. Venta de remedios refrescantes.

7-Mirian S.. Venta de carne.

8-Graciela A.. Venta de cosméticos.

9-Delia G. González. Venta de comidas.

10-Mirian González. Venta de remedios refrescantes.

11-Flora A.. Venta de frutas y verduras.

12-Brígida Sánchez. Venta de remedios refrescantes.

13-Basilisa F.. Despensa.

14-Soledad C.. Costurera.

15-Marta S.. Venta de tortas.

Todas ellas realizan actividades para recaudar fondos para el bien común del grupo. El grupo trabaja en forma conjunta, demuestran compañerismo y solidaridad.
texts.en:
This group was formed on August 4, 2008 resulting from the promotional works of the local partner adviser. The group was organized by Delia G. de G. who has made a living by selling groceries. She contacted the adviser, communicating that she had organized the group of 15 women who now work for the program called “Committee of Women Entrepreneurs”. The group named themselves “Las Unidas” as these women were already friends and neighbors. The committee members of “Las Unidas” are pursuing a variety of activities, such as the following detailed below: 1-Esmilce González. Sale of cleaning products. 2-Delia de González. Sale of groceries. 3-Norma González. Sale of groceries. 4-Clara García. Sale of clothing. 5-Estelvina González. Sale of drinking teas and herbs. 6-Rocío González. Sale of drinking teas and herbs. 7-Mirian S.. Sale of meat 8-Graciela A.. Sale of cosmetics 9-Delia G. González. Sale of groceries 10-Mirian González. Sale of drinking teas and herbs. 11-Flora A.. Sale of fruits and vegetables. 12-Brígida Sánchez. Sale of drinking teas and herbs. 13-Basilisa F.. Sale of groceries. 14-Soledad C.. Seamstress 15-Marta S.. Sale of sandwiches. All of the women pursue these activities to bring about the common wellbeing of the group. This group works as a team, demonstrating camaraderie and solidarity.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials for the production of cleaning products, food preparation, clothes (t-shirts, blouses, wallets, etc.), drinking teas and herbs, fabric to make clothes, fruits and vegetables, ingredients for making sandwiches, cosmetics, groceries (rice, sugar, herbs, pastries, candy, dairy products, etc.), meat, etc.

loans.name: Ti

texts.en: Mrs. Ti C. is a villager in Srey Chey Village in Takeo Province. She is 36 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom are attending the local school. She owns a small piece of land and cultivates rice. Her husband, Mr. Chhil Chha, works in a print shop and earns part of the income for their family. Although Mrs. Ti C. and her husband both work, they still cannot support their family well. Thus, Mrs. Ti C. would like a loan of $500 to buy a cow for breeding. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions after selling the cow. Her husband is shown with her in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Gloria Fransisca

texts.es:
La señora Gloria Francisca R. M. tiene la edad de 57 años, su estado civil es casada, Doña Gloria tiene 2 hijas a su cargo su hija mayor tiene la edad de 38 años y acaba de recibirse como ingeniera en sistemas y no labora recientemente su otra hija tiene la edad de 39 años ella no labora y es secretaria bilingüe, su compañero de vida no labora, los propósitos  que tiene es de ayudar a sus hijas para que puedan administrar un negocio y así independizarse de ella y cada una trabaje por cuenta propia para que en futuro no tengan la necesidad de seguir con su mama. 




La ubicación de su negocio es en león, la dirección es la siguiente auto lote de occidente 1.c al sur 1c abajo Rpto aracely Pérez, su actividad económica es una pulpería donde vende lo siguiente: golosinas, cuadernos, lapiceros y jugos, el tiempo que tiene de tener este negocio es de 8 años, ella inicia este negocio por cuenta propia y al encontrarse en la necesidad de obtener un trabajo y empezó con un estante grande y al paso del tiempo fue incrementándose y así obtuvo lo que es su pulpería hoy, el motivo de su financiamiento es para la compra de juguetes y ropa debido a que se aproximan las temporadas festivas  así ofrecerá a sus clientes los diversos productos que exhibirá en su venta para que este le siga generando ingresos para su familia y ella misma.
texts.en:
Gloria, 57, is married and has 2 daughters. The oldest just qualified as a systems engineer but hasn't worked recently. Her other daughter is a bilingual secretary but isn't working. Her partner doesn't work. Her goal is to help her daughters set up a business and become independent so that they no longer have to depend on their mother. Her business is located in Leon. It's a small grocery where she sells: snacks, notebooks, pens and cold drinks. She's had the business for 8 years. She started the business because she needed work. She's built it from little more than a large stall, growing it over time into the store that it is today. The purpose of the loan is to buy toys and clothes for the upcoming holiday season. The money will allow her to offer her customers various products so that she can continue to earn an income for both her family and herself.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Mirmen Pashtoan

texts.en:
Mirmen Pashtoan lives in district 8 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is married with 4 children; two of them are married and the other two are single, but Pashtoan wants her son to marry and she is faced with some economic problems concerning his wedding. When she found AFSG, she was really very happy and after completing documents she applied for a loan.

Pashtoan wants to take out an individual loan of 50,000 Afghani with a term of 12 months to buy the necessities for the wedding of her son so her son can marry as soon as possible. She wants to say that after this wedding, she is sure that she can repay this loan on time.

She is very happy with this process of small loans; she said it is a great program of loans in Afghanistan. Everyone can use these loans and she would like to thank the people around the world that help people of this country.

loans.use: To buy necessities for her son's wedding

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Trần Thị Hương  năm nay 36  tuổi,  Chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1998.  Trước khi tham gia Quỹ tình thương do thiếu vốn nên chị Hương chỉ  đầu tư vốn để buôn bán rau nhưng sau khi có thêm nguồn vốn vay của Quỹ tình thương chị Hương đã đầu tư vốn để kinh doanh hàng tạp hóa và nuôi cá. Công việc kinh doanh và chăn nuôi đã đem lại cho gia đình chị Hương nguồn thu nhập ổn 2.000.000đ/ tháng.
