Ngoài ra hàng tháng gia đình chị còn có thêm nguồn thu từ lương làm thợ xây của chồng với thu nhập 2.000.000đ/ tháng.
Vòng vốn tới chị Hương mong muốn được vay 15.000.000đ  một phần chị sử dụng để mua cá giống về nuôi, phần còn lại chị sử dụng đầu tư mua thêm các mặt hàng kẹo, bánh... phục vụ nhu cầu tiêu dùng của bà con trong dịp Tết.
texts.en:
Trần Thị Hương is 36 years old, a TYM fund member since 1998. Before joining TYM, she did not have capital to start any business so her income came solely from selling vegetables. With TYM fund, she opened a grocery store and started farming fish. These 2 businesses bring in 2.000.000 VND a month for her. Her husband works as a construction worker with a salary of 2.000.000 VND a month. For this loan cycle, she wishes to borrow 15.000.000 VND to buy breeding fishes and merchandise (candies, cookies ...etc) for her grocery store to get ready for Tet

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy merchandise for grocery store

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
This is Zainab M.. Zainab was born in Sanda, about eighteen miles from Makeni. She is thirty-eight years of age. She is married to a businessman. They have five children together, all of whom are still pupils. Zainab sells slippers and plastic sandals. She has been in this business for thirteen years now. Zainab is requesting a loan of Le 3,000,000. This will be her very first loan from SMT as an individual client.

With this loan, Zainab will increase her business by buying more slippers to add to her current stock. She will use the loan to buy ten dozen slippers, seven dozen foam slippers, and one carton of “madam” shoes. She buys the slippers and shoes in Freetown, Sierra Leone’s capital city, a 372-mile round trip from Makeni. A dozen slippers costs her Le 120,000; a dozen foam slippers costs Le 95,000, and a dozen madam shoes costs Le 120,000 in Freetown.

So far, business is going fine for Zainab. She faces no major challenges in her business. Her business is her only source of income. She loves her business and enjoys doing it. With this loan she receives from SMT, Zainab is expecting a vast improvement in her business and also an incremental increase in the amount of profit she makes. An increase in profit means paying school fees for children, feeding the family better, and offering support to members of her extended family.

loans.use: To buy ten dozen slippers, seven dozen foam slippers, and one carton of “madam” shoes

loans.name: Jitegemee Group

texts.en:
Mary, a fish seller in the Sakina neighborhood of Arusha for six years, currently earns an average monthly profit of $155 working everyday at her business from 10:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m.  She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania to  buy more fish for her business, hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to expand her business.  

Mary, the 30-year-old married mother of two children, aged 15 and 10, will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Felisiana, Agripina, Mary Y. and Bujaina, each of whom has her own small business in Arusha.

loans.use: To buy more fish for her business.

loans.name: Mean's Group

texts.en:
K. is a leader of a group of three members. She is 52 years old and a mother of four children: the first two are married and live separately, the last two are the students. K. is a widow mother and works in the private company since 2000. She is famous for her hard work and her responsibility. With the salary, she hardly manages with the family's expenses, and she is tired of taking the motor taxi but she is good at saving money. Hence, to reduce the family's expenses, K. is taking a loan to buy a motorbike for the family's transportation.

The other two members of the group are: N., 51, who serves ingredient porridge as the breakfast meal by her house, is applying for the loan to buy fruits to sell in the night time for another income. And S., 34, who works in the private company, is requesting the loan to pay for the certificate of motor tax. They all live in Battambang Province, Cambodia.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for the family's transportation.

loans.name: Husein

texts.en:
Husein has owned an electronics shop for 30 years. He carries a wide variety of products and has competitive prices. His clients are people from his region. Husein is 45 years old and lives in Nabatieh, Southern Lebanon with his wife and their five children.

Husein decided on doing this business because he wanted to improve his financial situation. When he first started, he had to face competition. This is the first time that Husein has requested a loan. Husein wants to borrow $1500 US from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his shop. In the future, he plans on improving his shop.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for an electronics shop

loans.name: Saniya's Group

texts.en:
Saniya N. is the leader of the Kisakye group in Mpunge. She is a married lady with a farming business. She grows food crops for sale. She grows matooke, beans, cassava, egg plants, green pepper, and so on and sells her crops to traders in Lugazi, Jinja, and sometimes in Kampala.

The group is taking its 24th loan and it is grateful that the loans have been helping them so much. Saniya dreams of owning a stall in all the markets to which she supplies so that she can sell like a retailer and a wholesaler. But finding a stall is not something you will wake up and achieve. She again needs a new loan to be able to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her crops.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides for her crops to grown high quality yields.

loans.name: Polad

texts.en:
Polad D. is a 29-year-old, very energetic young trader who sells different kinds of repair products. He started this business when he was 20 and since that time the range of his clients has increased. Many customers come to Polad because he can always advise the best products to use.

Polad is not married yet and lives with his parents. He is the only breadwinner for his parents.

Polad would like to increase the number of items he sells and with the income he will gain he will be able to get married. For this purpose he has applied for a loan. Lets do our best to help this ambitious guy.

loans.use: To purchase more items to sell

loans.name: Aniceta

texts.en:
Aniceta U. is selling "choriso", a kind of processed meat products sold by dozen. She is 41 years old and has seven children. Her husband, Genaro U. is raising pigs. They work so hard to be able to meet the needs of their family.

She would like to ask a loan of Php 14,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to  purchase stocks for processed meat business. The loan will also be used to buy feed for the pigs.

Through CEVI, Aniceta and her husband were able to sustain their livelihood all the more. CEVI provides not just loans but trainings and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase stocks for processed meat business

loans.name: Gorgui

texts.fr:
MBTH/17026
Gorgui B. habite la ville de Mbour située à 70 km de la capitale sénégalaise Dakar il est marié et père de famille. Il vit toujours dans la maison familiale  avec le prêt qu’il sollicite, il veut démarrer la construction d’un appartement.
texts.en:
MBTH/17026 Gorgui B. lives in the town of Mbour situated 70 km from the Senegalese capital, Dakar. He is married and the father of a family. He still lives in his family home, and with the loan that he is requesting, he wants to start building an apartment.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: construction

loans.name: Cell 8 Nanyonjo Jane Group

texts.en:
N. Jane is forty-one years old and is the single mother of five children who are working. She is also looking after four dependents who are schooling.

Jane deals in used clothes, that is: dresses, skirts, blouses, etc., and has so far been five years in her business. She is using the loan to purchase more used clothes to sell to her customers. Her beliefs with the loan are that her standard of living will improve and that she will manage to take care of her family.

Jane is a hardworking businesswoman whose dream is to prosper and upgrade to selling new clothes instead of used clothes.

loans.use: To purchase more used clothes to sell to her customers

loans.name: Atakishi

texts.en:
Atakishi has been in the spare parts sales business for eight years. He was born in 1971, is married and has three children. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan's Fuzuli region. He has settled in Fuzuli region in the Bala Bahmanli village.

Now he needs a loan of 1500 AZN to buy spare parts in order to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Vanna

texts.en:
Mrs. Vanna S., 45 (shown in the picture with one of her daughters), and her husband, Mr. Thy Chann, 47, were married in 1990 and have three children - one son and two daughters. One is a garment factory worker and other two attend school. The family lives in a suburb of Phnom Penh, about 25 kilometers from the capital. 

Vanna has been selling roasted corn for five months. Her husband has been a mason since 1999. She wants to purchase a motorbike for commuting, but she doesn’t have money for this. Thus, Vanna is requesting her first loan of $800.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for commuting.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa started her business selling clothes and accessories three years ago with her first micro-loan. She was a housewife before starting her business and has taken on the task of raising four children while running her own business. 

Her business has done very well and she has even been able to send her eldest child to college. Now she would like another loan in order to grow her business more by increasing her inventory. With this loan she will buy pants, blouses and bracelets. All her children are doing very well in school and she would like to be able to send all of them to college. 

You can help Rosa and her children achieve their dreams by funding this loan!

loans.use: Pants, blouses and bracelets

loans.name: Mitos

texts.en:
Mitos is 40 years old and married to Emeliano, who is also 40. She is a mother to three children; two boys and a girl. She lives in Antipolo City, Rizal province in the Philippines.

Mitos has the talent of sewing. She is known to their village as a good sewer and she receive orders for her sewing services. Sewing is her primary business and she needs capital to sustain its operation. In 2008, she joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines, with hopes of having access to capital. She used her previous loans as rolling and additional capital for her sewing. She has been in the business for almost six years.

Now on her third loan, she seeks 10,000 pesos as additional capital for her sewing business. Specifically, the amount will be used to pay for a sewing machine worth 5,000 pesos and for assorted cloth and threads. She is hopeful that her business will grow and she even dreams of expanding it and to later hire workers. She also aspires to send her children to school until they finish college and to have a more spacious and comfortable house.

loans.use: To pay for a sewing machine worth 5,000 pesos and for assorted cloth and threads

loans.name: Mrs. Srey Tum Horm Group

texts.en: Mrs. Srey Tum H. is the leader of a group of four who are all living in Thmei Village in Takeo Province. Mrs. Srey Tum H. is a farmer who owns a 2-hectare field for cultivating rice to earn a living. Aside from this, she is also a silk weaver. On this plantation, she now faces a small problem because her field contains infertile soil, which has a bad effect on the crop. To solve this problem, Mrs. Srey Tum H. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers, and she would use a portion of the loan to hire laborers to work in the field. For her silk weaving, she would buy more silk and other raw material to weave for her customers. Mrs. Srey Tum H. is a 31-year-old widow with three children, two of whom are weavers, and the youngest of whom is attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and to hire laborers to work in the field

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda tiene 27 años, vive en su casa propia con su hijo, Jefferson, de 6 años de edad. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora que gracias a lo aprendido de niña, hoy en día puede solventar los gastos de su hogar. El tejido de chompas, guantes, chalinas, etc. es la actividad a la que se dedica y le gusta mucho, ya que deja volar su imaginación y en cada prenda que realiza pone gran dedicación y esfuerzo para logar el acabado ideal. Además, con este trabajo se siente muy independiente, lamentablemente debe realizarlo durante prácticamente todo el día, lo cual le resulta muy cansado, pero Yolanda con gran dedicación se esmera en realizarlo de la mejor manera. 

Ella quiere en un futuro incursionar en otro tipo de negocio y es por eso que ha estado pensando comprar ropa y calzado para vender en otras ciudades, pero para ello tendría que viajar muy frecuentemente.

Este es el segundo préstamo de Yolanda con MFP y siempre se ha caracterizado por ser muy puntual en todos sus pagos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará mayor cantidad de lana y material para sus tejidos y si fuera posible un maquina tejedora.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 27 years old and lives in her own home with her 6 year-old son, Jefferson. She is a hard-working mother who, thanks to what she learned as a young girl, is today able to take care of household expenses. She knits sweaters, mittens, shawls, etc., an activity which she enjoys very much and that lets her imagination take flight with each garment she produces. With each garment she pays attention to every detail to make sure it is finished in an ideal manner. Besides, this work allows her to be independent. However, she must work practically all day, which is very tiring but Yolanda is very dedicated and works hard to accomplish her tasks in the best manner possible. She wants in the future to become involved in a new kind of enterprise and is thinking of buying clothing and footwear to sell in other cities but this would require her to travel frequently. This is her second loan with MFP and she has always been characterized by being very punctual with her repayments. With these funds she intends to buy large quantities of wool and other materials needed for her knitting and, if possible, a knitting machine.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase wool.

loans.name: Omaléyé E.

texts.fr: Cette dame exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu des accessoires traditionnels pour la cuisine; elle a débuté cette activité depuis 2006 dans le quartier d’Agoè Camp FIR. Cette vendeuse ambulante exerce cette activité qui lui permet d’apporter sa contribution financière dans la gestion du foyer. Elle vend des paniers, des balais artisanaux, des spatules pour préparer la pâte de maïs, des éventails. Elle est connue de beaucoup de clients qui font des commandes chez elle. En ce moment elle voudrait disposer d’un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 15 paniers, 05 balais, 20 spatules et 15 éventails. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants.
texts.en:
This lady runs an income-generating business selling traditional food preparation accessories; she began this business in 2006 in the Agoè Camp FIR district. This traveling saleswoman's business allows her to contribute financially to the management of her household. She sells baskets, handmade brooms, spatulas for preparing maize paste, and fans. She is known by many of her clients, who give her their orders at home. At the moment, she would like to obtain a loan through WAGES (one of Kiva's field partners) to buy 15 baskets, 5 brooms, 20 spatulas, and 15 fans. She is married and has 3 children.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy baskets, brooms, spatulas, and fans

loans.name: Korb

texts.en:
Mr. Korb E. lives in Krang Sbaek Village in Takeo province. He is a farmer who has a small piece of land to cultivate rice. His wife, Mrs. Keov Yeourn, sells cake in the local village. Although they try to work hard, they still earn insufficient income to support the family. 

In order to improve their living conditions, Mr. Korb E. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cart to be carried by a motorbike to transport goods and passengers for an income. Mr. Korb E. has four children who are all attending the local school. His wife is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: For a motorbike and cart

loans.name: Anju

texts.en:
Anju L. is a 24 year-old woman who lives in Tangal, Lalitpur. She lives with her husband and one son. Her husband is a driver and her son is in pre-primary school.

Mrs L. is a shopkeeper. Mrs L. opened her grocery shop two years ago to increase the quality of life of her family. She sells a variety of grocery items. She wants to further expand her business so she is requesting a Rs 20,000.00 loan to buy necessary grocery items for her shop.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods

loans.name: Good People Group

texts.en:
Theresa D. is a leader of a group of two borrowers called Good People. She is 29 years old and is single with an 11 years old child, and the child’s educational level is 5th grade. Theresa is a 5th grade drop-out due to lack of financial support.

She and her child lives and work in the Sheriff Quarter, Voinjama city the capital of Lofa county, northern Liberia.  Her business is beauty salon. She offers services like fixing hair, nails, facial and more to residents of her  community in  Voinjama city.

Theresa has been running this business for 3 years, and hoping to improve by having another salon at a different location in the near future.  She offers good service to her customers and talks to them in a good manner in order to encourage customers to continue patronizing her business.  Theresa needs this loan to purchase some hair extensions and new kinds of goods to improve business: her illness for about 3 months declined the business.  She dreams of supporting her kid with better education.

loans.use: To purchase some hair extensions and new goods for a beauty salon.

loans.name: Mahmood

texts.en:
Mahmood S. is a young man, 25 years old. His family consists of four brothers and one sister in addition to his mother. He lives with his family at Deir Al Ghosoun, a village of Tulkarem District. He shares the responsibility of supporting the family with one of his brothers who works for the Palestinian National Authority.

Mahmood is in the process of preparing his land for growing plants in addition to installing more greenhouses. He is applying for a loan from FATEN to increase his income by growing more plants and by installing a number of additional greenhouses.

This project will help Mahmood ensure better living conditions for his family and enable him to collect enough money to get married soon and start his own family.

Mahmood appears in the photo at his greenhouse surrounded by lovely cucumber plants.

loans.use: Tp prepare his land for planting and to install additional greenhouses

loans.name: Juana María

texts.es:
La   Señora Juana María G. H., Labora como Recepcionista en el Instituto Manuel Olivares Rodríguez  de Managua, ella tiene un  hijo a su cargo, y  esto se encuentra en edad escolar, es madre soltera, ha trabajado  créditos con CEPRODEL durante un  año, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido un crédito en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL.  

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: zinc y perlines por lo que va a cambiar el techo de su casa ya que este se encuentra en mal estado.

Con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos. 

 Juana dijo que gracias a los préstamos  otorgados por ceprodel ha podido mejorar su vivienda
texts.en:
Juana María G. H. works as a receptionist at the Instituto Manuel Olivares Rodríguez in Managua. She is responsible for her son, who attends school. She is a single mother and has worked with loans from CEPRODEL for a year. During this time, she has invested a loan in improving her home, thanks to the financing granted by CEPRODEL. She will invest the loan she's requesting in the purchase of construction materials, such as zinc and beams, that she will use to replace the roof on her house, which is in bad shape. Her goal is to offer her children greater security and a better quality of life. Juana said that due to the loans granted by CEPRODEL, she has been able to improve her living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvements and extension

loans.name: Atebar Khan Group

texts.en:
This is the Atebar K. Group. Hakima is the group leader. She is married and the mother of 8 children. She lives in Kabul Afghanistan. With hard work, she assembled a loan group that has three members. Each one is engaged in a different business. 

Hakima wants a loan for her son who sells fresh vegetables in his shop. With this loan, he wants to complete his inventory. Frishta wants a loan for her husband who repairs car batteries. Rabia wants a loan for her husband's general store. With this loan, he wants to buy more food for his shop. 

They requested a group loan. Each member needs 14000 AFN and to further their work and be a good client of Kiva and AFS. Hakima ensures that they can repay the loan on the time and she can control the whole group. She would like to thank everyone that helps Afghanistan and its poor people with this loan.

loans.use: To buy fresh vegetables for her husband's shop

loans.name: Lang

texts.en:
Mrs. Lang P. is 58 years old and a villager who lives in Chheu Teal Phluoh village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Nuch Chea, are farmers who own a 8-hectare field to cultivate rice. They have a child who is a student in the local school.

Mrs. Lang P. is requesting 2,000,000 KHR from AMK to buy rice seed, fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline to support her farming needs. Mr. Nuch Chea is a fisherman who can earn a small income from selling fish to support his family.

loans.use: To buy rice seed, fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline.

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.es: El señor Gilberto tiene 50 años de edad, es casado y tiene dos hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad y viven aparte. El señor se dedica al transporte de materiales de construcción, negocio que atiende en su casa de habitación para realizar los contratos, el tiene un camión para ir a traer los materiales. El señor dio inicio a este negocio desde hace veinte años, dio inicio con pequeños viajes al mercado oriental a comprar productos ferreteros, cuando logro adquirir una camioneta fue que empezó a comprar materiales de construcción y fue hace 6 años que logro tener lo suficiente ahorrado para poder comprar un camión, que es el que utiliza actualmente para trasladar los materiales de construcción. El señor está solicitando este crédito con el objetivo realizar compras de materiales variados, ya que estos actualmente han subido de precio y cada día necesita manejar mayor capital para dar respuesta a sus clientes, ya que él tiene que comprar en efectivo y hasta después le pagan los clientes. El señor hace unos años fue diagnosticado de cáncer, lo cual le impidió trabajar por un tiempo ya que fue operado y estuvo en recuperación, sin embargo a la fecha se encuentra en óptimas condiciones. Su sueño, es tener un centro bien establecido de venta de materiales de construcción como la de su competencia, en la cual sus proveedores puedan llevarle los materiales.
texts.en:
Gilberto is 50, married, and has two children. The children are grown and live separately. He transports construction materials. He takes care of the business in his house; he makes the contracts there. He has a truck to go get the materials. He started this business 20 years ago. He started with small trips to the Eastern market to buy hardware products. It was when he got a van that he started to buy construction materials. Six years ago he had enough saved to be able to buy a truck. That is what he currently uses to transport the construction materials. He is asking for this loan to buy various materials. The prices have currently risen, and everyday he needs more money in order to make deliveries to his customers. He needs to buy with cash, and his customers pay later. A few years ago he was diagnosed with cancer. That kept him from working for a time. He had an operation, and then there was recuperation. Now he is in great condition. His dream is to have a well established center, like the competition has, for selling construction materials. His suppliers could bring the materials to him there.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Toch

texts.en:
Mr. Toch T. is 55 years old and lives in Kompong Tom, a province of Cambodia, located about 200 km from Phnom Penh.
Toch T. owns and uses a motorcycle to pick up passengers around his community for a profit. In addition, his wife (who appears in the photo here) produces cakes and sells them to people in the village. The couple has six children, half of whom are now married and the rest of whom are single. Besides their current work, the family takes time to plant rice crops. Toch T. also has an ox that he uses to provide a breeding service for a fee. Toch T. has seen that this service is very profitable, so he would like to request a loan to buy more oxen to provide this service.

loans.use: To buy more oxen to provide a breeding service

loans.name: Bernarda De La Concepcion

texts.es: La señora Bernarda de la Concepción tiene 46 años de edad tiene 4 hijos a su cargo. Su actividad económica es la venta de ropa. Hace más de 11 años que se dedica a este negocio. Inicio con muy pocas cantidades de ropa, y al ver que sus clientes respondieron decidió invertir un poco más, Bernarda es una persona que demuestra que le gusta mucho su trabajo. El dinero que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de productos como ropa para niños, ropa para caballeros, para damas y además sobrecamas. Algo que desea en el futuro, es ampliar su negocio de venta de vestuario, ya que su clientela es muy buena y le compran bastante. Por ello desearía establecer una tienda de ropa nueva.
texts.en:
Bernarda is 46 years old and has four children. She sells clothing and has been in this business for the past eleven years. She began with a few items and when she noticed that her customers responded, she invested more into her business. Bernarda is a person who demonstrates that she lives her work very much. She will use the money from this loan to provide working capital to buy more clothing for children, gentlemen, and ladies. She will also buy bedspreads. She would like to expand her clothing business, now that she has steady customers who buy plenty of items. This is why she would like to establish a clothing shop.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en: Sharon, 26 years old, has businesses in rice farming and hog-raising located in Banga, South Cotabato.  She has a child that is 6 years old. To help finance her business, she has asked for a loan of Php 5,000 from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. since it provides the lowest interest rate as compared to others. This loan will help her purchase farm supplies and feed for her pigs.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy grocery items for  her business

loans.name: Daban Road Nalubega Margaret Group

texts.en:
N. Margaret is a business woman, forty years old. She is married with five children, of whom two are schooling, and she is looking after two dependents who are schooling too.

Margaret deals in a maize flour business which she has been operating for over two years. She is using the loan to purchase bags of maize to manufacture maize flour for sale. Her stock is improving whereby she is wishing to purchase a plot of land.

loans.use: To purchase bags of maize to manufacture maize flour for sale

loans.name: Muth

texts.en:
Muth S., 51, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for its palm products.

S. raises pigs and grows vegetables to sell for an income of USD 2 per day. Her husband produces animal feed to sell, earning an income of about USD 4 per day.

S. is requesting a loan of USD 150 to purchase vegetable seeds to grow more vegetables. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy vegetable seeds

loans.name: Sandy

texts.es:
Sandy S. es una Joven emprendedora muy trabajadora. Ella tiene una pequeña ferretería   vender cemento arena, tubería PVC, pinturas y también un poco de  electrodomésticos, este negocio lo inició desde  el año 2008, como una actividad familiar y aprendió este quehacer porque sus padres le enseñaron , desde el año 2002 por eso se preara y justamente está estudiando administración  de empresas para hacer su trabajo  cada día mejor .En la actualidad  cuenta con 3 empleados, y tiene muy poca competencia en el sector, así que su rotación es rápida por eso realiza sus compras semanales y vende diariamente de lunes a domingo, en el horario de 7:00 AM a las 4:00 PM. Este es el primer crédito que Sandy solicita a  la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo   con el cual  comprarà cemento, Tubos PVC y bloques, además de unos electrodomésticos de rotación  rápida  que ya no tiene en existencia.
 Su sueño tener una casa propia desde muy joven y, pero sobre todo terminar su carrera profesional; Sandy es una joven muy especial que vive en un sector muy transitado cerca de la calle murillo de Barranquilla y también  es vecina del famosa estadio de Futbol de Colombia “El estadio Metropolitano” donde juega el equipo del alma de los Barranquilleros: El Junior
texts.en:
Sandy S. is a young, hardworking woman. She has a small hardware store. She sells cement, sand, PVC tubing, paint and also a few appliances. She started this buiness in 2008 as a family activity and she learned this business because her parents taught her. Since 2002, she has been preparing for and studying business administration to do her job better every day. At present, she has 3 employees and very little competition in the area, so her turnover is fast. That is why she does her purchasing every week and sells every day from Monday through Sunday from 7:00 a.m until 4:00 p.m. This is her first loan that Sandy has asked for from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With it she will buy cement, PVC tubing and blocks, as well as appliances with a high turnover, since she doesn't have any. Her dream since she was very young has been is to have her own home, but more than anything she wants to finish her professional studies. Sandy is a very special young woman who lives in a very busy area near the Murillo street of Barranquilla and she is also a neighbor of the soccer stadium “El Estadio Metropolitano” where her beloved Baranquiila team plays: El Junior.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy cement, PVC tubing and appliances.

loans.name: Saroeun's Group

texts.en:
Mr. SaR. B. is 65 years old and is the group leader of the loan having been selected by its four members which located in Preaek Ksev village, Kandal province. The members of this group loan will purchase equipment, supplies and other items to support their different purposes. 

Mr. SaR. B. is a grocery seller in the local village. For this business, he will use the loan that he has requested from AMK to buy more groceries to enlarge his business activities. His wife, Mrs. Chhunly San, is a Khmer noodle seller who is able to earn a small income to add her husband's savings to improve her family's standard of living. This couple has a child who is a student.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to expand his business activities.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mrs. Mercy B. is from the barangay of Maloro, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is 35 years of age and married to Eddie B., a motorcab driver and her partner in the business. She is blessed with two children who are still in their infancy. 

To make a living, she is presently engaged in a fish-retailing business with a stall in the Public Market. She is also receiving support from her husband from his income as a motorcab driver. She has been engaged in this kind of business for five years and earns approximately $225 a month from this business activity. 

In the year 2009, Mercy joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mercy, as an active member of PMPC under the Regular Loan Program, has successfully repaid a loan of 20,000 PHP. She is now requesting a loan of 50,000 PHP as her 2nd loan, to be used for purchasing an additional motorcab unit and also as additional capital for their fish-selling business. 

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family, especially in meeting their basic needs, as savings for future use and their children’s education, loan repayments, insurance and possible business expansions. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy another motorcab and to use as addional capital for fish-selling business

loans.name: Kasifa

texts.en: Kasifa is married with five children, four of whom go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. Kasifa owns a retail shop in Natete selling all types of merchandise like sugar, salt, soap, cooking oil, dry cells and exercise books. She buys her merchandise from Kikuubo in Kampala city and uses public transport to and from shopping, which she does once a week. She has been in this business for four years. She wants to use this loan to buy more bags of sugar, boxes of soap, cartons of salt, and cooking oil. Besides this retail shop business she sells secondhand women's clothes and piped water to earn additional income. She works seven days a week. Her business challenges include thieves and the rainy season. Her major customers are taxi touts because she works near Natete taxi park. She aspires to build her own house. She decided to work with MCDT because they are trustworthy and she needed additional capital. She resides in and rents a two-roomed house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees, food and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and cooking oil

loans.name: Everlyn

texts.en:
Everlyn C., 45 years old, sells vegetables in Githurai, Kenya. She is married to a businessman by the name of Paul Kirimi and together they have three children aged 26, 23 and 12. 

Everlyn's main occupation has been selling vegetables for 10 years now. Her clients are within an urban area and come from all income brackets. She says that she is able to take home Kshs. 12,000 each month, which meets all her family's needs. 

Everlyn joined KADET after she was introduced by another client, and she is now getting her first loan. She plans to use this amount to buy more stock for selling in the market.  

Everlyn dreams of venturing into the real estate business in the future.

loans.use: To buy more stock of vegetables for resale

loans.name: Yaly

texts.es: La Sra. YALY vive en la zona de la radial 10,  tiene un hijo que se encuentra en edad escolar, ella es madre soltera, se dedica a la panadería desde hace 10 años. Ella sola se esfuerza para salir adelante con el apoyo de sus padres. Ella por las noches estudia en un instituto una carrera técnica desea graduarse y ejercer su carrera,  el crédito que esta solicitando es para comprar otro horno de panadería porque tiene mucha demanda, la Sra. es una persona que tiene muchas ganas de superación  para darle un futuro a su hijo, la Sra. Yaly es colaborada por su hermana en la elaboración y comercialización de los riquísimos panes.
texts.en:
Ms. Yaly lives in the Radial 10 zone. She has a school-aged son and is a single mother. She has been running a bread-baking business for ten years. With the support of her parents, she strives to move forward. At night, she takes classes at a technical school. She hopes to graduate and to use her studies. The loan she is requesting is to buy another bakery oven, because there is a lot of demand for her bread. Ms. Yaly is someone who has great hopes of improving her lot, in order to give her son a better future. Ms. Yaly works alongside her sister to bake and sell their delicious breads.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy another oven for her bread bakery

loans.name: Marcos Antonio

texts.es: El Sr. Marcos Antonio T. G. él es Trabajador de la Empresa Ministerio de Salud desempeñándose como supervisor de ESNEN tiene  treinta y un año de trabajar para esta empresa, es casado actualmente tiene un niño en edad escolar. Ha tenido  tres créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno lo  ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción y  mejorar su casa de habitación los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esa manera él ha  mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en:
Marcos Antonio T. G. works for the Ministry of Health.  He works as a supervisor for ESNEN (National Service for the Eradication of Malaria).  He has worked for this company for 31 years.  He is married, and he has a child who is now school age.

He has had three loans from Ceprodel.  He has used each loan to buy construction materials to improve his house.  The loans from Ceprodel have been extremely beneficial to him because that is how he has improved the living conditions for himself and his family.

loans.use: Buy cement, stone, zinc, iron, and a compra de cemento, piedra, zinz, hierro, and a toilet

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita A. sells food and daily-use products to the local community from her sari-sari (variety) shop. Carmelita has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP. She and her husband have three school-aged children and live in the village of New Visayas, Kibawe, Bukidnon.
  
Earlier this year, Carmelita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services. Her goal was to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Carmelita is requesting her first loan in the amount of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell in her shop

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en: Elisa B. is from the town of Banga. She is 66 years old and widowed. Elisa 's main source of income comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Elisa also raises pigs for fattening. Elisa joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Elisa has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. She is requesting a new loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) which will be used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

loans.use: To purchase general farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick S. K. is thirty five years old and married with two children aged two-and-a-half and 13. His business is located at Bondora Kaloleni in Mombasa, Kenya. Mombasa is in the coastal region of Kenya and is well known for its many tourist attractions including white beaches on the Indian Ocean. 

For the past six years, Patrick has owned a cafe called Master’s Cafe where he sells drinks and food to the local people. Besides this business, he also sells clothes and vegetables. Patrick works very hard to keep his business doing well. His business is profitable but his major challenge is that his monthly capital is reduced because most of his customers buy on credit and pay at the end of each month. 

Patrick is requesting a loan of 60,000 KES to renovate his business premises and buy more foodstuff to expand his offerings and attract more customers. He hopes to grow his business into the leading restaurant that serves all kinds of food and gives exemplary customer service twenty-four hours a day.

loans.use: To renovate business premises

loans.name: Promise Mae

texts.en:
Promise Mae L. is from the village of Lilingayon, Valencia City. She is 27 years old. Promise Mae is married and has 2 school-age children. To make a living, Promise Mae owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling ready to wear clothing & shoe products from NATASHA & AVON in the local community. Promise Mae has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Promise Mae joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Promise Mae has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to buy and sell. Promise Mae is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Promise Mae from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand the her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory &  for working capital

loans.name: Surkhay

texts.en: Surkhay A. is a 45 year-old-man who lives in the city of Imishli with his family.  He is married and a father of two sons. Surkhay owns a small grocery store in the city of Imishli. His wife helps him in the business which is their only source of income.  This is the first loan Surkhay has received from Aqroinvest and Kiva.  He used it to buy products to sell in his store to increase sales.  After repaying this loan of 1000 AZN he plans to take out another loan to expand this business and open a new store.

loans.use: to buy products to sell in the store

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Sok S., 51, is a farmer, earning an income of USD 1 per day. S. is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temples. The family has to spend USD 40 on food, USD 5 on electricity supply, and USD 55 on other necessary expenses every month. S. is requesting a loan of USD 300 to purchase more pigs to raise for sale. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy pigs to raise for sale.

loans.name: Elmer

texts.es: Elmer, de 30 años, es un hombre muy amable y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Luz (40)  y sus dos pequeños hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor educaciónElmer se dedica al cultivo de café y plátanos. Todos los días por la mañana trabaja en su cultivo, ya que sabe que el dinero que obtenga por sus productos dependerá mucho de la calidad de su cosecha. Él comercializa  sus productos en el mercado de Pichanaki puesto que es donde mejor le pagan y tiene compradores fijos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras, ya que así siente que los meses de trabajo han tenido sus frutos, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es fumigar sus tierras, puesto que siempre hay el peligro de que los químicos lo enfermen. Para más adelante tiene planeado  mejorar sus cultivos, para mejorar sus  ingresos.Es el  segundo préstamo que tiene con MFP, y manifiesta que el dinero del crédito le ayudara mucho en el progreso de su trabajo. En su banco comunal es muy querido por el resto de sus compañeras, ya que es muy solidario con todos.Elmer tiene planeado invertir los  dos mil soles solicitados en la compra de  insecticidas, ya que desea tener unos campos libres de plagas y espera  mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Elmer is 30 years old.  He is a very kind and hard-working man who lives in his own home together with his wife Luz (40) and hios two small children for whom he would like to provide a better education.

Elmer grows coffee and bananas.  Every morning he starts work on his crops since he knows that the money he makes for his produce depends a lot on the quality of his harvest.  He sells his products in Pichanaki market since that is where people pay him the most and he has regular buyers.  What he most likes about his work is harvesting his crops since that is when he feels that the months of work have borne fruit.  He has been in this business for 10 years and he considers the most difficult part of his work to be spraying his land since he knows that there is a danger that the chemicals will make him ill.  In the future, he is planning to improve his crops to improve his profits.

This is Elmer's second loan with MFP and he says that the loan money will help him a lot in making progress in his work.  He is a very well-liked member of his community bank because he is very supportive of the other members.  Elmer plans to invest the 2,000 Peruvian soles he has requested in buying insecticides since he would like to have his land free from pests and he hopes to improve his crops.

loans.use: To buy insecticides to improve his crops

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal”YANAPAKUY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Rosa; ella tiene 42 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 5 hijos; La socia tiene su negocio de carpintería, la socia trabaja conjuntamente con su pareja siendo la socia quien administra el negocio y de vez en cuando ella le ayuda a su pareja a realizar algunos acabados, la socia vende  muebles, armarios, camas, roperos entre otros mas de esta forma la socia saca a su familia adelante y se esmera a seguir con el negocio.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de materiales para su carpintería como madera entre otros más.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Here is a member of the communal bank named "Yanapakuy". It is located in the district of Cusco, in the province of Cusco, and the department of Cusco. 

Her name is Rosa. She is 42 years old, married common-law, and the mother of 5 children. She has a carpentry shop. She works together with her partner and she is the administrator of the business, although every once in a while she helps her partner do some of the finishes. She sells furniture, armoires, beds, dressers and other items. It is through this business that she is able to provide for her family. She works hard to maintain her business. 

She requests a loan to purchase carpentry materials, including wood and other products.

She is happy to receive a loan and she is committed to making the payments of her loan.

loans.use: To purchase carpentry materials.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is a 60-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating 2 businesses: buying and selling charcoal and firewood and a peanut butter business. She lives in Bayawan City, Negros Oriental. 

Pacita has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1999 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her charcoal and firewood and peanut butter businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 12000. 

Pacita is  borrowing PHP 10000 so that she can purchase more stocks to sell. This will be her 20 cycle loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 10000, which she paid off well within its term was just another step on her journey toward economic freedom. Pacita aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the  Dungganon way.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the  NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.
"

loans.use: To purchase more stocks to sell

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is a married woman who lives in Cadiz City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a business buying and selling dried fish. Her husband Rolando, who is 31 years old, buys & sells livestock to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities. They have one child who is 9 years old. Maricel joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2006 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 10 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Maricel has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 28,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 6,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 11th loan, she is borrowing PHP 28,000 as additional capital so that she can continue to save up for future house improvement & the education for children. Maricel is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org

loans.use: As additional capital for dried fish

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying a motor for his maize mill

loans.name: Capoluca Group

texts.es: Esta foto fue tomada en casa de la señora Epifania T. un integrante del grupo "Capoluca", que esta ubicado en el Estado de Veracruz, en México. Epifania se dedica a la venta de antojitos, que inicio hace 2 años. Solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos e invertir en su negocio de tacos. Sus compañeras y clientes la conocen como una persona responsable y trabajadora. Al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente satisfecha ya que por medio de este préstamo podra incrementar sus ventas y atraer más clientes. Tiene 32 años, estudio hasta la secundaria, es casada y tiene 3 hijas. Con este crédito espera ser la mejor de la zona, asi como incrementar sus ventas y con ello ofrecer una mejor variedad de antojitos para deleitar el paladar de sus clientes, además de poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y seguir apoyando a sus hijas con sus estudios hasta donde le sea posible.
texts.en:
The photo was taken in the home of Epifania, a member of the “Capoluca” Group, located in the State of Veracruz.  Epifania sells snacks, a business she initiated some 2 years ago.

Epifania requested the loan to buy supplies and invest in her taco business.  Her companions and customers know her as a hard-working and responsible person.  At the time of soliciting this loan, she felt satisfied because with the loan, she will be able to increase her sales and attract more customers.

Epifania is 32 years old, studied up to secondary school, is married and has 3 daughters.  With the loan, she hopes to become the best in the zone, as well as to increase her sales and, with that, to offer the best variety of snacks to delight her customer's taste, plus to be able to provide her family a better quality of life, and to continue helping her daughters with their studies as far as possible.

loans.use: TO BUY MORE SUPPLIES FOR THEIR SALES OF SNACKS

loans.name: Meav's Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of thirteen members. Mrs. Meav is the village bank president. She was selected as the village bank president by the other members. 

Mrs. Meav and her husband, Mr. Uk, are farmers. They own a plot of land, which they use to grow rice and vegetables for their family. 

This couple has five children. Two of the children are students and help their parents with farming. One of the other children is a seamstress in a garment factory, another child is a soldier, and the last child is a wedding beautician. 

In order to improve crop growth on Mrs. Meav and Mr. Uk's farm, Mrs. Meav is asking for a loan to dig a well.

loans.use: To dig a well for growing crops

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN ESTRELLA D. OROPESA”; Este banco está ubicado en el poblado D. Oropesa,  provincia D. Quispicanchis y  departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Victoria, es casada; la socia tiene 54 años D. edad; la socia tiene 3 hijos dos D. los cuales son ya independientes, y la otra D. sus hijas tiene 20 años, la socia se dedica a la administración y atención D. su tienda D. abarrotes, la socia desea implementar su negocio ella requiere el dinero para invertir en la compra D. mercadería tales como son harina, fideos, azúcar, arroz, leche y todo al por mayor para así poder vender al por menor y adquirir una ganancia significativa. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra D. mercadería. 

La socia está muy agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. dicho préstamo D. forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank "VIRGEN ESTRELLA D. OROPESA" which is located in the village of Oropesa, province of Quispicanchis, in the department of Cusco.

Mrs. Victoria, age 54, is married and has three children, two of which are already independent and another daughter who is 20.  

Victoria owns and manages a grocery store which she wants to improve by buying goods wholesasle such as flour, pasta, sugar, rice and milk.  Selling them retail would give her significant earnings.  She has requested the loan to buy these items.

She is very grateful for the loan and commited to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy wholesale goods

loans.name: Rosana

texts.es: Rosana, de 40 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Juan de 46 años y sus queridos hijos Katherine de 18 y Jefferson de 13 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Durante 10 años, ella se ha dedicado a la venta de arroz, invirtiendo en las hectáreas sembradas al norte del país, exactamente en la ciudad de Chiclayo, donde las siembras son en mayor proporción y por ende necesitan de una gran inversión. Es por ello que Rosana viaja constantemente dejando a su familia, lo cual le resulta muy difícil ya que ella quisiera estar todo el tiempo con sus pequeños, pero eso no ha sido un obstáculo más bien un impulso para seguir adelante ya que ella sabe que todos esos sacrificios son a favor de sus hijos para que sean unos profesionales. Rosana y su esposo trabajan juntos para que esto se haga realidad y son muy felices porque saben que trabajando muy duro lograrán todos sus objetivos. Es el quinto crédito con MFP y siempre ha sido muy puntual en sus anteriores pagos. Los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, los invertirá en la siembra de hectáreas de arroz que tiene en el norte del país para así lograr buenos ingresos.
texts.en: 40-year-old Rosana is a simple and hard-working woman. She lives in her own home along with her 46-year-old husband Juan and her dear children Katherine (18) and Jefferson (13) who she desires to provide with a better quality of life.  For 10 years, she has sold rice, investing in the hectares of cropland in the Northern part of the country, specifically in the city of Chiclayo where the crops are bountiful, and therefore they need large investment.  That is why Rosana travels constantly, leaving her family, which is very difficult as she wishes to be all the time with her little ones. However, this has not been an obstacle; rather it has been motivation to get ahead since she knows that all these sacrifices are for her children, so that they can become professionals. Rosana and her husband work together to make this a reality and are very happy because they know that by working very hard they will achieve their objectives.  This is the fifth loan with MFP and she has always been very punctual with her previous payments.  The two thousand new Peruvian soles requested will be invested in the sowing of hectares of rice that she has in the north of the country to thus obtain good income.

loans.use: to invest in the sowing of hectares of rice in the northern part of the country.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 45 years old and married to Jane.  They have seven children, all of whom attend school.  He runs a retail shop in Kibwezi County where he sells tires to motor vehicle owners in the area.  He has been involved in this business for nine years and earns KES 15,000 per month. 

George was introduced to Kiva parnter KADET Ltd. by a friend who is a registered member of KADET.  He requests KES 30,000 loan to buy more tires for resale.  This loan will be his first from KADET.

In the future, George plans to grow his business, become a leading tire dealer, and own commercial plot.

loans.use: To purchase more tires for resale.

loans.name: Jardines De Paute (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Jardines de Paute está formado por 9 Mujeres, quienes son mujeres luchadoras y emprendedoras que  laboran en diferentes actividades que les permiten crecer y mejorar la economía de sus hogares. Viven por los alrededores del Cantón Paute que se encuentra 35 km. al noreste de Cuenca, su clima es templado propicio para la floricultura y producción de frutas. Su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales, agricultura, etc. Son personas muy hospitalarias y amables. Paute tiene muchos lugares turísticos para visitar. 

La Señorita. Rosa Aurora vive por el cantón de Paute, se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por una amiga.
 
Tiene 24 años, es soltera y tiene una hija de 6 años de edad que estudia en una escuelita del sector. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de su hermano. 

La Señorita Rosa Aurora se dedica a la artesanía, realiza bordados a mano de todo tipo de prendas, esta actividad aprendió gracias a  mamá y tiene su negocio hace 4 años. Trabaja tiempo completo desde su casa ya que sus conocidas le realizan pedidos. También está estudiando a distancia la carrera de Ing. En Sistemas.
  
El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de hilos y telas para continuar en esta actividad.
 
Su meta es de culminar sus estudios Universitarios.
texts.en:
The community bank "Jardines de Paute" ("Paute Gardens") consists of 9 women.  They are diligent and enterprising women who work in various activities that allow them to increase and improve their family finances. They live in the vicinity of Paute Canton, which is 35 km. northeast of Cuenca. The climate is mild and conducive to flower and fruit agriculture.   Its people are engaged in trade, animal husbandry, agriculture, etc. They are very hospitable and friendly. Paute has many tourist attractions to visit.

Señorita Rosa Aurora lives in Paute Canton.  This is her second loan made through the community bank, which she was invited to join by a friend.  She is 24 years old, single and has a 6 year old daughter who studies in a school in the sector.  She does not have her own house, so she lives in her brother's home.

Señorita Rosa Aurora is engaged in crafts, and does hand embroidery on all kinds of garments. She learned this activity thanks to her mom and has had her business for 4 years. She works full time from home and receives her orders from people she knows.  She is also studying for a career in Systems Engineering via distance learning.

The money from the loan will be invested in the purchase of yarn and fabric to continue her activity.  Her goal is to complete her university studies.

loans.use: to buy yarn and fabric.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en: Paulina, 63 years old and married with three children, works hard to provide for her family. She has been operating a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines for eight years and also earns an income from food vending. Having borrowed and repaid 19 previous loans from NWTF, she is now requesting a PHP 15000 loan to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.  Paulina aspires to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Nieves

texts.es: Nieves D. 63 años resiD. en la localidad D. Palcamayo. Se caracteriza por ser una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su hija menor Liz D. 26 años, quien es el motivo D. todos sus esfuerzos. DesD. muy pequeña aprendió a trabajar en la chacra junto a sus padres, quienes le enseñaron todo lo que se tiene que hacer, para lograr un buen cultivo. Ahora tiene sus propias tierras, las cuales cultiva y cuida con mucho amor y paciencia. Ella siembra arveja, espinaca y zanahoria, las cuales lleva a vender al mercado mayorista D. Tarma. Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es cosechar sus cultivos, ya que siente que su arduo trabajo esta dando sus frutos. Lleva 40 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos D. las plagas D. insectos que pueden afectarlos. Con la fortaleza que la caracteriza trabaja sola en sus terrenos agrícolas, pues aprendió D. la vida a salir adelante por si misma. Pero en campañas agrícolas contrata peones para que le puedan ayudar en la cosecha. Además D. tener el apoyo D. su hija quien tiene un camión con el que trasporta su producción a la capital del país, “yo tengo todo”, menciona doña Nieves, “canastas, costales y demás materiales para trasportar”. Con el tiempo espera, comprar nuevas tierras para ampliar su producción. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen María” y este es el sexto crédito con MFP, donD. espera D. su colaboración para concretar sus planes. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte D. su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Nieves D. obtener su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra D. 2 bolsas D. semilla D. arveja y varios sacos D. abono orgánico para comenzar con su próxima siembra.
texts.en: Nieves is 63 years old. She lives in the town of Palcamayo. She is described as being a cheerful and hardworking woman. She lives in her own house with her youngest daughter, Liz, who is 26 and the reason for all her hard work. When she was very young she learned to work in the fields with her parents, who taught her what has to be done to have a good crop. Now she has her own land which she plants and takes care of with much love and patience. She plants peas, spinach and carrots which she sells in the wholesale market of Tarma. What she liks the most about her job is harvesting her crops, since she feels that her hard work is producing. She has spent 40 years doing this activity and she thinks that the hardest thing is protecting her crops from insects that can affect them. With the strenghth that characterizes her, she works alone in her fields, and she learned how to get ahead on her own. She does hire workers to help her with the harvest. Besides having the support of her daughter, who has a truck with which she transports her product to the country's capital. “I have everything"  Nieves says,  “baskets, bushels and everything else for transportation”. In time, she hopes to buy more land to increase production. She belongs to the “Virgen María” community bank and this is her sixth loan with MFP, where she hopes to have cooperation to cement her plans. On the other hand, she is committed once more to making her payments, as with the previous loans she had. She also likes being a part of her community bank because all of the members are responisble and supportive.  Upon getting your support, Nieves will invest the money in buying 2 bags of pea seed and various bags of organic fertilizer with her next planting.

loans.use: to buy two bags of pea seed and various bags of organic ferilizer.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 46 years old, married and has three children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 
Aida has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a 14,000 PHP loan through Kiva partner, NWTF, to buy more fish to sell at her stall.
Aida has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell at her stall.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora Silvia le esta haciendo falta las protecciones en las puertas y ventanas. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para poder pagarle a la persona que se encargara de hacer las protecciones y colocarlas en la casa. Ya que le preocupa  su familia y tiene tres hijos a quienes les quiere dar la protección y seguridad en la casa. Pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para realizar la mejora. 
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte del sueldo que recibe de su trabajo en una compañía de trasporte como contadora, es la fuente de ingreso que tiene para su familia.
texts.en:
The windows and doors of Silvia's house lack protection.  She is seeking a loan to pay someone to make this protection and install it in her house.  This problem has been bothering her family, and she wants to make her home safer and more secure for her three children.

She plans to pay off the loan out of the wages she gets from her job as a conductor for a transport company, which is the family's source of income.

loans.use: to add protection to her doors and windows.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase chicks and chicken feed

loans.name: Nestor

texts.en:
Nestor, a father of 3 school-aged children, lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. He owns and operates a retail store in their place which consists of daily use merchandise and other necessities.  The store has existed for 4 years already. Nestor is trying his best not to close down business operations because it is through this business that he earns about PHP 4,000 a month.

Nestor is borrowing PHP 5,000 from GDMPC, a cooperative that lends money to finance small-scale entrepreneurs. This amount will be used to purchase daily use commodities to sell at a profit. When this investment works out, according to him, his business will grow even more. Then, the revenue gained from this investment is planned for expanding and improving his business.

loans.use: To purchase daily use commodities to sell.

loans.name: Juan Doroteo

texts.es: Juan Doroteo es un hombre luchador que tiene 67 años, su actividad económica es ofrecer el servicio acarreo. Hace más de 15 años que se hace cargo de este negocio, pues siempre se ha preocupado por proporcionarle a su esposa e hijo lo más necesario. El dio inicio a este negocio vendiendo leña, luego surgió la idea de ofrecer el servicio de acarreo que consiste en transportar cosas como camas, leña, refrigeradora, roperos, madera, tubos entre otros. Es así que solicita este financiamiento para la compra de llantas, comprar cuerdas y brindarle ciertos arreglos a su carretón.  El quiere seguir apoyando a sus hijos por medio de su trabajo.
texts.en:
Juan is a fighting man who is 67 years old, and in the business of providing a hauling service. He has been doing this for more than 15 years. He has always been concerned about providing his wife and child with their needs. 

He started his business selling firewood, and then had the idea of offering a hauling service to transport things like beds, firewood, refrigerators, closets, wood, and pipes among other things. 

He is asking for a loan in order to buy tires, and to buy rope, and to make improvements to his cart. He wants to continue supporting his children through the work that he does.

loans.use: to buy tires, and to buy rope, and to make improvements to his cart

loans.name: Elita

texts.en:
Elita is happily married and blessed  with three school-age children. Elita is 50 years old and lives in Rizal, Jimenez Misamis Occidental. Elita sells fruit like bananas and she sells also straw, "hinis"-used to clean pots and "chicharon"-skin of pig and cow to earn a living. Elita had been in this business for 6 years.

Elita earns a net income of PHP 5000 every month. She has requested a loan for PHP 15000 use to purchase additional bananas so sell in the market.

Elita has been a member of GDMPC for about 1 year.  In the future, Elita hopes to expand her business to the neighboring places.

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

GDMPC: People empowering people.

loans.use: additional capital in purchasing fruits

loans.name: Matar

texts.fr: Son activité principale est le maraîchage, il s'active dans ce domaine depuis plus de 15 ans. Habitant dans une ville située a quelques kilométrés de la capitale du Sénégal. Ce prêt est destiné au maraîchage, il veut acheté avec ce prêt des semences et d'engrais pour pour démarrer son activiter. Avec ce crédit, il pourra supporter les dépenses liées au champ.
texts.en:
For the last 15 years, Matar's main activity has been market gardening. He lives in a town located a few kilometers from Senegal's capital city. 

The loan will be used for market gardening. Matar wants to buy seeds and fertilizers to get started. With the loan, he can meet expenses relating to his land.

loans.use: to buy farming products.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.es:
Angelina tiene 46 años de edad, esta acompañada, y es madre de cuatro hijos. Angelina se dedica a la crianza de cerdos y gallinas a pequeña escala. Ella empezó a dedicarse a dicho oficio hace treinta años. Para dedicarse al engorde de cerdos y gallinas, Angelina compra los animales pequeños en una plaza que queda a 15km de distancia de su casa. Ella luego los vende en la misma plaza, 3 veces por mes.

Angelina ha solicitado un préstamo a Fundación Campo para comprar cuatros cerdos pequeños y 15 pollos. Tambien ella comprará tres sacos de concentrado y los medicamentos necesarios para prevenir que los animales se enfermen. Con el préstamo Angelina podra ayudar a su esposo con los ingresos de la casa; ya que él se dedica a la agricultura y los ingresos de esta actividad se obtienen de forma estacional. Los ingresos adicionales también le permitirán disponer de un poco más de efectivo para comprar los artículos de primera necesidadpara sus hijos.

En un futuro Angelina planea construir una galera pequeña para los cerdos. Su intención es comprar cerdas reporductoras, de manera que no tenga que estar comprando cerdos pequeños.
texts.en:
Angelina is 46, has a partner, and is the mother of four children. Angelina raises pigs and chickens on a small scale. She began to do this work 30 years ago.  

To make a living fattening pigs and chickens, Angelina buys small animals in a square 15km from her house. Then she sells them in the same square three times a month. Angelina has applied to Fundación Campo for a loan, in order to buy four small pigs and 15 chickens.

She will also buy three bags of feed concentrate, and the drugs needed to prevent the animals from getting sick. With the loan, Angelina will be able to help her husband by contributing to the family income, as he is a farmer and the income from this work is seasonal. The additional income will also allow her to have a little more cash available to buy basic household necessities for her children. 

In the future, Angelina plans to build a small shed for the pigs. She intends to buy breeding sows, so that she doesn't have to be buying small pigs.

loans.use: To buy four pigs and 15 chickens to fatten and sell.

loans.name: Sirvard

texts.en: Sirvard lives in the Shirak region of Armenia in the village of Karnout.  Karnout is far from the noise of the city and the air is fresh.  There are few economic opportunities except for farming and raising livestock.  Sirvard has been engaged as a farmer for the past nineteen years.  Owing to the services of microfinance she has been able to grow her business.  The terms and conditions are fair and rates are going down.  Sirvard would like a loan to purchase additional cattle and seeds.  This loan will help her increase the family income by twenty percent.  She would like to save some money to renovate her house and start a dairy production business.  She is pleased with her life and her wonderful husband, son, and daughter.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and seeds

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
Felicitas es socia del Banco Comunal Prosperidad, tiene 41 años, es madre de 01 hija, y es socia de FINCA Peru desde hace 3 años.
Felicitas vende carne en el mercado, gracias a los préstamos que ha recibido sin muchos trámites, ha logrado comprar equipos para su negocio, le gusta las reuniones de su Banco Comunal porque le enseñó a ahorrar, a valorar a su familia, a ser puntual y responsable. El préstamo que solicita ahora lo invertirá en la compra de carne, su meta es comprar un carro para su uso personal.
texts.en:
Felicitas is a member of Prosperidad Communal Bank. She is 41 years old, has one daughter and has been a member of FINCA Peru for the last three years.

Felicitas sells meat at the market. Thanks to the loans she has received without too much paperwork, she has been able to buy equipment for her business. She likes her communal bank’s meetings because there she has learned how to save, how to appreciate her family and how to be responsible and to be punctual. 

She will invest the loan she is requesting now in the purchase of meat. Her goal is to buy a car for her personal use.

loans.use: to purchase meat.

loans.name: Carlos Josue

texts.es:
El señor Carlos, tiene 28 años de edad, esta casado, tiene 2 hijos de 7 y 14 años,  reside en  una Comunidad rural del Municipio de Taulabe, Comayagua.
su esposa se dedica a oficios domesticos, uno de sus hijos esta estudiando la educacacion primaria.
La actividad que Don Carlos desarrolla es la agricultura (siembra de granos basicos) y la construccion (albañileria).
Ha solicitado un prestamo para comprar fertilizantes que le ayudaran a nutrir mas el suelo para que el cultivo de frijol se desarrolle mejor. El espera vender la produccion a buen precio para aumentar sus ingresos familiares.
texts.en:
Carlos, 28, is single and has two children who are 7 and 14 years old.  He lives in a rural community in the Municipality of Taulabe, Comayagua.  His wife does domestic chores and one of his children is in elementary school.

Carlos is a farmer (basic grains) and works in construction too (bricklaying).  He has requested a loan to buy fertilizer that will help him better nourish his bean crop so that it will develop better.  He hopes to sell his harvest at a good price to increase family income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Tima

texts.en:
Tima is a widowed woman with three children, one of whom is attending school. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her child.

Tima has operated a café for the past two years; her potential clients are her neighbors and passers by. She faces a major challenge of competition from other operators. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the KES 10,000 she wants to purchase more food products like maize flour, wheat flour, sugar, rice and cooking oil for her café. She decided to join Yehu because of their quality financial services.

loans.use: to purchase more food products like maize flour, wheat flour, sugar, rice and cooking oil for her café.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es: Ricardo solicitó el préstamo para pagar el curso de finalización de estudios de la carerra de Ingeniería Civil. Espera en un futuro mejorar su situación económica, ser un profesional de ejemplo para la sociedad. Espera desarrollar proyectos, construir para Nicaragua. Quiere invertir en su profesión porque dice que vale la pena servir a la gente, y sobre todo afinar más el conocimento de su carrera. El desafío de un profesional es hacer que las cosas se hagan bien siempre.
