texts.en: Ricardo requested the loan to pay for his final course in Civil Engineering.  He hopes in future to improve his economic situation and become an exemplary professional in society.  He hopes to develop projects to build Nicaragua.  He wants to invest in his profession because he says it’s worthwhile to serve people above all to hone his knowledge in his career still more.  The challenge for a professional is that things are done well always.

loans.use: to pay tuition.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more items for her catalog sales business.

loans.name: Shahnaz's Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz has requested a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for the improvement of her son’s LPG gas cylinders sales business. He has a good clientele base of regular customers. His father also spends some time with him during the day and guides him off and on.
 
With the loan investment, he will purchase a larger number of gas cylinders, which will allow him to fulfill the client orders on time and increase his profits.
 
Shahnaz is a seamstress as well as embroidery expert. She works for her neighborhood clients to financially support her husband. He is a farmer and grows different crops. Shahnaz has two other daughters and sons. All of them work except the youngest one who is studying in class 7th. She is confident that her son’s business will be improved after an investment and she will be able to save some profits for her eldest daughter’s marriage.

loans.use: To buy LPG gas cylinders to sell

loans.name: Guardabarranco Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres socias exitosas una de ellas es María Elena que se dedica a vender cosméticos de la Avon desde hace 10 años, es una mujer casada, con tres hijos menores. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de cosméticos variados de la Avon y ropa nueva, Doris vende frijoles cocidos, hielo, helados, refrescos naturales y Yamileth vende comida ambulante en un mercado local de la capital y ropa.
texts.en: This group is made up of three successful members. One of them is María Elena, who has worked selling Avon cosmetics for 10 years. She is a married woman, with three children under 18. She will invest the loan in assorted Avon cosmetics and new clothing. Doris sells cooked beans, ice, ice cream, and natural soft drinks. Yamileth sells food and clothing as a mobile vendor in a local market in the capital.

loans.use: to buy assorted cosmetics from Avon and new clothing

loans.name: Luz Ana

texts.es:
Luz Ana tiene 59 años de edad, es casada y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene cinco hijos, ella nació en la ciudad de Cerro de Pasco pero vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco. Su actividad económica principal es la venta de zapatos. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar zapatos. 

Se encuentra contenta por el préstamo pues se compromete a pagar sus cuotas puntualmente y agradece por la ayuda brindada.
texts.en:
Luz Ana is 59 years old. She is married and has five children as the fruit of this beautiful relationship. She was born in the city of Cerro de Pasco but she lives in the beautiful city of Cusco. Her principal business activity is shoe sales. She has been selling shoes for several years and has done very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work. At this time she needs a loan in order to purchase more shoes.

Luz Ana is happy with her loan and she is committed to making all of her payments on time. She is grateful for the help that is being provided her.

loans.use: to purchase shoes..

loans.name: Israel Antonio

texts.es:
Don Israel es pequeño agricultor, pero su especialidad es el comercio de productos perecederos la mayoría del tiempo vende verduras y frutas de manera ambulante, viaja diario a las comunidades cercanas para poder realizar sus ventas siendo esta actividad que le ha permitido mantener a su familia y sobre todo a sus dos hijos en situación estable de vida. 

Para Israel no es tan fácil ganarse el pan de cada día, pues hay días buenos y otros malos y como su negocio se trata de productos perecederos los que no logra vender se malean  creando inestabilidad a su bolsillo, ante esta situación hay momentos que se queda sin productos que ofrecer y acude al crédito como ahora, de esta manera echa mano nuevamente con tal de poder tener un capital y salir adelante.  manifiesta sentirse muy agradecido con Kiva que se especializa en apoyar al sector de escasos recursos económicos y con necesidad de salir de mejorar su calidad de vida sin tener un medio para hacerlo de no ser el crédito.

Su mayor propósito es ver a sus hijos preparados como todo padre responsable busca la manera de darles lo mejor para que en el futuro se ganan la vida diferente y no atraviesen tantas dificultades económicas como él por no haber estudiado.

loans.use: Comprar Verduras para su negocio que le permite darle el sustento a su familia, piensa continuar en el mercado con este préstamo que sera el capital inicial de su labor cotidiana.

loans.name: Omari

texts.en: Omari lives in Kitunda area of Dar es Salaam.He is married with two children.He owns a retail shop near his residence.The shop sells different consumable items especially food items,rice in particular. Rice is one of staple food in Tanzania.Jafari plans to increase the stock of rice.There is an expectation of rice price rise.Having enough stock now will help him make more money later.The extra stock demands more funding.Through his savings he managed to contribute 20% of the required stocking.The strategy will help him increase income.The aim being to sustain the family and pay for school fees for his children. To implement his plans Omari needs USD 550 as a working capital.

loans.use: WORKING CAPITAL

loans.name: Joel

texts.en: I am a 31-year-old father of one.  I take care of 3 other children. My life will improve because I will be able to pay the school fees for the 2 in secondary school. I want the loan to enable me to earn a profit of US $3 a day.

loans.use: Expand and pay for license

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is a family man with six children who are all in primary school. He is the treasurer of a local group in the Jairos area. George has not undergone any form of training but is a shrewd and smart businessperson. He has repaid two previous loans with PEMCI in a timely manner. He started trading in cattle, goats and sheep in 1996 as a way of making ends meet, and with time has been able to support his family. With the proposed  additional loan of $300, he plans to increase his stock of animals to trade so as to increase his turnover and income. With additional funds, he will be able able to visit more market places in a week without having to wait until he has sold off the old stock. With less pressure for cash, he is also able to hold his animals and only sell when prices are good. Hence, the performance of his business is expected to improve with additional liquidity. With the income he generates, he is able to educate his children and take care of their needs. He has proven to be a good client and we highly recommend him for funding.

loans.use: Boost his Livestock Trading Business

loans.name: Khaya Gul

texts.en: Khaya Gul lives in district 15 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She lives with all the members of her family. She is uneducated but she is a driver and she has lots of experience. The engine of her car is not working. She wants to take a group loan to buy a new engine for her car to help her husban support their family. She is happy with this loan and she would like to thank AFSG.

loans.use: To buy new engine

loans.name: Feliza

texts.es:
Feliza L. is the treasurer for the Armonía de Pro Mujer association. She is married and the mother of four children. Feliza works in carpentry alongside her husband in their shop, which they have had for the past 10 years. They make a variety of products and fill orders for furniture, doors, and other such items.

Feliza is in need of capital to buy a large quantity of wood, due to the processing time that is necessary to be able to use the material. She also needs to invest in plywood, since this material is difficult to find at the end of the year. Only in this way will she be able to meet existing demand.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Feliza L. es secretaria de hacienda de la asociación de Armonía de Pro Mujer, casada y madre de cuatro hijos. Feliza se dedica al trabajo en carpintería junto con su esposo, en un taller propio el cual tienen hace 10 años, elaborando distintos productos y atendiendo pedidos como muebles puertas y otros. Actualmente Feliza precisa de capital para poder comprar mayor cantidad de madera tomando en cuenta el tiempo de procesado de la misma para poder ser utilizada como materia prima. Del mismo modo necesita invertir en la compra de venesta, ya que este material es escaso a fin de año, solo de esta manera podrá hacer frente a la demanda existente.

loans.use: To buy a large quantity of wood, due to the processing time that is necessary to be able to use the material

loans.name: Marian

texts.en: Mrs. Marian R. learned the business of selling clothes from her mother and started her own business in 2004. She is 26 years old, married with two children, and lives in Delta State, Nigeria. Marian will be glad if you can assist her with a loan of $325 to enable her buy more clothes for resale. She is a faithful LAPO member.

loans.use: To buy more used clothing for sale

loans.name: Joana Bento

texts.pt:
Joana Bento M. is 44 years old, married, and is the mother of 4 children. She lives in Polana Caniço and has her business in the Chai market in the Maxaquene district in maputo. She sells drinks and sodas. She is new to the program and is looking for a 6.000MT loan to replenish her stocks.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer.

Joana Bento M. tem 44 anos de idade, vive maritalmente e é mãe de 4 filhos. Vive no bairo Polana Caniço e tem o seu negócio no mercado Chai no bairro da Maxaquene em Maputo. Vende bebidas e refrigerantes. É nova no programa e pretende tomar um empréstimo de 6.000MT para reforçar o stock do negócio.

loans.use: Increase Inventory

loans.name: Florinda

texts.es:
Florinda has, through time, learned to care for animals and to value the land that has fed her since she was very young. Since she was a girl she has maintained a close bond with the kindness of nature and she works with satisfaction in this area. She wants to increase the quantity of her lambs and the production of her lands. She would like to purchase a small house in the capital of her country in order to have a place where she can stay when she goes to market the products that she obtains from her arduous work. For this reason she requests your aid in order to obtain the amount that she needs to acquire a greater quantity of small animals and to increase the quality and quantity of her agricultural products.

translated from Spanish by B, Kiva volunteer

Aurora, a través del tiempo aprendió a querer a los animales y valorar la tierra que desD. muy niña la alimentó; ya que desD. niña mantuvo estrecha relación con las bondades D. la naturaleza y sus actividades las realiza con satisfacción en este rubro.Desea incrementar la cantidad D. sus carneritos y la producción D. sus tierras, para posibilitar el cumplimiento D. la compra D. una pequeña casita en la capital D. su país a fin D. tener un lugar donD. cobijarse cuando realice cada uno D. sus viajes para comercializar los productos que obtiene luego D. su arduo trabajo. Por esta razón recurre en tu ayuda a fin D. obtener la cantidad que necesita para adquirir mayor cantidad D. animalitos y acrecentar la calidad y cantidad D. sus productos agrícolas.

loans.use: To buy more lambs and to improve the quantity and quality of her agricultural products

loans.name: Urania Del Carmen

texts.es:
Urania del Carmen Rodriguez V. is married and a mother of two children that are still in school. Her grocery store opened six years ago in the neighborhood of Chichigalpa in Chinandega. Urania was not able to finish her secondary studies as her economic situation forced her to abandon her studies. She felt a need to have her own income to avoid depending 100% on her husband.

Currently, her husband´s income and the income generated by her grocery store provide for her family and allow her to keep her two children in school. Mrs.Urania has been working with CEPRODEL over the past 3 years and she is very happy to have received the microloans necessary to purchase stock for her business. These loans have helped her to meet her clients expectations daily. She has received 12 microloans from CEPRODEL.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva volunteer.<

loans.use: Purchase milk, sugar, rice, meat, chicken, oil, cheese, etc...

loans.name: Sili Centre - Group 1

texts.en: The village of Sili on Savaii Island is one of the well-endowed villages in terms of natural resources.  It has very rich soil, with a large number of springs and creeks which serve as natural irrigation for farms located at the foot of the mountain ranges.  The village learned about SPBD through the radio talk-back shows and from a meeting SPBD staff made with a village chief.  Many women expressed desire to join the microfinance program.  Faamalie's group was the first to undergo the four week SPBD training sessions.  They have successfully prepared their farm plans and budgets, which are the basis of their loan proposals.  Most of the households in Sili village farm taro, bananas and vegetables.  They sell their products in the capital town of Salelologa, which is about 40 kilometers from the village.

loans.use: Purchase of farm implements (bush knives, crowbar, sprayer), agricultural supplies (seeds, seedlings, fertilizers, weed killers) and payment for additional farmhands

loans.name: Najib

texts.en: Najib is 46 years old and has five children. He lives with his family in south Lebanon, in the town of Nabatieh, where he works as a car mechanic. He has applied for a loan from Al Majmoua to buy several car engines, which he will use to maintain and expand his business.

loans.use: to buy car engines

loans.name: Artemio

texts.en:
Artemio V. (38) is married to Norma (31). The couple lives in Luque with his two school aged daughters.

Artemio worked previously in construction. But one day, his friend offered him a job opportunity as a company’s driver and he accepted the proposal. He took advantage of this experience and later on, with the savings from that job, he bought a car. That is how Artemio became a taxi driver. Nowadays, he owns a space in a taxi stand. Artemio wants to buy many cars in order to have an entire taxi stand in his neighborhood in the future. His desire is to leave a small company to his daughters to given them a secure income.

Artemio plans to sell his old car and, with that money plus the money provided by the credit, he wants to buy a new car.

loans.use: Purchase of a new car

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en: Hassan is a 40-year-old man who lives in Nabatieh, in southern Lebanon. Hassan sells mobile phones. This is the sixth time he had applied to Al Majmoua for a loan. He needs to buy merchandise to sustain and develop his business.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Basirat

texts.en: Basirat B. sells jewellries and pillows in her community. She is 27-years-old and married with three children. She worked for another businessperson for five years before she started hers. Basirat has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past two years.  She is requesting for a loan of $350 to buy additional jewellries and pillows to sale.

loans.use: To purchase additional jewelry items and pillows for resale

loans.name: Seun

texts.en: Seun O. is 35 years old and married to Mr. O..They have 4 children and they live in Benin City.  She runs a patent medicine store (pharmacy) where she sells drugs to people in her community. Seun learned this business for 2 years and she started her own patent medicine store in 2007. She is a LAPO client.  Seun needs the loan amount of US$ 875 to buy more drugs for sale. Seun is happy and she says thank you to Kiva lenders and Lapo.

loans.use: To buy more drugs for sale

loans.name: Holnisso

texts.ru: Нурова Холниссо жительница города Турсунзаде.Возраст 37 лет, разведенна , имеет 3 детей. Клиентка занимается куплей продажей пледов и одеял. Она торгует на рынке «Саховат».Содержит своих детей она сама,так как  муж бросил семью.Холниссо хочет получить кредит на увеличение ассортимента торговой точки.Планирует погасить кредит в течении 8 месяцев..
texts.en:
Holnisso N. lives in Tursun-zoda. She is 37 years old, divorced, and has 3 children. The client buys and sells rugs and blankets. She trades in the Sakhovat market. She supports the children herself since her husband abandoned the family. Holnisso wants to take out a loan to increase the variety of goods in her shop. She plans to pay off the loan in 8 months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: increase the variety of goods for sale

loans.name: "las Emprendedoras" Commercial Bank Group

texts.es:
El Banco de Emprendimiento LAS EMPRENDEDORAS inicio actividades con catorce socias, las mismas viven en la zona de Villa Victoria, zona que se encuentra en el lado oeste de la ciudad de La Paz, en esta zona generalmente se dedican al comercio y servicio  y por ende la mayoría de las socias se dedican a estos rubros. 

El Banco de emprendimiento LAS EMPRENDDEDORAS es reestructuración del Banco de Emprendimiento DIOS ES AMOR trabaja con nuestra Institución  tres ciclos, habiéndose fundado el 03 de octubre de 2007, actualmente se mantienen en el grupo 10 socias, teniendo como mesa directiva: 

- 	Presidenta			Mery Margot A. C. 
-	Tesorera			Cinda G. Bascope
-	Secretaria			Pamela VAsquez M.

Se debe resaltar que el grupo trabaja con mucha solidaridad, compañerismo y responsabilidad; aprendieron al interior de la asociación a ahorrar aun teniendo problemas en un anterior ciclo, las socias no quisieron abandonar nuestra institución. Las razones que las motiva a trabajar en este tipo de crédito , al margen del crédito es que las señoras  señalan que al interior de la asociación encuentran un espacio de esparcimiento, motivación, confraternización, un espacio donde se sienten escuchadas y pueden hablar de sus problemas personales, para luego salir y poder nuevamente hacer frente a todos sus problemas.

Verónica Erika A. P.: Ella tiene como actividad principal la vente de té, con su actividad y junto a la ayuda de su esposo ven la posibilidad de poder mantener a sus dos hijos, la cuales actualmente son estudiantes, su único sueño es ver realizados a sus hijos profesionalmente es por eso que acudieron a nuestra institución para poder incrementar mas su negocio.

Cinda Gonzáles Bascope: La señora actualmente trabaja como repartición de víveres, antes ella vendía comida pero la señora al dedicar mas tiempo a sus hijos tuvo que optar por repartir víveres, su único sueño es que a sus hijos no les falte nada a esto también le colabora su esposo que es electricista pero la señora como madre es mas dedicada a su trabajo y sus hijos. Es una vecina de la zona de villa victoria.

Maria de Carmen C. S.: La señora es una persona muy responsable, ya que ella en todo el día se moviliza a dos lugares una que es desde Villa Victoria donde se ubica su domicilio hasta El Alto porque ahí tiene su puesto de venta de pan ubicado en el Ceibo, para luego bajar, hasta su domicilio para vender lubricantes, pero es una mujer que a pesar de ir y venir siempre esta al pendiente de sus hijos, su esposo es chofer de un taxi la cual también aporta para la canasta familiar y otros gastos de manutención en el hogar.

Janeth Cristina N.: La actividad que desempeña es en la atención de un punto cotel e Internet ya que ella aspira por poder ver a su único hijo profesional pero también ella aspira a poder comprarse una casa para su familia sola es por eso que trabaja seis días a la semana es una persona muy dedicada a su negocio y su familia. Su esposo es sastre y trabaja en su domicilio.

Vicente C. M.: Un hombre responsable con su familia, el como padre de familia ocupa un lugar especial en su casa ya que sus hijos lo ven como el ejemplo para sus vidas. Presenta dos actividades para poder sustentar la canasta familiar y el estudio de sus hijos una la del servicio de amplificación y la tienda de barrio, su esposa se dedica en la venta de comida, el no quiere que sus hijos sean simplemente vendedores sino sean profesionales es por eso que se esfuerza en sus actividades para poder darles lo mejor y algún día sean personas de bien.

Mery Margot A. C.: Ella es una persona sola ya que todavía no encontró una pareja que sea una compañía para ella, su sueño es tener una familia que sea ejemplo dentro su medio pero ella es paciente y espera, pero así misma, ella vende todos los productos de belleza, ella con su negocio ahorrara para lo futuro para que no le falte nada también aspira por tener su casa propia donde pueda vivir cómodamente.

Pamela Lucy V. M.: Una jovencita dedicada a sus estudios y su trabajo ya que con eso sustenta todo lo que le hace falta para poder ser una profesional, actualmente ella no tiene hijos es por eso que aprovecha esta oportunidad para poder surgir y terminar su profesión ella vende todo en cuanto a material de escritorio con la ayuda de sus padres este préstamo que necesita le ayuda más para sus estudios.  

Rossemary Marcela M. M.: Una mujer que juntamente a su esposo velan por el bienestar de sus hijos pero el detalle es que ella se encuentra todo el día en su casa atendiendo una tiendita ubicada en su mismo domicilio y siempre estar al pendiente de sus hijos escuchándolos y ayudando en lo que pueda su esposo trabaja todo el día como obrero en una fabrica ubicada en El Alto el sueño de ambos es verlos crecer a sus hijos sin que les falte nada.

Guillermo Tito T. Cossio: El señor lastimosamente es divorciado, actualmente no cuenta con alguna persona al cuidado de él porque su esposa se los llevo dejándole solo, pero esto no fue motivo para no poder vivir, aun con esa soledad el señor sigue adelante, aprovecha los encuentros deportivos que existen en su barrio para poder vender refrescos, dulces y otros productos, también esta en la elaboración de zapatos para poder tener un poco mas de ingreso, él  sigue viviendo con la esperanza de ver nuevamente a sus hijos.

Beatriz Maria P. Q.: Tiene al cuidado de sus dos hijos juntamente a su esposo los dos hacen lo posible para mantenerlos ante esta situación que atraviesa el país, ella requiere de este préstamo para poder incrementar su capital de trabajo par ala venta de pan y con el ahorro que va a generar poder hacer estudiar a sus hijos. Es una mujer dedicada y responsable.
texts.en:
The Entrepreneurs Commercial Bank opened its doors with four members, who live in the vicinity of Villa Victoria, an area located on the west side of the city of La Paz. In general, this area of town is devoted to commerce and services, and therefore the majority of bank members fall into this category. The Entrepreneurs Commercial Bank has its roots in the restructuring of God’s Love Commerical Bank. It was founded on October 3, 2007, and has worked with this field partner through three loan cycles. Currently the group has ten members. President Mery Margot A. C., treasurer Cinda G. Bascope, and secretary Pamela Vasquez M. sit on its board of directors. It should be noted that the group projects solidarity, companionship, and responsibility; those within the association have learnt to save despite encountering setbacks in the last loan cycle. Members do not want to leave the association. This type of loan in particular motivates the members to work. The ladies indicate that within their association they find a place that provides relaxation, motivation, and companionship, a setting where they feel heard and can speak of personal problems, a haven from which they can then go forth empowered to once again tackle those problems. Verónica Erika A. P.’ main business is the sale of tea. Due to this business and together with her husband’s assistance, Verónica envisions the possibility of being able to support their two children, both of whom are still in school. Her sole dream of seeing her children become professionals caused her to join the association to be able to expand her business. Cinda G. Bascope currently works in food distribution. In the past she sold food; however, in order to spend more time with her children she opted for becoming a distributor. She dreams that her children would lack for nothing and works with her husband, an electrician, towards this end. As a mother, she is dedicated to her work and her children. Cinda lives in the Villa Victoria neighborhood. Maria de Carmen C. S. is a person who has a great deal of responsibility. Throughout the day she commutes between Villa Victoria, where her home is located, and El Alto where she markets bread in El Ceibo, returning once again to her home to sell lubricants. Despite her comings and goings, she is always within earshot of her children. Her husband drives a taxi, which puts food on the table and contributes to household maintenance. Janeth Cristina N. plays her part at a Punto Cotel, a La Paz telecommunications company that provides Internet, telephone and cable television services. She dreams of seeing her only son become a professional, but also hopes to be able to buy a house for her family, and to attain this goal works six days a week. She is a person who is very dedicated to her business and to her family. Her husband is a tailor, who works out of the home. Vincente C. M. shoulders a lot of responsibility for his family. As the head of household, this father occupies a special role in his home since his children look to him as a role model. He engages in two endeavors to put food on the table and contribute to his children’s education, an expansion service and the neighborhood store. His wife sells food. Not wanting his children to be simple shopkeepers but to become professionals, he puts all his efforts towards giving them the best so that one day they might be persons of means. Mery Margot A. C. is single because she has not yet found the ideal partner. Her dream is to have a family that would be a shining example to those around them, but she is patient and ever hopeful. She sells all sorts of beauty products and due to the business is able to save for the future so she will not be in need. She also hopes to have her own house where she might live comfortably. Pamela Lucy Vasquez M. is a young woman devoted to her studies and her work, on the road to becoming a professional. At present she has no children and therefore can take advantage of this opportunity to be able to move forward and complete her education. She sells office supplies. Her parents’ help and the needed loan will assist her in completing her studies. Rossemary Marcela M. M. is a woman who, together with her husband, looks out for the welfare of her children. She spends her day in her home tending a small shop located in the house itself, always within earshot of her children, listening to them and helping them with whatever she can. Her husband works all day as a laborer in a factory located in El Alto. Both dream of seeing their children grow up without lacking anything. Guillermo Tito T. Cossio unfortunately is divorced. At present he has no one in his care as his wife took the children, leaving him alone. However, this was not a reason to give up on life. Despite the solitude, he moves forward, taking advantage of neighborhood sporting events to sell soft drinks, candy and other products. He also makes shoes in order to have a bit more income. He continues to live with the hope of seeing his children once again. Beatriz Maria P. Q. has two children in her care. She and her husband do everything possible to support them. Due to the current circumstances facing the country, she is in need of this loan to be able to increase her working capital for the sale of bread, and the profit generated will allow her children to complete their education. She is a very dedicated and responsible woman.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials

loans.name: Inh

texts.en: Mrs. Inh S. lives in Prey Tamao Village in Takeo Province. She is 31 years old and married with three children who all attend  the local school. She owns a piece of land where she can cultivate rice. She now faces an obstacle because she does not have animals to plow and must hire someone to do this. Mrs. Inh S. would like a loan of $500 for this purpose. She would use the rest of the loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides to make her crop more productive. Her husband, Mr. Tith Torn, is a laborer. Her husband appears with her in the photo.

loans.use: To hire a laborer with two oxen to plow the rice field and to buy fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en: Mrs. Nguyen Thi T. is 43 years old.  She has been part of TYM Fund since 2002.  She lives in Hung Yen commune, Hung Nguyen district, Nghe An province with her husband and four children.  Her husband is a construction worker.  Now her family’s main income is from raising chickens and her husband’s salary.  Their business developed well and brings her family an income of 2.5 million VND (about $140 US) per month.  This time she wants to borrow 11 million VND ($650 US) to buy more chickens and chicken feed for raising them.

loans.use: To buy more chickens and chicken feed.

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr:
Menuisier de formation, Monsieur A. Kokou est né en 1967 à Gapé. Marié et père de six (06) enfants, il exerce avec détermination et professionnalisme son métier. Ce qui lui confère une réputation notoire et une sollicitation de toutes parts. Il entretient de très bonnes relations avec de grands services, des institutions, entreprises qui lui confient souvent des marchés à réaliser et qu'il n’arrive plus à satisfaire face à l'augmentation des prix des planches sur le marché. C’est pourquoi il voudrait aller dans les fermes et villages pour s’approvisionner en gros et constituer ainsi un stock important de planches afin de servir à temps les clients et décrocher d’autres marchés importants qui l’échappent aujourd’hui faute de moyens financiers.
Ainsi sollicite-t-il un financement pour réaliser son vœux le plus cher de manière à s’imposer dans son quartier.
texts.en:
Mr. Kokou A. was born in 1967 in Gapé, he is a carpenter. He is married and the father of six children, he practices his trade with determination and professionalism. This confers him a good reputation and orders from everywhere. He has very good relations with large service industries, institutions, businesses that often give him contracts and he cannot meet the demand anymore because of the increase in the price of boards. This is why, he would like to go to farms and villages to buy in bulk and build up a large stock of boards. That would allow him to serve his clients on time and to obtain other large contracts that he can't currently get because he lacks the financial means. Thus, he is requesting a loan to fulfill his dearest wish and to establish himself in his neighborhood.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stoskage de bois et planches

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Phạm Thị L. năm nay  46 tuổi, gia đình chị có 3 con trong đó hai con đã trưởng thành. Năm 1999 chị L. tham gia Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi và làm đậu phụ bán. Hiện nay đây cũng là công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị với thu nhập 3.500.000đ/ tháng.
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để  đầu tư cho chăn nuôi và mua nguyên liệu làm đậu phụ.
texts.en:
Mrs. Phạm Thị L. is 46 years old. She has three children, two of which are grown. In 1999, she joined TYM Fund and borrowed capital to invest in raising livestock and in making tofu to sell. These businesses are her family's main source of income today providing 3,500,000 VND per month. This loan cycle, she hopes to borrow 10,000,000 VND to reinvest in both her businesses of rearing livestock and to purchase the materials to make and sell tofu.

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rearing Livestock & Productions and Sales of Tofu

loans.name: Kangni

texts.fr:
N. Kanyi est un jeune homme qui habite le quartier de kotokou kondji. Il a pour activité génératrice de revenus la vente des objets de friperie, ce qu’il fait depuis 2001, il s’approvisionne au marché d’assiyéyé. Il demande son premier crédit de wages d’un montant de 300000F pour acheter 04 balles de chemise et  des pantalons en gros.
Il est célibataire sans enfants, il arrive avec ce qu’il gagne de plus à soutenir sa famille.
texts.en:
Kanyi N. is a young man who lives in the Kotokou Kondji neighborhood. The business he has been running since 2001 consists in reselling used clothing, that he gets at the Assiyéyé market. He's seeking his first loan from Wages, to buy wholesale 4 bales of shirts and trousers. He's unmarried and without children, and counts on his additional income to support his family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and bales of shirts and trousers

loans.name: Mousa

texts.en: Mousa is a 28 year old man who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon. Mousa has been working as a car electrician. He also sells electrical accessories. Mousa has requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his garage. This is the first time that Mousa has requested a loan. His clients are his friends, neighbors and people from his region. Mousa decided on doing this business because of his experience. In the future, he plans on expanding his business in order to improve his income because he will get married soon.

loans.use: Mousa will use the loan to purchase tools for his garage.

loans.name: Mey's Group

texts.en: A leader S., 38, is a widow mother to one child whom is a student. She owns a general store selling plastic, kid's sweets, cooked ingredients, charcoal, gasoline, noodle ...etc to the whole community since 2000. By the store, she has a lot of customers and she earns a good benefit because she is famous for good service and responsibility. To support her child's education, Seroeun wants to have more income. Seroeun is applying for the loan to build a bigger store and to buy more products for her store. The other group members are: T., 37, who serves rice as the breakfast meal, is taking the loan to invest in her selling. And S., 48, who owns a shop selling groceries, is looking for a loan to buy more products for her shop. They all live in Phnom Penh city, Cambodia. A sister of S. is in picture too.

loans.use: To build a larger store and to buy more products for her store

loans.name: Ángela

texts.es: Ángela tiene 22 años, vive con su madre y sus hermanos en la casa de sus padres. Se dedica a la venta de ropa para jóvenes, la cual ofrece a personas conocidas y familiares lejanos, negocio que viene realizando desde hace un año. Su forma de venta es mediante visitas a sus clientes con algunas prendas como muestra y con sus habilidades de convencimiento asegura sus pedidos. La mercadería que adquiere lo hace al por mayor de una tienda de ropa donde ella labora. Para más adelante Ángela sueña con tener una boutique donde venda ropa exclusiva para jóvenes, por lo que está ahorrando para tener un capital estable para concretar su sueño. Es la primera vez que viene solicitando un préstamo con MFP, y está muy contenta de ser parte de su banco comunal, donde promete ser muy responsable de sus cuentas. El dinero requerido será invertido en la compra de más prendas de vestir, en especial polos de temporada, de esa manera, podrá abastecer a sus clientes con sus pedidos.
texts.en:
Ángela is 22 years old and lives with her mother and her siblings in the house of their parents. She sells children’s clothing, which she offers to people she knows and far-away relatives. She has been conducting her business for one year. She sells her products by visiting with her customers with some sample garments and with her persuasive selling techniques she ensures her orders. She acquires most of her merchandise from a clothing store where she works.

For the future Ángela dreams of having a boutique where she would sell exclusive clothing for children, for this reason she is now saving in order to have stable capital to achieve her dream. This is the first time that she has solicited a loan from MFP, and she is very happy to be a part of her communal bank, where she promises to be very responsible with her repayments. The requested money will be invested in the purchase of more garments, specifically seasonal polo shirts so she will be able to supply her customers’ orders.

Translated from Spanish by Breanne Kochert, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase of merchandise

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Ms. Angela N. is from Purok Sandayong, Sto. Niño, Pagadian, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is a widow with 2 kids. Having started her sari-sari (variety) store business from a very small capital, she is coping well with the challenges of her business. The small business is doing so well that she has confidently decided to expand to gain more income.

She joined Paglaum MPC for the chance to access a loan. She is now requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to further capitalize her business. She is determined to maintain a good credit standing whatever may happen, so she can always go to the cooperative in the future. She also dreams of renovating their little house and to start saving now for the education of her children.

loans.use: to expand her little variety store

location.town: Pagadian-Purok Sandayong, Sto. Niño, Pagadian City

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To grow pineapples

loans.name: Monico

texts.en:
Monico, 49, is a resident of Barangay Cabaruan Naguilian, Isabela. He is married to Julieta D., 47, who runs a grocery store in Roxas, Isabela, away from her family. Monico is requesting a loan of PHP 4,000 to expand his wife’s business. He feels that by taking out this loan, he will make his wife happy and proud of him. He hopes that with the help of the loan, she will be able to provide for all of her children’s needs. According to him, his wife hopes to move home one day so that they can start a business selling cooked snacks like pancit bihon. He believes that someday, with their combined diligence, they can achieve their dreams.

The couple is blessed with four children, all of whom are studying. The eldest, Jemar, is 15 years old, Glydel is 13 years old, Patrick James is 8 years old and the youngest, Klydis, is 6 years old.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Malika

texts.en: Malika is a lovely 32-year-old woman who lives with her three children. She runs a small fabrics-selling business where she offers at the market a variety of types of fabric for different tastes and ages. Malika is asking for this loan so that she can buy a larger quantity of goods. The extra capital will enable her to expand her merchandise and thus improve her business and increase her profits. Her dreams are to have her own large store one day—but most importantly, enable her children to have a better future, one where they can continue to study at the university, become professionals, and lead healthy and comfortable lives. On behalf of Malika and everyone here at IMON International, thank you for your support! More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase new fabrics for increasing her range of goods

loans.name: Nasreen Muhammad Mushtaq Group

texts.en:
Nasreen baji has lived in Lahore, Pakistan for the past 20 years. Lahore is famous for its historical places and Punjabi food. Nasreen baji is a very active lady. She sews clothes to pay off her utilities. Her husband, M. M., has run a plastic pipe making business for over 8 years. Nasreen baji is applying for a loan to buy items (plastic beads and patterns) to advance her husband’s business.

This loan serves four other people:
 
Abida baji wants a loan to buy blankets to sell.  
Shabana baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart for loading. 
Rubina baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). 
Sadaf baji wants a loan to buy items (creams, cosmetics) for her beauty shop. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: Nasreen baji wears a white dress and working on a sewing machine in this photo.

loans.use: To buy material for plastic pipe making.

loans.name: Саломат

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Ёкубова Саломат 1960 года рождения, замужем имеет четверых детей. Саломат занимается торговлей продуктами питание. Она закупает товар на оптовых рынках города Худжанда и возит продавать в районы области. В этом ей помогает муж. Торговля идет успешно так как сейчас сезон свадеб. Поэтому она хочет, разнообразить свой ассортимент. На запрашиваемый займ Саломат закупит печенье и разных видов конфет.

loans.use: на закупку печенье, разных видов конфет

loans.name: Bulubandi North Nakagolo Hasifa Group

texts.en: N. Hasifa is 23,  married, has two children and also looks after two dependents. She has owned a bakery for 5 years. She is requesting a loan to buy more equipment, ingredients and so forth. She is a hardworking business lady whose dream is to purchase a plot of land.

loans.use: To improve her bakery business and buy more equipment, ingredients and so forth.

loans.name: Juana Catarina

texts.es: La Señora  Juana Catarina L. L. cuenta con 57  años de edad, es Viuda vive conjuntamente con sus dos hijos y actualmente  se dedica a la Artesanía como costurera de delantales típicos lleva 8 años dedicándose a esta actividad cuenta con dos maquinas industriales, y se encuentra en el lugar conocido como paraje Xeatzam del Cantón Nimapa Municipio y Departamento de Totonicapán  actualmente la demanda de sus clientes a crecido y por las condiciones en la que ella vive no son suficientes para ampliar su capital de trabajo y así cubrir la demanda por tal razón se acerco a la Instalación de la ASOCIACION ASDIR para adquirir un pequeño préstamo y así crear otra fuente de ingresos. Generando mejores oportunidades en su trabajo como también sus ingresos a si poder cubrir sus gastos mensuales.

loans.use: Artesania (Compra de materia prima)

loans.name: Leonara Penina

texts.en:
Leonara is 28 years old. She is married to Martin Moya, who works in a clearing and forwarding company. They have three children, Hellen, Rose and Wayne, who are 12, 6-1/2 and 2 years old, respectively.

Leonara was introduced to KADET by existing group members. She has no previous loans from other MFIs. She has been in the clothing materials business for three years. Her business is in a densely populated with reliable monthly customers.

Leonara will use her loan to buy more material for women's dresses. The demand for this material is high, especially at the end of each month, when the business is at its peak. Leonara plans to purchase a sewing machine with the extra profits from her loan.

Her hopes and dreams are to be a wholesaler and own a material shop. Leonara believes she is hardworking and focused enough to accomplish this goal.

About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To Increase her stock of ladies' dress materials during the peak season

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr:
Cette femme exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de bijoux et bracelets de différentes gammes. Une partie de son stock a baissé, pour la reconstituer, elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter une vingtaine de bijoux et 10 bracelets montres.
Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants, avec le revenu de son commerce elle participe aux charges de sa famille.
texts.en:
Akossiwa A. sells watches and other jewelry in a variety of styles and quality. To replenish part of her inventory, she has requested a loan from WAGES to purchase twenty pieces of jewelry and 10 bracelet watches. She is married, and the mother of three children. The income from her business helps her contribute to the support of her family.

Translated from French by Linda Koza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase jewelry and watches

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en: Sonia P. is from the village of Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 50 years old and is married. Sonia owns and operates a specialized "sari-sari" (variety) retail store, selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Sonia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000.00 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Sonia is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Myferlene

texts.en:
Myferlene B. and Jonathan B., both the same age, are happily married to each other. They are thankful to have a child named Nathan James now 4 years old. According to the happy couple, while Nathan James is still young and not yet going to school, they will start saving for his future needs. While their expenses are not that great, they will start to save. Their main source of income is from their farming business that is personally managed by Jonathan because he is a farmer. This business has been up and running for 5 years now, and they want this business to continue to grow so that they will be able to save for the future of Nathan James.

Every loan that Myferlene received through Kiva field partner Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI) after becoming a member has been used in improving this business. Her 4th loan will be used as additional capital for their farming business. Now, they plan to plant pineapples instead of rice, and they will buy all the necessary things needed for planting this, such as pineapple seedlings, fertilizer and many more, plus the expenses for the work that will be done to plant the pineapple. Myferlene is hoping that with the use of the loan, she’ll be able to make their business more productive.

Myferlene is working hard with the help of her husband so that their business will grow and the result will be they can give their child a better future. She really wants to release their family from the shadow of poverty and that is why she is striving so to succeed.

loans.use: For additional capital for their farming business

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is 55 years old. She has been engaged in fish selling in their village. Her daily net income is PHP 250. She desires a loan amounting to PHP 5,000 from KIVA lenders for additional capital for her business. She plans to purchase some fish to sell in their village to be able to gain more profit.

She is married and blessed with seven children. Some of them are already married and some are still single and have jobs. She is living with her husband at the village of Magdalena, Cabatuan, Isabela. According to her, when trials come, she endures them patiently.

loans.use: Additional capital in her fish vending business

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en: Mary Jean is a farmer. She is 42 years old and married. She has two children and her oldest is only 15. She cultivates rice on her land, which is one of the major agricultural crops in her town in Agusan del Sur. Mary Jean is a member of Community Economic Ventures, Inc. Her previous loan was used for farm financing, and she was also able to acquire 4 pigs. Now, she is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase necessary farm supplies. She is hopeful that this loan will help her farm and pig-raising business grow.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Kafotatoala Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  Kafotatoala sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 25 ans et 2 enfants. Avec leur mari et enfants elles vivent  dans des grandes familles traditionnelles et  résident dans le village de Fantombougou, sous préfecture de Fana, Région de KOULIKORO, République du Mali. 
Elles se sont connues par des liens de voisinage et de commerce. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le souci d’avoir constamment un appui financier pour leurs activités. 
Elles viennent tout juste de commencer la collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso. 
Elles comptent utiliser le prêt pour acheter, une grande quantité de condiments alimentaires et des habillements. Les produits sont achetés au marché de Fana et revendus sur place au marché et au bord du goudron à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.  
Elles estiment réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 15.500F CFA  par mois. Les bénéfices sont partagés entre la nourriture,  la santé et  les  activités.
texts.en:
The members of the Kafotatoala group are married women who average 25-years-old with 2 children. With their husband and children, they live in large traditional families in Fantombougou village, in the Fana district, Koulikoro region, of Mali. They know each other through neighbor and work connections. They collaborate with the microfincance institution Soro Yiriwaso, taking care to always have financial support for their activities. They all just began working with Soro Yiriwaso.

They count on using the loan to buy a large amount of food condiments and clothing apparel. The products are purchased at the Fana market and resold on location at the market and on the street to both male and female clients. They estimate that each will earn a monthly profit of 15,500 FCFA. The profits are shared and go toward food, health and activities.

Translated from French by Kelly Percival, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of condiments and clothing

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 38 years old. He is married and the father of seven children. All his children are currently in school.

John is a very hard-working young man whose efforts bring hope and joy to his family. He does not downplay the importance of both business and family.

He trades in fishing nets, as he lives in a coastal area. He takes delivery of stock from Accra in the greater Accra region and sells them to the fishermen in the community. He has been in business for the last five years. He is requesting a loan to buy a supply of fishing nets in bulk. He is also a taxi driver and combines the two businesses successfully. He hopes to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To buy a bulk supply of fishing nets.

loans.name: Jacinta Guisela

texts.es:
Jacinta Cedeño de 37 años, vive en una casa de ladrillos esta ubicada en Paraíso de Guayaquil, su esposo trabaja como guardia en un hotel de Guayaquil tienen 1 hijo que estudia en una escuela particular cerca de su sector.

Jacinta comenzó hace 2 años atrás vendiendo en su casa arroz y azúcar. Poco a poco empezó a tener ingresos necesarios para comprar más víveres para el negocio. Ahora Jacinta trabaja sola todos los días vendiendo víveres de todo tipo. Una de las complicaciones que tiene son las enfermedades que hay en estas épocas ya que hay mucha lluvia en su sector. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, azúcar, enlatados, dulces para tener más surtida su tienda. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa y poder ampliar más el negocio.
texts.en:
Jacinta Cedeño is 37 years old and lives in a brick house located in the District of Paraíso in Guayaquil. Her husband works as a security guard at a hotel in Guayaquil. They have one child who attends a private school near their district.

Two years ago, Jacinta started selling rice and sugar from her home. Gradually she started to generate the income needed to buy more groceries for her business. She now works every day by herself selling all types of food. Some complications that she encounters are the diseases that develop during this time of the year because the district experiences a lot of rain.

With his loan, she will buy rice sugar, canned goods, and an assortment of candies to restock her store. In the future, she hopes to finish the construction of her house and be able to expand her business even more.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie A. is a married woman who supports her family by manufacturing pots and other products made of clay. She lives in Barangay Tuburan, in Hinigaran, Negros Occidental with her husband who works as a security guard, and their 4 children who are between ages 4-15.  Three children still attend school.

Rosalie has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2002 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her business manufacturing clay products, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 11,200.

Rosalie is now requesting a PHP 15,000 loan in order to manufacture more clay products. This will be her 11th loan with NWTF-Project Dungganon. Rosalie aspires to improve her family’s living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital.

loans.name: Rosalina's Group

texts.en:
Rosalina M. is from the town of Dumalinao, Zamboanga del Sur. She is the leader of a three-member group loan offered by Kiva partner, PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.
Rosalina is 41 years old, widowed, and has five adult-aged children. To make a living, Rosalina owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Rosalina has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2007, Rosalina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,500 PHP from PMPC. Rosalina is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This loan will be her fourth from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.


About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Teofilo

texts.es:
el señor Teofilo O. tiene 55 años de edad, vive en union libre con la señora  Juana Hernandez, tienen dos hijos que dependen de ellos,  tiene una pulperia en donde vende arroz, frijoles, maiz, azucar, frescos, jugos, harina de maiz y otros productos de la canasta basica familiar.
 
este negocio lo tiene desde hace varios años, el cual esta ubicado en su casa de habitacion en la aldea El Caimito, esta solicitando el credito para compra de varios prodcutos al por mayor. el lugar en donde el vive es un poco retirado y cuesta que lleguen los carros repartidores, solo una vez por semana, esto le dificulta a el, ya que muchas veces se le termina el producto y tiene que esperar hasta que pase de nuevo el carro repartidor para poder abastecerse de mercaderia, por tal razon es que esta solicitando el credito.
texts.en:
Teofilo O., 55, lives in a common-law relationship with Juana Hernandez; they have two children that depend on them. He has a grocery store where he sells rice, beans, corn, sugar, soft-drinks, juices, cornmeal and other products that are part of the basic family shopping cart. He has had this store for several years; it is located in his home in the village of El Caimito. He is asking for funding to buy several products at wholesale. The place where he lives is a bit remote and it's difficult for delivery trucks to come by; they only do so once a week. This is a problem for him because he often runs out of a product and has to wait until the delivery truck comes by again to resupply; this is why he needs funding.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beans, rice, sugar, coffee, water, soups, toilet paper, candles, matches, milk, soap, soft-drinks, lard, cooling oil, cookies, bread.

loans.name: Heng

texts.en: Heng C. is married and resides with her husband in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia. She has five children. She stays at home as a housewife and takes care of the household chores. Her husband is a skillful fisherman, earning an income of USD 5.60 per day. The family is also assisted by her three children who are currently working at a local garment factory, earning USD 1.60 each per day to help cover the family expenses. C. is requesting a loan of 400 USD to repair her house. This is her third loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: To repair the house

loans.name: Silvia Marlene

texts.es:
El 1 de diciembre de 1999 Cuenca fue declarada  Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad e inscrita en la lista de Bienes Patrimoniales de la Humanidad  el 4 de Diciembre del mismo año,  pero más allá de esta declaratoria para los habitantes de ésta urbe  es patrimonio de su cultura,  por su situación privilegiada, por su arquitectura, sus vestigios arqueológicos y la belleza natural que encierra ésta hermosa ciudad del austro ecuatoriano. Aquí encontramos el Banco Comunal El Mirador integrado por mujeres soñadoras dispuestas hacer realidad sus sueños a base de esfuerzo y sacrificio con sus familias.

Silvia T. vive en  la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca con su  hija de doce años, su esposo viajó al exterior y para legalizarse se divorció de ella hace siete años para casarse allá pero una vez legal se olvidó de su familia, ahora ella tiene un nuevo compromiso del cual concibió una niña que se encuentra de un año cuatro meses, aún no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

Nuestra socia  trabaja como contadora en una mecánica hace  cinco años, su horario de medio tiempo  le permite por la tarde cuidar de su sobrina mientras que su hermana estudia, también se dedica a la confección y  arreglo de ropa en sus ratos libres y como le gusta los retos éste año se ha propuesto seguir belleza en una academia de la localidad. Su pareja trabaja en el arte de la joyería

Silvia se  encuentra en su cuarto ciclo en el banco comunal  y con su primer crédito compró una máquina de coser,  con los otros  créditos recibidos invirtió en la salud de sus hijas que durante un tiempo pasaron las dos internadas en una clínica del sector. Ahora con el préstamo obtenido va a adquirir  una maquina recubrid ora para así ir ampliando su pequeño taller de costura, tiene como meta llegar a tener un gran taller de costura.
texts.en:
On December 1, 1999 Cuenca was declared a UNESCO World Cultural Heritage site, and it was officially registered on Dec. 4th of the same year. But beyond this declaration, for the inhabitants of this city, is the heritage of its culture, its privileged location, its architecture, its archaeological remains and natural beauty that surround this beautiful city of the Ecuadorian highlands. Here we find the communal bank "El Mirador" which is comprised of women dreamers who are ready to make their dreams a reality, based on their efforts and sacrifices with their families. Silvia T. lives in the city of Cuenca with her 12 year-old daughter. Her husband traveled outside the country and, in order to become a legal immigrant, divorced from Silvia 7 years ago so that he could marry there. But once legal, he forgot his family. Now she has a new relationship in which she conceived a daughter, who is now 1 year and 7 months old. They do not have a house so they live in a rented home. Silvia has worked as an accountant at a mechanic's shop for 5 years. Her part time schedule allows for her to care for her niece in the afternoons while her sister studies. In addition, she makes and mends clothing in her free time. As she enjoys a challenge, this year she intends to enroll in a beauty class at a school in her area. Her partner works in the art of jewelry. Silvia is in her 4th loan cycle with the communal bank. With her first loan she bought a sewing machine. With the other loans she received she invested in the health of her daughters who, during a period of time, were admitted to a clinic in her area. Now with this loan she will acquire an industrial sewing machine to expand her small dressmaking workshop. Her goal is to eventually have a large sewing workshop.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to acquire an industrial sewing machine for her business making and mending clothes

loans.name: Janchiv

texts.en:
Janchiv L. is 27, married and has a 2-year-old child. He and his family live together in a 'ger', the Mongolian nomadic tent. They live in Arhangai, one of Mongolia's central provinces. 

Janchiv operates a carpentry business with his wife. They have been operating their business since 2007, and have steadily expanded. In 2007, he started his business, with an initial investment of 200,000 tugrugs (~  140 USD). As a result of three years' hard work, his working capital has increased to 2,000,000 tugrug (~ 1430 USD). With his earnings, he has been able to purchase his own plot of land with a house and yard for his family. 

Janchiv purchases his raw materials in Tsenher soum (a local administrative unit ). Janchiv is an enthusiastic person who has a great business mind and excellent communication skills. He says, “I would like to create my own workshop and hire a few employees for my business in the future.” He is requesting a 2,500,000 tugrug (~  1785 USD) loan to support his business.

loans.use: To increase his working capital

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is married with five children, all in school. Sarah takes care of additional family members. She owns a three-room house where the family stays and they do have access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include food and school fees. Sarah owns a retail shop in Ntinda Kalinabiri Zone and doesn’t pay rent for her business because she works from her home. She wants to use this loan to add more stock to her shop by buying more bags of rice, beans, boxes of soap, sugar, toothpaste, cooking oil and trays of eggs. Sarah has been in this business for 10 years. Besides this business, she also gets income from rental houses. She works seven days a week and is faced with the challenges of thieves who always break into her house and steal all the merchandise and of transporting her merchandise from Kikuubo in Kampala city to her shop in Ntinda Kalinabiri Zone.  She hopes to expand her business to a wholesale shop. Sarah joined MCDT because of the low interest charged.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise to sell

loans.name: Vevencia

texts.en:
Vevencia R., 62 years old, is from the village of Salvacion, Kadingilan Bukidnon. She is married and has 5 adult children. To make a living Vevencia sells vegetables in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

Vevencia joined HSPFI in 2009 to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from HSPFI which she used as additional working capital.

Vevencia is requesting her third loan, for 10000 PHP, which she will use to purchase more vegetables to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue to supplement her family’s income.

About HSPFI

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note

To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Bou

texts.en:
Bou S., 60, is widowed and resides with her three children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for its palm products. She appears in the photograph with her son. One of her children is a garment factory worker, earning an income of about USD 2 per day.

S. is a farmer who grows rice for an income of USD 1 per day. She is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase fertilizer and rice seed to expand her agriculture business.

In the future, S. would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed

loans.name: Talapsu Group

texts.en:
Marie C. is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. She was born in Puntu, a village in northern Sierra Leone and she is 35 years of age. She is married to a teacher and they have five children. Three of her children are attending primary school and two are in secondary school.

For ten years now, Marie has been selling fish, baking flour, and firewood. With the help of this loan, members of this group will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. Marie will use her share of the loan (SLL 800,000) to expand her business. She will buy more fish, baking flour and firewood wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.use: To buy more fish, baking flour and firewood wholesale to add to her current stock

loans.name: Charlyn

texts.en:
Charlyn M. is from the village of Thailand, Banisilan, South Cotabato. She is 41 years old. Charlyn is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Charlyn owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Charlyn has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 7500 PHP a month for these activities. She chose to lower down the amount of her loan from PHP 13,000 to PHP 5,000 because she finds it easier to pay back.

In 2008, Charlyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Charlyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Charlyn is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Charlyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & for working capital for her store

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is married with three children; two attend school while one is too young for school. Her husband is a businessman and he contributes to his family's basic needs. She rents a house with electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expense is school fees.

Janet has been operating her business selling cereals for over twenty years. She has a shop where she sells to restaurant operators, neighbors and passersby. Her previous occupation was tailoring. With this 20,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase five sacks of maize, beans and rice. Janet's major challenges are theft because of insecurity in the area and high transport costs. She decided to work with Yehu because of the simple procedure to join.

loans.use: To purchase five sacks of maize, beans and rice

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose J. is currently in the business of selling charcoal at home, and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell. Rose is 52 years old and is widowed. She has 7 children and her children do not go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a family house for her children.

loans.use: To stock more bags of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Romelyn

texts.en:
Romelyn J. is from the city of Dipolog. She is 30 years old. Romelyn is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Romelyn owns and operates a furniture making business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from making and selling general household furniture to local businesses and community members. Romelyn has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately PHP10,000 gross a month for these activities.

In 2008, Romelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Romelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of PHP8,000 from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional raw materials to expand product offerings. Romelyn is requesting a new loan of PHP13,000, which will be used to purchase additional raw materials to expand product offerings. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Romelyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional raw materials to expand product offerings.

loans.name: Calidez Group

texts.es:
El grupo Calidez está con formado por tres mujeres trabajadoras y esforzadas  una de ellas es Olga S. de 60 años quien desde el 2002 tiene una pequeña venta  la cual ha invertido y desea que crezca.

Las otras integrantes del grupo son Alicia L. Sandobal quien vende nacatamales y Magali Nohemí G. comercializa leña desde hace cuatro años.
texts.en:
The Calidez ["Warmth"] Group is made up of three hard-working and spirited women. One of them is 60 year-old Olga S., who has had a small store since 2002. She has invested in it and hopes that it will grow. The other members of the group are Alicia L. Sandobal, who sells nacatamales [steamed corn cakes wrapped in banana leaves] and Magaly Nohemí G., who has sold firewood for four years.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy basic grains, meat, dairy products, etc.

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es: La  Sra. María Elena E.  ella tiene una pequeña pulpería, ella tiene ocho  años de dedicarse a esta actividad. Ha tenido  doce créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno  los ha realizado para la compra de mercadería para su negocio y así ampliarlo en mercadería,  los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esa manera ella ha  mejorado su negocio y su   condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. María Elena E. has had a small grocery store for the last 8 years.  

She has had 12 CEPRODEL loans which have all been used to buy merchandise for her store thus expanding her stock.

Ceprodel loans have been very beneficial because she has been able to improve her business and hers and her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To buy basic grains, rice, beans, sweets.

loans.name: Ulziijargal

texts.en: Ulziijargal D. is 44 years old and lives with her husband and one daughter in a ger (traditional Mongolian housing tent) in the Huvsgul province of Mongolia. Her daughter attends university while she operates a business making concrete blocks with the help of her husband. They have been in this business since 1996 and have gained many years of experience. The demand for this product is usually high during the spring and autumn seasons. Ulziijargal says, "All the blocks I produce are made by hand, so I am planning to buy a mechanical block-making machine in order to increase my productivity." She is requesting a 600,000 tugrik loan to produce more blocks.

loans.use: To produce more blocks

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en: Pamela is a widow with six children, three boys and three girls, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and rent. For over ten years, Pamela has operated a food vendor business selling deep-fried chicken, fish and potatoes and also runs a tailoring business. She works in a shop, from door to door, and from home. Her customers are school children and neighbors. In the future, Pamela hopes to establish a butcher shop and become a supplier of chicken and fish. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her living standard. With the Kshs 60,000 she wants to purchase one sack of potatoes, cooking oil, 10kgs of peas, one bundle of wheat flour and a freezer.

loans.use: To purchase potatoes, cooking oil, peas, and wheat flour plus a freezer.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret M., aged 26, is a business lady who runs a hardware business along Outering road. She sells items like tanks, cement, timber, sand and many other items in her hardware store. She is married to Harrison, who runs another hardware shop at Kariobangi estate and together they have two children, John and Ann, who are both in primary school.  Her business has been in operation for the last year and she gets a monthly income of Kshs 20,000 per month.
