Margaret was introduced to KADET by the credit officer in charge of Eastlands branch. This loan will be her second loan from KADET Ltd and with the loan, plus her additional income, she will increase the stock of timber, cement and other building materials in her hardware shop. If the loan boosts the business and generates more income, she will develop her piece of land by building rental houses, which will guarantee her more security financially for the future.

loans.use: To increase stock of timber, cement and other building materials in her hardware shop.

loans.name: Crisa

texts.en:
Crisa O. is from the village of Liong, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 44 years old. Crisa is married and has 3 school-age children. To make a living, Crisa owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, biscuits, breads,toothpaste & junk foods in the local community. Crisa has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Crisa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Crisa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to buy and sell. Crisa is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Crisa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Hanifahon's Group

texts.en:
Hanifahon A. has a large family.  She is 44 years old.  Together with her husband, they are raising six children. The older children help the parents run their family business, the younger children are school pupils.  

The most widespread business in Kyrgyz villages is farming and cattle breeding.  For 20 years, the family has been getting profits from cultivating agricultural production and reselling cattle. Currently Hanifahon keeps a cow with a calf to be fattened and resold.  Their earnings have made possible to give their children a proper education, and also to make house repairs. 

In order to increase the total number of animals, the family wants to purchase 3 sheep. For this purpose they need to get a loan.  In the future, they aim to arrange their children’s weddings.

	--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase 3 sheep

loans.name: Consolata

texts.en: Consolata M. is a single lady with two children aged five and two. Her business is located at the Nairobi Central Business District where she sells clothes to the local people. She has been doing this for six years. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is that fashion is seasonal and some designs go out of style before she has sold them. Then she takes losses or her capital becomes locked up due to slow stock movement. However she works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of Kes 50,000 to buy more clothes to boost her business during this festive season. She hopes to grow her business and open more stalls in Nairobi since the target market is huge. She also hopes to gain financial stability and give her children a good education to the university level. She describes herself as generous, kind and lovable.

loans.use: Buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Greyse Zulema

texts.es:
Greyse de 48 años, vende comida rápida, almuerzos y meriendas en un local pequeño para poder general suficientes ingresos y ayudar con  los gastos familiares a su esposo. 

Trabaja desde muy temprano comprando la comida desde las 05h30am hasta que cocina la comida y la vende en almuerzos y meriendas. Su esposo es chofer en una camioneta y tiene una niña de 17 años que está estudiando pero actualmente se le ha complicado la salud teniendo una arteria del corazón desarrollada y le hace daño corre y hacer deporte. 

El préstamo lo quiere dirigir a las recetas médicas de su hija y el tratamiento para que se le deshinche la arteria. En el futuro quiere que su hija se recupere y que tenga una vida profesional exitosa.
texts.en:
Greyse is 48 years old.  She sells fast food, lunches and afternoon snacks from her small premises to make sufficient income to help her husband with their family's expenses.  She works from very early in the morning, buying food from 5.30am.  She then cooks the food and sells it in her lunches and afternoon snacks.  Her husband is a truck driver and she has a 17 year-old daughter who is studying but who currently has health complications as she has a problem with a coronary artery and she suffers when she runs and takes part in sports.

Greyse would like to use her loan to cover her daughter's medical prescriptions and the treatment that she needs to deflate the artery.  In the future, she would like her daughter to get well again and for her to enjoy a successful professional life.

loans.use: Medical prescriptions

loans.name: Roger Alberto

texts.es: El señor Roger R. es obrero trabaja en la Alcaldía de Managua como operario de limpieza de la comunidad, tiene dos hijos en edad escolar, solicita este financiamiento para compra de útiles escolares y pago de matrícula de sus hijos
texts.en: Roger R. works for the City of Managua as a cleaning operative.  He has two school-age children.  Roger is requesting this loan so that he can buy school supplies for his children and pay their school fees.

loans.use: To pay school fees

loans.name: Chhay

texts.en:
Chhay Y. is a 56-year-old farmer and single mother who lives in Kompong Cham province. She was blessed with six children, three of whom are single and the other three are married.  

One of Chhay Y.'s sons is a leader in the construction business. He has a few physical laborers to help him provide his service. He has received a lot of orders from his clients to construct their houses.  However, he lacked the construction materials needed to support his business. Therefore, Chhay Y. will use her loan for her son to purchase the necessary construction equipment so he can run his business smoothly.

loans.use: To purchase construction equipment for her son's business

loans.name: Huseyn

texts.ru: Хусайнов Хусейн проживает в районе Фархор. Возраст, 42 года. Женат. Имеет троих детей. Живет вместе с родителями. Жена, домохозяйка. Отец с братом находятся на заработках в России. Сам Хусейн имеет средне - специальное образование, строитель. Он более 15 лет занимается строительством. На сегодняшний день он намерен приобрести новые инструменты для своей деятельности. И поэтому он берет кредит для приобретения новых инструментов.
texts.en: Huseyn H. lives in the Farkhor district.  He is 42 years old, married and has three children.  He lives with his parents.  His wife is a homemaker.  His father and brother are both working in Russia.  Huseyn has a secondary-specialized education, as a construction worker.  He has been involved in construction work for over 15 years.  Currently, he intends to purchase new tools for his business.  This is why he is requesting this loan.

loans.use: Purchase of new tools

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is married with 4 children, living in Hioma, Uganda, with a dream of educating his children up to University. For three years he has been operating a shop, and this has enabled him to pay school fees for his children. He has a challenge of price fluctuation, and his desire is owning a wholesale shop. Patrick needs the loan to buy rice, sugar and maize flour for selling.

loans.use: Buying rice, sugar and maize flour for selling.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth joined Grameen America with a dream of opening her own hair salon.  To date, she has received four loans totaling $12,800 to invest in her beautician work, where she rents a chair in a hair salon.  One year ago Elizabeth and her husband separated and she was left with four children to proviD. for.  As her daily expenses increased she maD. the difficult decision to send her four year old son to be cared for by his grandparents in the Dominican Republic while she worked long hours to get back on her feet.  Today Elizabeth is once again reunited with her son and is focusing on achieving her dream. Through Grameen America's savings program Elizabeth has already accrued over $3,500 in her savings account and continues to save until the day that she opens her salon.  This loan will help Elizabeth to purchase additional supplies and continue to grow her customer base.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for her beauty salon

loans.name: Dachi Ami Holassé

texts.fr: Madame Holassé est revendeuse  de pagnes, elle à 30ans. Elle s’approvisionne au Grand Marché de Lomé et revend de façon ambulante. Son activité à commencé en 2001 et elle sollicite ce troisième prêt pour acheter  des pagnes afin de se prendre en charge  et d’accroitre son activité.
texts.en: Mrs. Holassé is a reseller of traditional colorful “pagnes” fabrics. She is 30 years old. She stocks up at the big market of Lomé and resells as a street vendor. Her business was launched in 2001, and now she is seeking a third loan in order to stock up on “pagnes” fabrics in order to be able to grow her activities and support herself.

loans.use: to purchase traditional "pagnes" fabrics

loans.name: Felicia

texts.es: Felicia, D. 55 años es una mujer sencilla y luchadora. Se separó desD. hace 15 años con su esposo; quedando sola al cuidado D. sus 8 hijos, a los que sacó adelante. Ahora vive con su hija Isabel, D. 15 años. En su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío D. Villa Visca. DesD. que su esposo la dejó; aprendió a valerse por si misma. Por ello comenzó a trabajar en la agricultura, poniendo en práctica las enseñanzas que sus padres le dieron. Sus principales sembríos constan D. arveja, papa, maíz, los cuales cuida con mucho esmero. “Es mi única distracción, no tengo televisión ni energía eléctrica”, afirma. Asimismo señala que se dedica al lavado D. ropa, donD. le pagan D. acuerdo a la cantidad D. ropa lavada. “Lavando ropa saque adelante a mis hijos”, menciona con orgullo. Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es poder ver crecer sus cultivos, ya que es símbolo D. una buena negociación con los proveedores del mercado mayorista D. la ciudad D. Tarma, donD. comercializa sus cosechas. Ahora se está preparando para la cosecha D. arveja, que muy pronto dará fruto. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Villa Visca”, y este es el décimo crédito con MFP, donD. le enseñaron a salir adelante para el desarrollo D. su familia. Felicia, invertirá el crédito solicitado en la compra D. varios sacos D. abono orgánico; que le servirán para la siembra D. papa que comenzará dentro D. estos meses, con el apoyo D. una socia que brindará terreno y semilla.
texts.en:
Felicia, 55, is an unassuming, hard working woman.  She’s been separated from her husband for the last 15 years and caring for her 8 children by herself; she’s raised them all.  She now lives with her daughter, Isabel, 15, in her own house located in the hamlet of Villa Visca.  

Since her husband left her she learned how to get ahead on her own.  She started our working in farming putting into practice the skills her parents taught her.  Her main crops are peas, potatoes and corn which she cares for very diligently.  “It’s my only distraction; I don’t own a television set or even have electricity,” she affirms.  She also states that she’s been taking in laundry where she’s paid according to the amount of clothes washed.  “I supported my children washing clothes,” she mentions proudly.  What she likes best about her work is being able to see her crops grow because that’s a symbol of the good negotiations with wholesalers in Tarma’s market where she sells her crops.  She is currently getting ready for the pea harvest which will soon bear fruit.

She is a member of the “Villa Visca” communal bank and this is the tenth loan with MFP where she learned to get ahead for her family’s development.  Felicia will use the requested loan to buy several sacks of organic manure that will be used for the potato planting that will start within these months with support from another member who will proviD. the land and the seeds.

loans.use: to buy sacks of organic manure.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es: Virginia tiene su negocio que es la venta de zapatos. Tiene más  de 4 años trabajando en esta actividad, la ubicación es en su vivienda en donde asisten una buena cantidad de clientes. Por lo que tiene que trabajar todos los días ya que la mayoría de sus clientes siempre le solicitan variedad en los diferentes zapatos que ofrece. Inicio este medio de vida porque no tenía los ingresos necesarios para su hogar. Es por eso que solicita este crédito para la compra de zapatos deportivos, zapatillas, botas, pantuflas, sandalias, calzado para niño entre otros.
texts.en:
Virginia sells shoes.  She’s been in the business for over 4 years.  Her sales take place at home where a good number of customers come by. Because of this, she has to work every day since most of her customers always request a variety of different shoes from her.  

She started this way of life because she did not have sufficient income to meet household expenses.  

She is, therefore, asking for this loan to buy athletic shoes, slippers, boots, sandals, loafers and children’s shoes, among others.

loans.use: to buy athletic shoes, sandals, boots, slippers, loafers and children's shoes, among others.

loans.name: Jagathmaya

texts.en:
Jagathmaya is 50 years old and married, with three children who are 15, 17 and 19 years old.  In 2000, she established her mushroom farming business.  She supports her family by working seven days a week and four hours a day.  

She has already received and successfully repaid two loans from Kiva partner Patan BPW.  She will use the current loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for her agricultural business.  In the future, Jagathmaya plans to improve her family's economic condition.  She thanks you for your support. 

About Nepali Agriculture:

Over 70% of Nepal's economy is based on agriculture.  Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land.  Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet.  With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer.  With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market.  Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.

loans.use: to buys seeds and fertilizer for her mushroom farming business.

loans.name: Alejandra Josefina

texts.es: Alejandra Josefina su actividad es la venta de cosméticos. Hace más de 3 años que tiene este medio de vida. Siempre ha sido una persona muy responsable y que disfruta de comunicarse con sus clientes, la mayoría de sus clientes le solicitan una gran variedad de productos y ella siempre está dispuesta a brindar el mejor servicio a sus clientes por lo que es una mujer dedicada y abnegada. El crédito que solicita es para la compra de lápiz labial, polvos, pintura de uñas, brillos, tratamientos entre otros.
texts.en: Alejandra Josefina sells cosmetics.  She’s earned her livelihood this way for over three years.  She’s always been a very responsible person who enjoys communicating with her customers.  Most of her customers request a wide variety of items and she is always willing to provide the best customer service so she is a very dedicated and selfless woman.  The loan she’s requesting is to buy lipstick, powder, nail polish, blush and treatments, among others.

loans.use: to buy beauty supplies and cosmetics.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 35 and married. She has two children, a 7-year-old and a 5-month-old. She has been in mixed farming for the last six years, producing peas, wheat, and potatoes, which she sells to the middlemen in the local market. She engages the services of two farmhands. She earns additional income from retailing kerosene in the local market.

Janet has requested a loan worth 60,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to enable her venture into poultry farming. She says the loan will help her buy poultry birds. This is Janet’s fourth loan request with Juhudi Kilimo. She hopes the business will improve her family's living standards.

Janet points to her lack of sufficient funds, and rainfall, as the greatest impediments to her farming business.

loans.use: to purchase poultry birds

loans.name: Lea Mercedes

texts.es: Lea, de 41 años de edad, es originaria de la comunidad el Jicarito localizada en león, esta casada, ella es agricultura se dedica a la siembra de maíz y también a la crianza de ganado. Desde pequeña sus padres le enseñaron a trabajar en la agricultura, su primer negocio fue a los 22 años  de edad , sembró su primeros cultivos con la ayuda de su esposo y hermano de esta actividad ha venido sobreviviendo,despues se dedico a criar ganado para vender  . Solicito el préstamo para comprar de terneros. Pues la venta y compra de ganado tiene mucha demanda y genera buenos ingresos que le permitirá comprar más tierra para cultivar y tener una buena crianza de ganado de raza. En sus planes esta dedicarse a la compra y venta de ganado en desarrollo.
texts.en: Lea is 41 years old and from the community of Jicarito in León.  She is married and works in agriculture farming corn and raising cattle.  Since she was young, her parents taught her to work in agriculture and she had her first business when she was 22 years old.  She planted her first crops with the help of her husband and brother and has been living by these means ever since.  Later on she decided to raise cattle to sell.  She is asking for a loan to buy calves as there is a lot of demand in this business and it generates good money that will allow her to buy more land to farm and help with raising the cattle.  She plans to continue buying, raising, and reselling cattle.

loans.use: buy calves

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud, 31, is a single man who has been working in furniture making for fifteen years. He started his own business in 2003.

Mahmoud is a man with a good reputation and he is recommended by most of his clients because of the quality of work he does. To improve his quality of work more, Mahmoud requested a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to buy necessary tools for his business, in addition to renewing his working permit since he's a foreigner.

Mahmoud works hard on improving his image in his domain and hopes to further expand his work in the future.

loans.use: to buy necessary tools for his business.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a 43-year-old Rwandan entrepreneur with five children between the ages of 16 and 18, some of whom are adopted.  Her husband earns money selling various goods.

For the past five years, she has owned a general store in which she sells toothpaste, shirts, and other goods.  This business has enabled her to meet the needs of her family.  

She will use this loan to purchase more goods such as rice and cooking oil that she will sell in her general store for profit.  

With the future profits generated from her business, she plans to feed her children and accumulate savings for the future.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, salt, sugar etc. to sell

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.ru:
Светлане 60 лет, она родилась в городе Капан. После окончания средней школы, она поступила в Капанское музыкальное училище. 
Светлана вдова, у нее трое детей: сын и две дочери. Все дети имеют свои семьи и живут отдельно от матери. 
Предпринимательской деятельностью Светлана занимается  с 1996г. Она торгует одеждой, бельем и обувью в арендованном помещение Капанской городской ярмарки. Товары Светлана приобретает в Ереване раз в месяц. Светлана работает без выходных, а недавно она начала торговать цветами, которые она ежедневно приобретает у оптовиков. Благодаря помощи младшей дочери на ярмарке, Светлана успевает заниматься и продажей одежды, и продажей цветов. Цветочный бизнес приносит ей дополнительный доход и она по мере своих возможностей помогает семьям своих дочерей.   
	Кредит на сумму 400.000 драм необходим Светлане для приобретения осенней одежды и обуви в преддверии начала нового учебного года, а также для расширения цветочного бизнеса. 
Данный кредит является 7-ым по счету и Светлана всегда выплачивает кредит без просрочек.
texts.en: Svetlana is 60 years old, she was born in the city of Kapan. After finishing high school she was accepted to Kapan's musical academy. Svetlana is a widow and has three children: a son and two daughters. All of her children have their own families and live separately from their mother. Since 1996 Svetlana has been working in retail. She sells clothes, lingerie and shoes at a rented stall at the Kapan City Market. She purchases her inventory every month in Erevan and she works without weekends. Recently Svetlana also started to sell fresh flowers which she purchases every morning from whole-sellers. With the help of her youngest daughter Svetlana can manage both the clothing and the flower sale businesses. Flower sales bring them additional profit and allow Svetlana to financially help out her daughters' families. Svetalana is asking for a loan of 400,000 dram to purchase fall season clothing and shoes before the start of the new school year and to expand her flower business. This is Svetlana's 7th loan and she has always paid back her loans on time.

loans.use: To buy autumn season clothes to resell and also to develop her flower trading business

loans.name: Sherlita

texts.en:
Sherlita is a 55-year-old married woman with 5 children. The oldest child is 37 and the youngest is 19.

Sherlita has only been in the business of raising hogs for a year. She was helping her husband till their land and grow rice crops before she started raising hogs. She plans to use her loan to purchase pig feeds and vitamins. Each month, she earns about 4,000 PHP by operating the hog-raising business.

In the future, Sherlita hopes to have a better living situation.

loans.use: to purchase pig feeds and vitamins.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: Maribel tiene 29 años, vive con su pequeño hijo en casa de sus padres. Se dedica a la venta de sus cosechas y demás productos alimenticios que adquiere al por mayor. Ella aprendió de sus padres todo lo relacionado a la agrícultora, desde entonces no deja de cultivar papa, maíz, habas, arveja entre otros productos alimenticios, que tienen mucha demanda en el mercado. mayormente sus productos son vendidos los días viernes en una feria comercial que se encuentra en una localidad un poco lejana a la suya; pues ahí mayor afluencia de gente. Ella esta contenta por que sabe que su negocio esta mejorando poco a poco, por ello requiere de un aumento de capital de trabajo para su siguiente inversión. Es su primer crédito que tiene con MFP, se entero de la financiera por medio de sus amistades que la invitaron a formar parte de este grupo solidario, agradece la oportunidad de crecimiento y confianza hacia su persona y se compromete a ser puntual en sus pagos. El dinero estará destinado en la compra de más mercadería y también sacos de abono para sembrar en sus terrenos.
texts.en:
Maribel is 29 years old and lives with her young son in her parents' house. She works selling her own produce as well as other foodstuff she buys in bulk. She learned everything she knows about farming from her parents and since then has always grown potatoes, corn, beans, peas and other foodstuff which is in high demand at the market. She usually sells her products on Fridays at a trade fair which is located a little far from where she lives, as there is a greater influx of  people there. She is happy because she knows that her business is improving little by little; it requires an increase in working capital for her next investment. This is her first loan with MFP. She learned of the microfinance institution from friends who invited her to join this solidarity group. She is grateful for the opportunity to grow and the trust shown her and she agrees to be punctual with her repayments. The money will be used to buy more merchandise and sacks of manure for her farmland.

.

loans.use: to buy food products in bulk as well as sacks of manure.

loans.name: Lorenda

texts.en:
Lorenda is 53 years old and married with seven children. She lives in the Philippines. For the past 10 years, Lorenda has run a retail shop where she sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She is a new HSPFI member.

Lorenda is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
Gregoria de 35 años de edad, vive con su familia en casa de sus padres, cuenta con los servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona urbana del distrito de San Pedro de Lloc que pertenece al departamento de La Libertad.  Esta zona es agrícola y ganadera.

Gregoria se dedica a la preparación y venta de humitas (productos que se realiza a base de maiz fresco), su producto lo prepara en su domicilio, desde hace 8 años,  cuenta con su propia clientela y tambien realiza pedidos y con los ingresos que obtenga podra cubrir sus necesidades familiares.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa  de 1000 nuevos soles para la compra de insumos, con el fin de seguir elaborando sus humitas,  para ofrecerle a sus clientes y así obtiene ganancia para tener una mejor calidad de vida.  Gregoria es una mujer de empuje, trabajo y dedicación que loúnico que desea es que sus hijos sean cada vez mejores para salir adelante en la vida.
texts.en:
Gregoria is thirty-five years old and lives with her family in her parents’ house, which has basic services and is located in the urban district of San Pedro de Lloc in the Department of La Libertad. This is an agricultural and ranching region.

Gregoria prepares and sells humitas (products made from fresh corn). She has been preparing her product in her home for the past eight years, has her own customer base, and also fills special orders. With the revenue she earns, she is able to cover her family’s necessities.

She has requested a loan of 1000 PEN [$375] from Edpyme Alternativa to purchase ingredients to continue preparing humitas, and to be able to offer them to her customers. In this way, she will earn profits and have a better quality of life. Gregoria is a driven, hard-working, and dedicated woman, and all she desires is that her children continue to benefit from her efforts and get ahead in life.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients, such as fresh corn, to continue preparing humitas.

location.town: San Pedro de Lloc - Pacasmayo - La Libertad

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: El cliente  Mario, tiene 44 años y esta casado con la señora, Valentina, no tienen hijos dependientes, son de familia humilde y trabajadora.  El cliente se dedica al servicio de construcción, que trabaja en todos lados para sustentar a su familia, y de igual manera la  esposa se dedica al servicio de comercio de frutas, que vende en el mercado principal de la ciudad de Cochabamba (la pampa), el destino del crédito es para la construcción de su vivienda, el cliente vive en la localidad denominada Pucarita Chica, de la ciudad de Cochabamba, es por lo cual reflejamos una pequeña historia del cliente para el conocimiento de todos ustedes.
texts.en: Mario is 44 years old and married to Valentina.  They do not have any dependent children, and are a humble and hard-working family.  He works in construction all around the area in order to support his family.  His wife works selling fruit in the main market of Cochabamba.  He will use this loan to build his home.  He lives in the Pucarita Chica zone in the city of Cochabamba.  We shared a bit of his story with you all so you could get to know him.

loans.use: with the construction of his house

loans.name: Showers Of Blessings Group

texts.en:
Janet is 40 years old and lives in Masvingo. She is widowed and has three children aged 16, 21 and 23, all of whom attend school.  She has been a cross-border trader for the past 5 years. She goes to South Africa to buy electrical gadgets and clothes for sale.  The challenge she faces is high competition.  She makes additional income from house rentals.

Janet has requested a loan of US $4OO to buy more stock for her business. With the additional income generated by the loan, she will pay the school fees for her three children.  It is Janet's aspiration to be a wholesaler with a network of branches countrywide.

loans.use: To buy electrical gadgets and clothes for sale

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel, está nuevamente solicitando un préstamo para la compra de gaseosas, plátanos, boquitas, maíz, esta inversión le desea hacer para tener material y así vender en la feria de su pueblo, ya que es oportunidad para vender, por esta razón quiere estar preparada con mercadería.
Ella nos comenta que su negocio y los ingresos han mejorado favorablemente, ya que estos microcréditos son un gran apoyo.
texts.en:
Maribel is asking for a new loan to buy beverages, plantains, boquitas (ready made snacks), and corn. This loan will be used to buy materials and sell her items in the town fair that is her opportunity to sell her products and she wants to be prepared.

Maribel tells us that her business and income have improved favorably since these microloans are a great support for her enterprise.

loans.use: buy beverages, plantains, snacks and corn.

loans.name: Ramiro

texts.es:
Ramiro es un hombre  muy trabajador, desde hace 2 años se dedica al transporte urbano como chofer de taxi, llevando a sus clientes a su destino por un bajo costo. Para tener mejores ganancias el trabaja día y noche de esta manera para poder cubrir su gastos como la canasta básica y de su casa.
Es padre de dos pequeños por quienes sale adelante para ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida. El préstamo que solicita es para comprar partes de refacciones para darle mantenimiento a la unidad y así ofrecer un mejor servicio.
texts.en: Ramiro is a very hardworking man. For two years he has worked in urban transportation as a taxi driver, taking his customers to their destinations for a low cost. To have better earnings, he works this way day and night so that he can cover his expenses such as the basic needs of his household. He is the father of two little ones to whom he manages to offer a better quality of life. The loan that he is applying for will be used to buy parts to maintain his taxi and thus offer better service.

loans.use: to repair his taxi

loans.name: Budihidihi Sk No 2 Group

texts.fr:
Delphine fait partie du groupe Budihidihi. Elle a 30 ans et elle est mariée avec 2 enfants de 4 à 7 ans, dont 2 scolarisés, elle a 1 personne en charge autre que ses enfants. 

Delphine est cultivatrice de riz. C’est son deuxième  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Elle va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques pour son agriculture de riz. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de suivre tous les conseils donnés par les agronomes. Dans les prochaines années, Delphine voudrait être la grande cultivatrice de riz dans sa région. Avec les profits, elle prévoit d’éduquer ses enfants.
texts.en:
Delphine is part of the Budihidihi group. She is 20 and married with two children, who are 4 and 7 years old. Both go to school. She also takes care of one other person in addition to her children.

Delphine is a rice farmer. This is her second loan cycle with ACB. She will use her loan to buy chemical fertilizers for her rice farm. 

Her strategy for growing her business is to follow all the advice given to her by the agronomists. In the coming years, Delphine would like to be the biggest rice-grower in her region. With the profits from her buisness, she would like to educate her children.

loans.use: Elle va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques pour son agriculture de riz.

loans.name: Francisca Del Carmen

texts.es:
Francisca, quiere seguir invirtiendo en las actividades económicas que realiza para el beneficio de su familia, por eso nuevamente solicita un préstamo para comprar leche, verduras, frutas e insumos agrícolas para una nueva siembra de maíz, ya que su alternativa en los momentos de necesidades son los prestamos dándole la liquidez necesaria para salir adelante.
Ella ha tenido un efecto positivo en las inversiones anteriores hasta el momento han logrado terminar la construcción de la vivienda, ofreciéndole mejores condiciones a su familia.
texts.en:
Francisca wants to continue investing in the economic activities she carries out for her family’s benefit. Consequently she is again requesting a loan to buy milk, vegetables, fruit and farming supplies for a new planting of corn, since her only option in these moments of need is to take out loans, giving her the necessary liquidity to move ahead.

She has had positive results from earlier investments. As of the present, she has successfully finished constructing her house which provides her family with better living conditions.

loans.use:
.
to buy milk, vegetables, fruit and farming supplies.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda, tiene 30 años de edad, casada desde hace 13 años, tiene 2 hijos de 13 y 11 años de edad quienes están estudiando, vive en el Dorado, Santa Barbara.
Yolanda tiene 14 años de dedicarse a cultivar sus parcelas de café, la zona donde vive es productora de café y desde niña tiene la experiencia.
Sus cultivos han mejorado, pues ella ha solicitado cuatro préstamos a ODEF, para darle un buen mantenimiento y sacar buenas cosechas, más ahora que es un negocio rentable, con este préstamo actual va invertir en la siembra de vivero de café y en compra de fertilizantes. Lo vende en pergamino húmedo en el mercado local de la zona. Todo su esfuerzo a sido para sacar adelante a su familia y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 30 years old, married for 13 years and has two children who are 13 and 11 years old attending school; she lives in El Dorado, Santa Bárbara.  Yolanda has been farming coffee for 14 years.  The zone she lives in is coffee-producing and she’s had this experience since childhood.

Her crops have improved for she has requested four ODEF loans to provide them with care and produce good harvests more so now that it’s a profitable business.

She will use this current loan to invest in her coffee nursery buying fertilizer.  She sells it in damp parchment in the local market.  All of her effort is to move her family forward and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Khaticha

texts.ru: Хатича замужем и любящая мать пятерых детей. Более 17 лет она занимается купле- продажей детской одежды. Она трудолюбивая женщина и усердно работает ради улучшения благосостояния семьи. Она хочет устроить своих детей в хорошие университеты, чтобы видить их  образованными и воспитанными людьми. С этой целью Хатича расширяет свой бизнес, чтобы получить максимум дохода. Она запрашивает займ в размере 2000 Сомони для покупки новых товаров для пополнения оборотного капитала. Она надеется на вашу помощь и заранее благодарна вам за вашу щедрость и милосердие.
texts.en: Khaticha is married and is a loving mother of five children.  She has been involved in buying and selling children's clothing for over 17 years.  She is a hardworking woman, who works diligently to improve her family's welfare.  She wants to place her children into good universities, in order to see them as educated and well-mannered people.  With this goal in mind, Khaticha expands her business in order to maximize her income.  She is requesting a loan in the sum of 2,000 Somoni to purchase new merchandise in order to increase her working capital.  She relies on your help and thanks you in advance for your generosity and mercy.

loans.use: to purchase new merchandise

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth is 30 years old and lives in San Vicente Alto,Oroquieta City.  She is married with three children.
 
Janeth has a business that buys and sells clothing and earns approximately PHP 1,000 each month doing this type of work. She has  requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase more clothes to sell.   Janeth has been a member of PMPC for a month.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
La Sra. Patricia tiene un hijo que se va ha graduarse y quiere que su hijo lo disfrute y para ello necesita cubrir  los gastos como fotografías, vestuario,  pago de la entrega de papelería y con esto se sentirá bien por que su hijo tendrá una recompensa por su esfuerzo.
La Sra. Patricia vive con su esposo quien la apoya en todo momento, su esposo trabaja como chofer de carretera para una empresa de la localidad, los dos han acordado que su mayor deseo es que sus hijos reciban una buena educción y mismo garantisandoles  un futuro mejor  lleno de oportunidades 
generadas en base de ese estudio que la señora patricia y su esposo con tanto esfuerzo
y sacrificio le brindan a sus hijos
brindandoles un amejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Patricia has a son who is going to graduate.  She wants her son to enjoy it, so she needs to cover the expenses for photography, clothing, and the fees for the graduation papers.  With this she will feel good because her son will be rewarded for his effort.

Patricia lives with her husband, who always supports her.  He works as a truck driver for a local business.  The two have agreed that their biggest desire is for their children to have a good education.  This will guarantee them a better future filled with opportunities based on those studies that Patricia and her husband give their children with so much effort, offering them a better quality of life.

loans.use: to pay for her son's graduation expenses.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario G. is from the village of Lugdungan. She is 59 years old, married and has six adult children. Rosario operates a family member's business in the agriculture sector, primarily planting rice. Now she has a business hog raising aside from farming. She has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. 

In 2010, Rosario joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Rosario is requesting a loan of 13,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase of feed for her four pigs. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Rosario from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase feed for her hog fattening

loans.name: Potenciana

texts.en:
Potenciana is a 50-year-old married woman with four children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

She does business buying and selling used shoes in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase bundles of used shoes to sell.

Potenciana has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of used shoes to sell

loans.name: Marcia Marth A

texts.es: MARCIA MARTHA: Es una señora alegre y luchadora, madre soltera de un hijo de 10 años de edad que estudia su quinto grado de primaria, con el propósito de sacar adelante a su hijo, desde hace 5 años vende de manera ambulante ropa nueva y calzado, de esta manera genera sus propios ingresos. Solicita financiamiento para comprar en Masaya calzado para mujer, hombres y niños y ropa nueva. Ella sueña con tener el suficiente capital para tener su propio tramo.

loans.use: para comprar en Masaya calzado para mujer, hombres y niños y ropa nueva

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel has three children and they at the moment are studying their basic and university studies; he lives in Pedro Escobedo, Querétaro. Since he was younger, Samuel has worked to commercialization of leather products (sale of belts, wallets and buckles). In 1994, one of his clients made a fraud to him and that is the way how he felt the necessity to get a job and somebody gives him an opportunity to acquire a space in a small market in his town, he used his own capital obtained with sales of his own articles of his home.

After many years of efforts and with support of his wife and children, Samuel has been to maintain his business. For that reason, he has been working to give them and cover their necessities, like a quality education to his children. To make grow up his business Samuel needs a loan of $475 USD in order to increase his sales in this Christmas season. Help him to grow up in his business and continue sustaining his lovely family and be a successful man.

** \"This text has been translated from the following original business description.\"

Samuel M. Barón, es padre de tres hijos, quienes actualmente realizan sus estudios básicos y universitarios, él vive en Pedro Escobedo, Querétaro. Desde su juventud Samuel se ha dedicado a la comercialización de productos de piel (venta de cinturones, carteras y hebillas) . Pero fue en 1994, después de un desfalco que le provocó uno de sus principales clientes, cuando sobrevino la necesidad y le brindan la oportunidad de adquirir un espacio en el tianguis de la localidad, capitalizándose con la venta de pertenencias propias de su hogar.

Después de años de esfuerzo y con el apoyo de su esposa e hijos, Samuel a logrado mantener su negocio y de ésta manera ha podido dar todo lo necesario a su familia, y una educación de calidad para sus hijos. Para poder hacer crecer su negocio Samuel necesita un crédito de $475 DLLS y así poder incrementar sus ventas en la época navideña que se aproxima. Ayúdalo a crecer en su negiocio y continuar sosteniendo su familia.

loans.use: Purchase Merchandise

loans.name: Razak

texts.en:
Born in 1977 in Lomé in the Gulf region, Mr. Razak C. is married and a father of a child. He stopped his secondary studies after failing the BEPC (a local examination) and started learning about tailoring. He is now a tailor and embroiderer and has a small workshop with a saleswoman in Hountigomé in Lomé.

With the aim to increase his profits, he would now like to open a small textile shop in his workshop. To this end, he is asking for a credit of $600 for the first time. With his tailoring experience and management capabilities, this credit will give him a second chance, economically, to improve his standard of living.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Né en 1977 à Lomé dans la préfecture du golfe, Monsieur C. Razak est marié et père d’un enfant. C’est un homme qui a arrêté ses études secondaires après un échec au BEPC pour rentrer dans l’apprentissage de la couture. Il est actuellement tailleur brodeur de formation et a un petit atelier avec une femme vendeuse de produits divers, tous vivant à Hountigomé à Lomé. Voulant augmenter le bénéfice qu’il tire de son métier, il désire ouvrir une petite mercerie dans son atelier. A cet effet, il sollicite pour la première fois, un crédit de $600 . Avec son expérience de couturier et la capacité de gestion qu’il a acquis, ce financement lui donnera un second souffle sur le plan économique, ceci pour améliorer son niveau de vie.

loans.use: Opening of a textile shop in his tailoring workshop

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel has been living on his farm his entire life. He not only inherited his lands from his father, but he also inherited the knowledge of how to grow rice from him. He lives in his home with his wife and one of his children. He also has three sons who live separately, but help him work his lands. He will use the loan to fix his lands for farming. He will also buy fertilizer and seeds for his farm. In the future, he wants to invest in pigs and chickens.

Samuel is the latest addition to one of the new Communal Banks in the Mifex Rural Finance Program. All of the members of the 10 de enero Communal Bank are part of an Association of Rice Farmers in Salitre named 10 de enero. They will use the microloans to prepare the lands and cultivate rice on their farms. Because they form part of a communal bank, they are all each others' guarantors for the loan. This means that if for some reason one person in the group cannot fully repay the loan, the other borrowers and the 10 de enero Association are responsible for the amount in default. The members of the bank also participate in a program designed to teach and encourage savings among the group. Promoting savings is often forgotten in many microfinance programs, but is imperative for the communities Mifex works with to have capital reserved for future investments or unexpected difficulties.

Loan Use and Repayment

The loans in this sector will be used to create water basins that will prevent flooding in the case of heavy rains or store water in case of droughts. They will also be used to treat the land prior to farming, to plant the seeds and purchase fertilizer. The loan repayment schedule is also different from the typical microentrepreneur. Because farmers see the profits from their investments 5 or 6 months after making their initial expenditures, Mifex asks them only to pay 50% of the capital in the first 5 months of the loan. The rest of the debt must be paid in the sixth and final month.

Below is more information about Salitre compiled by the staff at Mifex when evaluating the potential of the sector for the Rural Finance Program.

Economy of Salitre

Salitre is a rural sector in the Province of Guayas known as the capital of Montuvios (montuvio is a cowboy) with approximately 30,000 inhabitants. The main economic activities are herding and agriculture which make up about 80% of the economy. The infrastructure and basic services are poor, especially the roads and water services.

Salitre is highly dedicated to farming rice and cattle ranching. Rice is a crop that yields about every four months. In order to farm rice, the environment must be very humid and there must be a high volume of water. The lack of a structured water system makes it difficult for the small farmers to be highly productive. The best months for cultivating rice are early in the year when it is the rainy season in the coast of Ecuador.

Salitre is a national tourist attraction as many Ecuadorians visit the freshwater Salitre River. There are cottages, small restaurants and water attractions that people come to enjoy.

Access to Credit

There are not many financial institutions that provide services to the productive sector of the local economy. The primary access to credit comes from loan sharks who charge extremely high interest rates averaging around 20% a month. The locals are also exploited by the intermediaries that buy their products in order to commercialize them in the city and to export abroad. These intermediaries buy crops in advance at very low prices, finance soil at extremely high prices and often provide emergency loans for even higher interest rates than the loan sharks.

Risks

Salitre is a dangerous sector considering it is in a rural area. There is a high incidence of robbery of cattle that results in many of the ranch owners owning weapons to protect their property. Because the police are not present in these areas, farmers and ranchers must apply their own laws and provide their own security. In some instances they have formed their own cooperatives and associations to have a community crime prevention effort.

Salitre is in the lowlands of Ecuador and is vulnerable to flooding in the rainy season. In the event of a heavy rainy season, often at its worse when El Niño occurs, the farmers of rice lose many of their crops. All this is due to a lack of infrastructure in the area.

loans.use: Rice cultivation

loans.name: Prom

texts.en: Mrs. Prom R. is a 29-year -old widow living in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia.  She owns and operates a small booth selling a variety of fruits and duck eggs.  She earns about $4/day in this business which is enough to support her one child and her mother who lives with her.  This loan will be used for purchasing more fruit and duck eggs for her booth.  Currently, her clients demand more products, but she cannot satisfy them because she doesn't have enough capital.  This loan will help her to increase her income so she can continue to support her child and mother.

loans.use: To purchase fruit and eggs

loans.name: Onosai

texts.en: Onosai M. is a 72-year old mother of twelve children. She’s one of the very active old members in the program who started with a pig rearing business, then took on a taro plantation, and is now running a shop business. She is the chief of their community of 32 ladies, all active except one that is now working. With her great support in their community, she has been able to help the young women follow in her footsteps; she has become a great role model to all the ladies in her community, and also the program. She is one of the best savers as well and this encourages the other ladies to save up like her. With her years in business, she has now ended up with a shop, which she believes suits her strength and age. With her requested loan, she will  purchase a freezer and to restock  her shop. Good members like her are needed in the program.

loans.use: Loan will be used to purchase a large freezer and restock her shop.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys, 39 years old, lives in the Province of Huaraz with a partner and two children. She is a member of the Banco Comunal Paltainas al Progreso. For 20 years, she has dedicated herself to the sale of groceries using her earnings to help support her family.

With the recent loan from Manuela Ramos of 2,300.00 soles (approx. $767 USD), which will be repaid in six months, she hopes to purchase additional goods/products (such as rice, sugar, noodles, cooking oil, milk, etc.) to offer for sale in her store.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Gladys tiene 39 años de edad, vive en el Centro Poblado de Paltay, Distrito Tarica, Provincia de Huaraz. Es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos. Es fundadora del Banco Comunal Paltainas al Progreso, desde hace 20 años se dedica a la venta de Abarrotes y Golosinas, con estos ingresos ella apoya a sus hijos y su hogar. Con el reciente préstamos recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 2,300.00 soles ($767.00 aprox.), el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará mercadería como Abarrotes (arroz, azúcar, fideo, aceite, leche, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase basic necessities (sugar, rice, milk, etc.) for grocery store.

loans.name: Neema

texts.en:
“What kind of business does Mrs. K. run?” I asked. “Kuku, kuku!” replied my colleague emphatically. Who or what is ‘Kuka’ you may ask, as I did while client and colleague alike enjoyed my confusion! Kuka means chickens in Swahili. I hope simple chickens aren’t an anti-climax after such intrigue, but simple chickens are what support Neema K., her husband Moses and their ten year-old daughter Rachel.

Neema accessed a loan from SELFINA early in 2007 to establish a business raising and selling chickens, which she has repaid in full. She is now requesting a loan of $700 to expand this business. She wants to buy more kuka!

About the microloan partner:

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipments from the said client extending a loan to her and then leases back the same equipment – a process called sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: Neema would like to purchase additional chickens to raise and sell.

loans.name: Sesilia

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam! This is 44-year-old Sesilia K.. She is single with three children, ages 14, 22, and 24, and has one other dependent who is her sister. In 2005 Sesilia established a barbecue business, and now requests a loan of $275 in order to purchase ingredients in bulk for her tasty tandoori chicken. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is an organization that is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania. Through leasing and leaseback, SELFINA provides a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets. As they lack tangible collateral assets, they are termed not creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from that client, extends a loan to her, then leases back the same equipment. The process is called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients in bulk for her barbecue business.

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.en:
A. Dilorom is a 41-year old mother of 2 school age children. Her husband is currently unemployed. 

For 12 years Dilorom has been the main bread-winner in the family. She is selling the national robes for boys and national hats for kids. Those national oriental items are very beautiful and extremely popular in Tajikistan. When there is a wedding party or other family occasion the boys are as a rule dressed robes and hats embroidered by hand. 

Dilorom requests 450.00 US Dollars in order to purchase more goods like oriental robes and national hats. She promises to pay the loan in 6 months and thanks everyone for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Laurita

texts.en:
Laurita, a forty-two year old mother of two girls, sells ‘chimichurri’ (a typical Dominican hamburger with lettuce, many kinds of herbs, spices and other condiments). Laurita operates her business from a small local next to her house located in the Batey of Palavé community of San Cristobal. The entrepreneur says that this activity is her principal source of income, and she wants to keep carrying on her business “until I become millionaire,” she says, laughing hard.

Laurita hopes that someday she’ll have “a very big store that can compete with Burger King.” With her loan, she’ll buy raw materials to keep preparing her chimichurri.

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials to prepare hamburgers.

loans.name: Djumagul

texts.ru:
Djumagul M. lives in the town of Yavan. She is 61 years old, married and has five children. She does not work anywhere, but in spite of her age, she keeps her animal husbandry business herself. Djumagul is a very active and strong woman. She has one milk cow from which she gets milk and sells it on the market. This business brings good income to her. She wants to buy a second cow to increase the amount of milk she can get which will allow to increase her profits. Besides, milk is always in high demand and selling it helps supply the residents with a healthy and nutritious product at an affordable price. This is why Djumagul needs a loan. She will pay off the loan within 8 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Магмуродова джумагул проживает в городе Яван. Замужем , имеет 5 детей.Возраст 61 год. Клиентка нигде не работает , но не смотря на свой возраст она самостоятельно занимается животноводством. Джумагуль очень активная и сильная женщина. Имеет одну корову которая дает молоко. Свежее молоко она продает на базаре. Этот бизнес дает ей доход. Сейчас клиентка хочет купить еще одну корову , чтобы увеличить количество получаемого молока. Это дает возможность увеличить доход. Кроме того молоко всегда пользуется спросом и продажа данного вида прдукции помогает обеспечить население жизненно- важным продуктом . по доступным ценам. Поэтому клиентка запланировала получить кредит. А погасить кредит она сможет в течении 8 месяца.

loans.use: To buy a milk cow

loans.name: Natangué Group

texts.fr:
In order to combat the real effects of the phenomenon of illegal immigration, the women of Thiaroye mobilized themselves to form a group, which will allow them to acquire more finances. This will be used to transform seafood products and local cereals and to manufacture dolls. This will give the female victims of illegal immigration the opportunity to work and to meet the needs of their families, since many among them find themselves in a state of total disarray after having lost their sons or their husbands.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Afin de lutter contre la réalité du phénoméne de l'émigration clandestine, les femmes de Thiaroye se sont mobilisées à former un groupement. Ce qui va leur permettre d'acquérir des financements. Ceci leur permettra de transformer des produits halieutiques, des céréales locales, de confectionner des poupées pour donner aux femmes vicitimes du phénoméne de l'émigration clandestine, l'opportunité de travailler et de subvenir aux besoins de leur famille parce que beaucoup d'entres elles se sont sont trouvées dans le désarroi total aprés avoir perdu pour les unes leurs fils et les autres leurs maris.

loans.use: To buy material for the transformation of seafood products

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 33-year-old father of one child. He lives with his family in Nabatieh, in southern Lebanon. Mohamad owns a bookstore. This is the fifth time he has applied to Al Majmoua for a loan. He needs to buy merchandise to sustain and develop his business.

loans.use: To buy books for his bookstore

loans.name: Zenaida Rebeca

texts.es:
Zenaida is a hard-working woman who toils tirelessly in her small brick factory, where she has worked for 20 years. Her wish is to earn income for the wellbeing of her 6 children, who have motivated her continuously. Currently Zenaida is supporting the studies for 4 of her children. Her wish is to be able to produce a greater number of bricks, taking advantage of the time in the year when profits are higher. She will use the requested loan money to purchase a greater amount of sawdust, an important ingredient for making bricks.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson

Zenaida es una mujer muy trabajadora, ella labora incansablemente en su pequeña fábrica de ladrillos, donde viene trabajando hace 20 años, su deseo de generar ingresos para el bienestar de sus 6 hijos, la han motivado incansablemente. En la actualidad, Zenaida vela por los estudios de sus 4 menores hijos, su deseo es poder producir mayor cantidad de ladrillos aprovechando esta época del año en que recibe mejores ganancias, con el dinero solicitado podrá invertir en mayor cantidad de aserrín, insumo importante para la fabricación de sus ladrillos.

loans.use: Purchase of important materials to continue her business

loans.name: Mevlida

texts.en:
Mevlida is a 25-year-old woman from the small community of Osijek, which is located outside the city of Sarajevo. She is single, and currently lives with her parents. Mevlida has been working to support herself at a coffee shop she runs with her friend. They run this shop at the major open market in town, so it gets a lot of business.

Mevlida is requesting this her 1st loan with Zene za Zene in the amount of 1200 KM to help with some renovations to her shop. She would also like to purchase some more goods for her cafe, including coffee & juice, with the remainder of this loan. It is Melvlida’s goal to increase her income by serving more customers after this expansion.

loans.use: To renovate & buy inventory for her cafe

loans.name: Fatma's Utulivu Group

texts.en:
Fatma is married and has a 6 month old child. She has been selling clothes since 2005. She works everyday from 8am to 4pm and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

Fatma is now requesting a loan to buy more clothes to expand her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Amina.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Leocrecia

texts.es:
Leocrecia es socia del Banco Comunal Retoño. Leocrecia es casada, tiene 36 años y 5 hijos, Leocrecia junto a su esposo son recicladores de fierros, cauchos, botellas descartables, zapatillas, ollas, cobre, bronce, que compran por kilos, actividad que realizan en un local de su propiedad en el distrito de San Juan Bautista, Leocrecia tiene un carro con el cual salen a los diferentes distritos y también en la ciudad de Ayacucho para reciclar todo cuanto encuentran, luego de acopiar lo envían a la ciudad de Lima.

Leocrecia necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de plásticos y fierros. Los sueños de Leocrecia son comprar un molino para moler los plásticos, construir una buena casa y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Leocrecia is a member of the Retoño Village Bank. She is 36 years old and is married with five children. Leocrecia and her husband are recyclers of iron, rubber, disposable bottles, slippers, pots, copper, and bronze, which they buy by the kilogram. They recycle these items in a business that they own in the San Juan Bautista district. Leocrecia has a car which they use to travel to different districts and also within the city of Ayacucho to recycle everything they find. After collecting everything, they send it to the city of Lima.

Leocrecia needs a loan of 1,000 soles, which she will invest in the purchase of plastics and iron. Leocrecia dreams of buying a mill to grind plastics, of building a good home and that her children will grow up to become working professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Larissa Kravanja, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Leocrecia needs a loan of 1,000 soles, which she will invest in the purchase of plastics and iron.

loans.name: Svay

texts.en:
Mrs. Svay T. is a villager in Konsoum Ork Village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer and has a plot of land. Her husband Mr. Sor Soka works in security.

Even though they have different careers, they do not make enough money to earn a good living.

Thus, Mrs. Svay T. has decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings. This will allow her to purchase a new home for her and her family.

She is 40 years old and the mother of two children. Both of her children attend the local school.

Her husband is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To add to her savings to buy a new house

loans.name: Channa

texts.en: Mr. Channa R. lives in the Tep Phyrom village in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. He installs windows. This business is going well, and he wants to expand it. So Mr. Channa R. requests a loan to buy more equipment for doing construction work. He hopes to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions. His wife, Mrs. Roeun Sreyna, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she cultivates rice. Mr. Channa R. is 24 years old and has a 3-year-old child.

loans.use: Buy more equipment for construction work

loans.name: Maria Luz

texts.en:
Maria Luz is a member of the Luz y Vida (“Light and Life”) Village Bank. She is 26 years old and lives with her partner and her daughter. Maria Luz runs a small dry goods store from a rented stand in the Nazarenas Market. She works seven days a week from 6 am to 8 pm and brings her baby daughter to work with her. 

Maria Luz is requesting a loan of 900 soles to buy sacks of rice, flour and dried pasta. Her goal for the future is to continue expanding her business.

loans.use: Buy sacks of rice, flour, to improve her business

loans.name: Vu Thi

texts.vi: Chị Vũ Thị Hải  năm nay 48  tuổi, gia đình chị có 3 con trong đó H. con đã trưởng thành. Năm 1999 chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư thu mua phế liệu về bán lại cho các đại lý thu mua. Hiện nay đây vẫn là công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị với thu nhập 3.500.000đ/ tháng.  Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay  12.000.000đ để đầu tư vốn đi thu mua phế liệu.
texts.en:
Mrs. Vu Thi H. is 48 years old. Her family has three children, two of whom are grown. In 1999, she joined TYM Fund to invest in buying scrap materials for reselling. Currently, this business gives her family an income of 3,500,000 VND per month. She would like to borrow 12,000,000 VND to invest in buying more scrap materials.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thiennga Ngo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa se dedica a la venta a de cosméticos desde hace ocho años. Empezó vendiendo productos de una sola marca, pero poco a poco y con la idea de obtener un mayor ingreso ha llegado a vender cosméticos de tres distintas marcas. Por otro lado, también ofrece el servicio de limpieza ay mantenimiento en un consultorio dental. Ha sido con este oficio con el que ella empezó a trabajar y a ayudar con los gastos en su hogar. 

Rosa es madre de dos hijas, quienes siempre han significado su motivación más importante para poder trabajar. Hoy en día ellas ya son mayores e independientes; por lo que las ganancias de Rosa las comparte con su esposo ara cubrir gastos y mantenimiento de su casa.
 
Junto con unas amigas esta considerando la posibilidad de abrir  un negocio de confección de ropa dentro de unos años.
texts.en:
Rosa has been making a living by selling cosmetics for the past 8 years. She started selling the products of only one brand, but little by little, she has been able to start selling the cosmetics of three different brands. She also offers a cleaning service in a dental office. With this side job she was able to work and help out with the household expenses.

Rosa is the mother of two girls, who are her motivation to work. Now that they are grown, Rosa and her husband live alone. She shares her earnings with her husband so that all of the household expenses with be covered. Together with some friends, Rosa is considering the possibility of starting a business of making clothing in a few years.

(Translated by Ally and Mariela of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: New Merchandise (Cosmetics)

loans.name: Joyce's Group

texts.en:
Joyce has been a vegetable seller in the Sakina neighborhood of Arusha for 3 years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of US$ 40. Every day she works at her business from 12:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m. She is requesting a loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more vegetables for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Joyce is 31 years old, married, and has three children between 12 and 4. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Fatuma and Farida. Each woman has her own small business in Arusha.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables for re-sale in order to expand her business

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline I. is currently in the business of selling onions and cooking oil. She is requesting a loan to expand her business. Jackline is 25 years old and is married to a man who is a driver. She has one child who does not go to school. With the extra profit from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a hotel.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Expand her business and open a hotel

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.es: Rebeca tiene 26 años, vive junto a su esposo y su única hija de 2 añitos. Vive en casa de sus suegros. Desde hace 7 años se dedica a la venta de bebidas en su domicilio. Asimismo, en las afueras de su casa y junto a su esposo, vende repuestos de licuadoras. Rebeca está muy contenta con sus negocios, porque le permiten obtener buenas ganancias, y debido a que su casa se encuentra en una zona muy transitada sus ventas son diarias y constantes. En el futuro, quiere tener una distribuidora de bebidas, tanto de cervezas, como de variedad de refrescos. Con MFP tiene 3 préstamos, y le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal porque con sus compañeros están muy unidos y son solidarios unos con otros. Con el dinero que solicita comprará mayor cantidad de bebidas para incrementar sus ventas, con otra parte mandará a arreglar algunas estructuras de su casa.
texts.en:
Rebeca is 26 years old and lives with her husband and her little two year old daughter. She lives with her husband's parents. For the past seven years she has been selling beverages from her house. She and her husband also repair blenders in their yard. Rebeca is very satisfied with her endeavors because they provide her with a good income and, due to the fact that her house is located in a busy area, she does a brisk business. In the future she wants to become a wholesaler for beverages such as beer as well as other types of refreshments. She has had three loans with Microfinanzas PRISMA and she likes working with her communal bank because they are very united and supportive of one another. With the money from this loan she is going to buy larger quantities of beverages in order to increase her sales. Another part of the loan will be used to repair some parts of her house.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beverages for sale and to fix up her house.

loans.name: Chem's Group

texts.en:
One of the members of the two borrower group loan is Mrs. Chem Y., age 41, the leader. Mrs. Y. generates her daily income by braiding thatch out of her home for sale. Almost all of her clients come to buy at her home. Y. is a widowed mother who has four teenage children: one is a fish seller, one sells firewood, and the other two are students who help her work when they are not studying.

Y.'s investment is going well, and she is trying to group up with a number of the users. Unfortunately, she has run out of raw materials; thus, she has decided to seek for a loan in order to buy additional raw material for braiding.

The other one borrower is Mrs. C., a fish seller who requests a loan to purchase more fish to sell. The borrowers live in Siem Reap Province.

loans.use: To buy additional raw material for braiding

loans.name: Los Obreros Group

texts.es: El banco comunal denominado "Los Obrero" esta representado por el señor Demetrioa y conformada por 12 personas las cuales se dedican a diferentes actividades como  a la elaboración D. muebles D. madera, a la venta D. comida, empanadas, carne, abarrotes en tiendas D. barrio, frutas y verduras. Cada uno D. los miembros sabe que existe gran competencia en el mercado pero también sabe que debe esforzarse en su puesto D. venta ya que representa el ingreso diario y el sustento D. su familia es por esta razón que requieren del financiamiento para poder obtener mayor mercadería a un precio mas bajo así como la compra D. insumos para brindar un producto acabado que pueda competir en el mercado. Este grupo es relativamente nuevo por lo que no tiene mucha experiencia en grupos solidarios pero están concientes que se requiere D. un mayor esfuerzo para cumplir con su grupo y con la Institución y poder mejor la calidad D. vida D. sus familias.
texts.en:
The communal bank named "Los Obreros" is represented by Demetrio and is maD. up of 12 persons who work in different activities, such as making wood furniture, the sale of food, empanadas, meat, groceries in neighborhood stores, fruits and vegetables. Each one of the members knows that there is a lot of competition in the market but they also know that they must work hard at their sales since this means daily income and support for their families. They need financing in order to be able to get more merchandise at lower prices as well as buy supplies so they can offer a product which can compete in the marketplace. This group is relatively new and does not have much experience with support groups, but they are aware that it requires a greater effort to fulfill their obligations with the group and the loan institution in order to improve their families´ standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Nelicia

texts.en:
Dried prawns (known locally as hibi) processing and distribution is the specialty of Mrs. Nelicia A.. This couple started their business several years ago and have been able to maintain it and meet the demands of their customers, friends and neighbors. They sell on consignment at different stores like Gaisano City – Ozamiz, Lee Plaza in Dipolog and big stores in Davao City, Pagadian City and other neighboring towns and provinces.

Nelicia is 51 years old, married and a resident of Maquilao, Tangub City. Unfortunately, this couple was unable to have a child but they have one adopted child that they treat as their own. Her name is Cheryl. She is now a grown lady and a member of Paglaum MPC under the PDP-LP Program (Paglaum Development Program for Landless People).

Now, Nelicia is applying for a loan of 14,500 PHP to purchase prawns for hibi processing. This is her sixth loan. The couple wants to thank PMPC and Kiva for their support and financial assistance. They will be able to maximize their supplies and make bigger sales and profits.

loans.use: To buy hibi for processing and distribution

loans.name: Jumagul

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 




Жумагул успешно закончила свой кредит и смогла увеличить оборотный капитал скота.Она планирует в дальнейшем получив кредит хочет оптом закупить корм для скота и две молодые коровы. На снимке Чумагул в день выдачи.
texts.en:
Jumagul successfully repaid her loan and was able to increase her livestock working capital. She plans to use the next loan to buy livestock feed wholesale and two young cows in the future. The photograph shows Jumagul on the disbursement day.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Wholesale purchase of livestock feed

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
Maritza  es socia del Bancomunal Las Luciérnagas.
Maritza es casada tiene  44 años, dos hijos de 20 y 15 años, la mayor  trabaja y la menor está estudiando en la escuela estatal.
Maritza trabajaba como secretaria en una empresa, redujeron personal y se quedo sin trabajo, al poco tiempo se enfermo del corazón la operaron,  ya no pudo trabajar  por muchos años. Hace un año decidió  trabajar vendiendo  cosméticos  y joyas.  
Desde que Maritza está en Finca aprendió ahorrar, y a ser cumplida con los préstamos  es una gran ayuda porque puede invertir en productos.  
Maritza necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles, para la compra de joyas, cosmético y va matricularse en un taller de joyería.
El sueño de Maritza es alquilar un puesto para bazar.
texts.en:
Maritza is a member of the communal bank "Las Luciérnagas" (The Fireflies). Maritza is married and is 44 years old. She has two children and they are 20 and 15 years old. The oldest works and the youngest is a student in the public school system. Maritza used to work as a secretary at a company but her position was cut when their were job cuts at the company. She was left without a job and shortly after she had heart problems and had to undergo an operation. She could not work for many years. A year ago she decided to work selling cosmetics and jewels. Since Maritza has been in Finca she learned to save and to be responsible with her loans. It is a huge help because she can invest money in her products. Maritza needs a loan of $400 (1,200 Soles) to buy jewelry, cosmetics and to pay for a jewelry making class. Maritza's dream is to rent a space in the bazaar.

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy jewelry, cosmetics and to take a jewelry making class.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena C. is a 42-year-old store owner who has been in business for 15 years. Her husband works overseas and she lives with their seven children. They live in one of the poor communities of Bagong Silang, Caloocan City.

Elena used to earn money by cooking and serving food to her neighbors until she opened a small variety store three months ago. She makes a daily income of P 600 and has hired two youngsters to assist her in her business.
