She has been with the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative for four years. She is now seeking a loan of P 12,000. She will use the loan to purchase additional merchandise for her store, reducing the frequency of trips to the market to buy more inventory.

Elena is working hand-in-hand with her husband, who works miles away, to sustain her children’s education. She also dreams of owning a bigger grocery store.

About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through a fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise for sale in her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more crops in bulk

loans.name: Josefa María

texts.es: Dona Josefa A.  tiene 40 años de edad, es Casada de oficios Comerciante,  “Venta  de Ropa  Típicas para Mujeres” cuenta con un Pequeño Negocio, habita junto  a su esposo  e hijos, ella y su esposo se dedican al mismo oficio  lleva 12 años en la venta de ropa Típica en su residencia que se encuentra en el Caserío Chaquiral, de la Aldea V. del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su familia, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.

loans.use: Comercio (Capital de trabajo)

loans.name: Jimoh

texts.en: Jimoh is 32 years old, married, and has 2 children. He sells motor parts and has been in business since 1996. He lives in Ogbomoso, Oyo State. He hopes for a loan in the amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more motor parts to sell. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders

loans.use: To purchase more motor parts to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy work supplies and equipment

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina C. is from the village of Brgy. Santiago in Iligan City. She is 38 years old. Rosalina is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Rosalina sells scrap metal and other used products in the local community. Rosalina is just starting this business.

In 2009, Rosalina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalina is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP that she will use to expand her business. This will be Rosalina's first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is 52 years old and married with four children, two of whom are still in school. She operates Wajudys Wedding Gifts shop, selling utensils like sufurias (pots) and kettles, and beauty products like earrings, necklaces and flowers in wholesale. Her shop is located in Githiga Shopping Centre in Kiambu and she says it is unique because there are no other shops there like it. She has run her shop for six years and also earns extra income as a dairy farmer. Susan is requesting a loan of Kes 40,000 to add stock, especially jewelry, because December is wedding season in Kenya. Susan describes herself as a very hardworking lady who is focussed and works with a lot of seriousness. In the future, she hopes to expand both her businesses by partnering with Faulu, which she says she knows is a daraja (bridge) to making her dream come true. About Faulu Kenya: Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To add to her stock of wedding items

loans.name: Elidio Dias

texts.pt:
Elidio Dias P. nasceu na cidade de Chimoio, capital da Província de Manica, centro de Moçambique, tem 29 anos de idade, solteiro e pai de um filho de 7 anos de idade. Fez 12ª classe, neste momento continua a fazer o ensino técnico profissional. Vive na casa própria com seus irmãos e sustenta também a sua filha que vive com a sua mãe.

Saiu de Chimoio para Maputo concretamente no Distrito de Boane, aos 14 anos de idade com os seus pais. Faz um negocio próprio de venda de produtos de 1ª necessidade e recargas de telemóveis, com estes consegue um rendimento de cerca de 11.000.00mt e tem outro rendimento de 4.900.00mt provenientes do subsidio pago pela embaixada da Ruanda, onde lecciona a língua portuguesa das 17h as19h. Com estes rendimentos consegue poupar algum dinheiro na sua conta bancária.

Nunca teve empréstimos em outras instituições bancárias, conheceu a Hluvuku através de seu irmão que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu 4º empréstimo no valor de 21.000.00mt, com o qual pretende comprar produtos (bolachas, açúcar, caldos, recargas e outros) para satisfazer a sua clientela. Os empréstimos passados foram de os mesmos foram para a mesma actividade.

Futuramente pretende solicitar mais empréstimos, afim de ampliar o seu negócio e construir um estabelecimento comercial.
texts.en:
Elidio Dias P. was born in the city of Chimoio, capital of the Manica province in the center of Mozambique. He is 29 years old, single, and father of one child who is 7 years old. He completed 12th grade and is currently enrolled in technical college. He lives in his own home with his siblings and also supports his daughter who lives with her mother. He left Chimoio for Maputo, specifically for the Boane district, with his parents when he was 14 years old. He has his own business selling basic necessities and cell phone minutes. He earns around 11.000,00 MT from these activities and also earns 4.900,00 MT a subsidy paid by the Rwandan embassy, where he teaches a Portuguese language class form 5pm to 7pm. With his earnings he is able to save some money in his bank account. He has never had loans in other banking institutions. He learned about Hluvuku through his brother who is also a client of the institution. This is his 4th loan, in the amount of 21.000,00 MT, which he will use to purchase products (biscuits, sugar, soups, batteries, etc.) to serve his customers. His prior loans were for the same amount and for the same activities. In the future he plans to request additional loans with the goal of growing his business and building a shop.

Translated from Portuguese by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of food products and cell phone minutes

loans.name: Medina

texts.en:
Medina is a 37-year-old married woman with two young kids. Her oldest child is 3 years old. She married her husband, Julian, in 1996, and she explains that she loves taking care of her family. She is engaged in the business of rice farming to meet her family's daily needs, but she notes that she also wants to save money for her children’s future. She is currently preparing her land for planting.

She applied to CEVI to gain access to its financial program. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 14,000 PHP ($300). With the loan proceeds, she would like to purchase farming necessities, such as diesel for the tractor, and to pay her laborers. Medina will be happy to use this loan for her business because she knows that it will enable her to save more income in the future.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing farming necessities and by paying her laborers

loans.name: Ikory

texts.en:
Ikory S. sells tea and bread in a small restaurant.  She is requesting a loan to stock charcoal to sell. Ikory is 28 years old and is a widow.   She has four children who all go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to build a house to rent.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: stock charcoal to sell

loans.name: Risolat

texts.ru: Содикова Рисолат проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст 51 лет. Вдова, имеет 3 детей. Рисолат имеет среднее образование. Она более 14 лет занимается торговлей на рынке. В ее ассортимент входит основном одежда. Кредит просит для расширения ассортимента, т.е. увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Risolat S. lives in Kulyab. She is 51. Risolat S. is a widow and a mother of 3 children. She has a high school education. For more than 14 years, Risolat has been selling clothing at a local market. She asks for this loan to increase the assortment of goods she sells and to help drive sales up.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the volume of goods sold

loans.name: Florencio

texts.es: Florencio tiene 54 años de edad su estado civil es soltero, no tiene hijos dependientes, vive en una casa que es propia. Florencio se dedica a la venta de ganado vacuno, la carne la comercializa en las ferias de la ciudad donde vive. Florencio cuenta con una experiencia de 16 años de experiencia en este rubro su competencia es de nivel medio, esto debido a que cuenta con clientes fijos quienes lo prefieren por su responsabilidad en el trabajo. El presente crédito lo sacó para capital de operación, es decir para la adquisición de ganado vacuno. El presente es su tercer crédito en la institución en créditos anteriores trabajo de manera optima, no tiene obligaciones con las Entidades Financieras.
texts.en:
Florencio is 54 years old and single with no dependent children; he lives in a house he owns. Florencio sells beef cattle; he sells the beef in the markets in the city where he lives. He has worked in beef sales for 16 years and is very competent; he he has many customers who prefer to buy from him because he is responsible in his work. This loan will be used for working capital--to purchase more beef cattle. This is his third loan through the institution; he worked hard to repay his previous loans so that he no longer has other liabilities.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of beef cattle--working capital

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Mrs. Teodora C. is from Molave Zamboanga del Sur. She is 43 years old and married with seven children. To make a living, she runs a sari-sari store. Her husband is a farmer  who supports their daily basic needs. Her store serves as their other source of income.

In 2009, she joined PMPC to gain access to financial support and to engage in other business activities. She successfully repaid her previous loan of 5,000PHP from PMPC. She used it to renovate her store. As of now, she has a new loan of 7,000PHP taken from PMPC and its being used for additional capital. It's her third loan from PMPC.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Poni

texts.en:
Poni M. is currently in the business of brewing and selling local alcohol at the market and is requesting a loan to stock materials to use in her business. Poni is 26 years old and is married. Her husband is a businessman. She has 3 children who all go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock materials to use in brewing alcohol.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana Z. de 57 años, vive en una zona periurbana en Paraíso de Guayaquil, su casa es mixta de caña y tablas y solo cuenta con luz como servicio básico. Es viuda con dos hijos mayores de edad. 

Ana inicio a vender ajo cuando el esposo murió ya que tenía que sustentar los gastos del hogar. Compro ajos a un bajo precio los pelaba y los vendía por fundas.    

Ahora ella vende el ajo en funda a muchas personas. Trabaja desde las 08h00 hasta las 18h00, lo que ella quisiera es tener su propio puesto de venta de ajo y granos, pero su situación económica no le ha sido favorable. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cemento, hierro y bloques para poder construir su casa de cemento y así no le filtre las lluvias su casa. En el futuro quiere tener una tienda.
texts.en:
Ana Z. is 57 years old and lives in the periurban district of Paraíso in Guayaquil. Her house is a mixture of reeds and wooden boards, and receives electricity as its only basic service. She is a widow with two adult children.

Ana started selling garlic after her husband died so that she could continue paying her household expenses. She buys garlic at a low price and then sells it after it has been peeled. Many people now buy peeled garlic from her. Ana works from 8am until 6pm. What she wants most is to have her own vending post where she can sell garlic and grain, but her financial situation has not been favorable.

With this loan, she wants to buy cement, iron, and blocks so that she can build a cement house that does not leak when it rains. In the future, she wants to open a store.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials for building a cement house

loans.name: Faamita

texts.en:
Faamita A. C. is 37 and married with 4 children (ages 3 - 12).  She owns a business venture, selling baked goods in the local community.  Faamita has 3 years of experience in this business.  Faamita needs a loan of WST $1750 to purchase new items to expand product offering.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2007, Faamita joined SPBD.    This is her 3rd loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Faamita's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Faamita A. C. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.9 out of 3
Level of Education:                              2 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         2 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
A Sari-sari store owner is our featured entrepreneur for this story. She is Julieta C., 60 years of age, a widow and a resident of Fernan, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. For her means of living, she engages in a Sari-sari store business. For 20 years she has been able to sustain this business even in times of crisis. At present, she is earning an average net income of not less than PHP1,500.00 a month. This income is so helpful in order to support her basic needs. Aside from that, she is also earning support from her son. 

She joined the cooperative just this year. As a newly recognized member under the PDP-LP Program, she is applying for an amount of PHP3,000.00 to add to the capital for her existing business. The future income will be used for her basic needs, loan repayments and savings. She is hoping that she can  also help her grandchildren in sending them to schools by means of this business. 

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Eat

texts.en: Eat O. is 40 years old and lives with her husband in Takeo province. She and her husband together raise and sell pigs for a profit of US$4 a day. The couple has five children living at home to support. Every month, Eat O. spends about US$45 on food, US$7 on utilities, US$35 on transportation and US$40 on miscellaneous expenses. To earn more money, Eat O. would like to take out a loan of US$1000 so that she can raise more pigs.

loans.use: to raise more pigs

loans.name: Kankeletigui Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Kankeletigui est constitué de neuf membres dont la majorité est célibataire. Elles habitent toutes dans le camp Militaire de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) avec en  moyenne 20 ans et 1 enfant.
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de service (parents militaires), de voisinage dans le camp et font le commerce d’articles divers tels les concentrées de tomates, les chaussures, les huiles de palmes, les céréales, la friperie (avec Awa D.) les fruits et légumes etc. 
Dans le souci  d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, elles ont décidé d’adhérer au programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1ier  de prêt solidaire.
Mademoiselle Awa D., compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, une balle d’habits de friperie. 
Elle se ravitaille au grand marché de Ségou et revend ses habits à domicile et en ambulant dans les quartiers à une clientèle mixte, au comptant et à crédit. Mademoiselle Awa D. espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 20.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour épargner et réinvestir dans l’activité. 
Tout comme les autres membres du groupe, elle a pour ambition d’augmenter le volume de son activité dans ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The group Kankeletigui is composed of nine women members, most of whom are unmarried.  They all live in the Military Camp of Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali), and they average 20 years of age and one child.  They know one another through ties of service (military parents), camp community, and business in a variety of goods, such as tomato paste, shoes, palm oil, grains, used clothing (as with Awa D.), fruit and vegetables, etc.  Concerned about increasing their working capital, the group members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program and are now on their first solidarity loan.  Ms. Awa D. intends to use her loan for buying a bale of second-hand clothing.  She gets her supplies at the big market of Ségou and resells them out of her home and by going door-to-door in the districts.  Accepting cash or credit, she makes her sales to a mixed customer base.  She hopes to make a monthly profit of 20,000 francs CFA that will be put into savings and used to reinvest in the business.  Just like the other group members, she has the ambition of increasing her business volume with this partnership with Soro Yiriwaso. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying used clothing

loans.name: Cica Agnes

texts.en: Cica Agnes A. is 39 years old. Her husband is a cook for a living and they have three children. She sells cosmetic products in a small boutique, where she has been in business since 2008. She has requested 500,000 CFA to purchase fragrances, some weavings, and 100 cartons of cosmetics. She is an experienced borrower – this is her third loan from WAGES.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics

loans.name: Jesca

texts.en:
N. Jesca is a hardworking business woman, thirty-eight years old. She is married and blessed with three children who are are all schooling. More so, she is caring for four dependents, too.

Jesca deals in a hardware business located in Nakaiba which she has been operating for over eight years. She is using the loan to purchase more stock of cement, nails, paints of different types, iron sheets among other items.

Jesca’s future dream is to open up a wholesale hardware shop, mainly selling cement and other hardware items such as nails, wire mesh and so forth. And, more so, she hopes to educate her children up to university level.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of cement, nails, paints of different types, iron sheets, etc.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Olivia is married with six children and all her children go school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She owns a charcoal store at her home and sells to all categories of people on both on a retail and wholesale basis.  

She wants to use this loan to buy more bags of charcoal. She buys bags of charcoal from delivery vans that come from the villages, so she doesn’t incur any transport costs. She has been in this business for five years. Her customers are the local people. She works seven days a week. Her business challenge is defaulters. She aspires to go directly to producers. She joined MCDT (a Kiva partner) because she wanted additional capital. 

Olivia resides in and owns a two-roomed house and the family has access to electricity but no piped water. Her monthly expenses include food, school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina A. is from the village of San Roque, Enrile, Cagayan. She is 54 years old. Josefina is widowed and has 11 adult-aged children. To make a living, Josefina owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Josefina has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4500 PHP when she sells her raised animals.

Josefina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josefina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from ASKI. Josefina is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Josefina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en: Marilou A. is from the village of Nilabo, Rizal. She is 41 years old and is married with two school-aged children. Marilou owns and operates a general store, selling dry goods (products such as textiles, ready-to-wear clothing, and sundries) in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Marilou joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,500 PHP from PMPC. Marilou is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital. This loan will be her 5th from PMPC. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her general store

loans.name: Marta

texts.es:
La Sra. Marta A. es de la ciudad de Carapeguá,  Barrió Santa Margarita, tiene un hijo adolecente en edad escolar.

         Marta es vendedora de ropas y otros productos artesanales como edredones, colchas, mantas, ponchos, hace varios años que realiza este trabajo por la zona de Carapeguá y compañías vecinas, comenta que tiene varios clientes y este trabajo le genera buen  ingreso y esto le ayuda a aumentar su  ingreso.

        También es empleada doméstica, trabajo que la ayuda a obtener otro ingreso ya que su hijo se encuentra estudiando en el colegio y requiere de recurso económico para ir terminando sus estudios.

         Con el crédito  obtenido comprará  edredones, colchas, ponchos, mantas y otros.
texts.en:
Mrs. Marta A. is from the city of Carapeguá, Barrió Santa Margarita. She has a teenage son of school age. Marta sells clothing and other hand-crafted products like comforters, bedspreads, blankets, and ponchos. She has been doing this work for several years in the Carapeguá area and neighboring areas. She says that she has several customers and that this work earns her a good amount of money, and this helps her to increase her income. She is also a domestic worker, a job which helps her to earn more income since her son is studying in secondary school, and she needs the economic resources so he can complete his studies. With this loan she will buy comforters, bedspreads, ponchos, blankets and other items.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase comforters, bedspreads, ponchos, blankets and other items

loans.name: David Mbugua

texts.en:
David Mbugua, 39 years old, is married to Ann Wanjiru, and together they have three children, all still in school. He has operated a taxi business within the Githurai area for 10 years and now makes a profit of kshs 13,000 per month.

David, who was introduced to KADET by another client, is requesting his first loan which he will use to expand his secondary business, a butcher shop in the same area, and also repaint his taxi vehicle since he plans to expand his area of operation to the central Business District in Nairobi.

He plans to buy another taxi and employ someone to drive it for him.

loans.use: To expand his butcher shop and repaint his taxi vehicle

loans.name: Medalit

texts.es:
Medalit tiene 30 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a sus padres en elsector San Isidro Desaguadero del caserío Calazán ubicado en el distrito de Monsefú, a mas de veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace dos años a la venta de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega instalada en su domicilio, allí ella ofrece a sus clientes diversos productos de consumo y uso diario que contribuyen a facilitar sus vidas diarias. El negocio goza de buena acogida gracias al buen trato que brinda y a la calidad de productos que ofrece. Con los ingresos que percibe ayuda a sus padres a solventar la economía diaria de su familia.

Medalit desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas productos de modo que pueda ampliar sus ventas y percibir mayor cantidad de ingresos, para realizar esta acción ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Ella es una joven bastante responsable y que gusta mucho de la labor que realiza, sus vecinos y conocidos le consideran alguien tranquila y coanfiable.
texts.en:
Medalit is 30 years old. She is single and lives with her parents in the San Isidro Desaguadero neighborhood of the Calazán hamlet in the Monsefú district, located 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For the last two years, she has been selling necessaries and groceries from a shop attached to her house. She offers her clients many consumer products that they use regularly. The business does well thanks to her good service and the quality of the products she offers. She uses the income to help her parents meet the everyday costs of their family. Medalit wants to expand her business and buy more products so that she can make more sales and thus more money. For this reason, she is seeking her first loan with the microfinance partner Edpyme Alternativa. She is a very responsible young woman who enjoys her work, and her neighbors and acquaintances find her trustworthy and reliable.

Translated from Spanish by Ross Forman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy good to increase the stock for the store attached to her house

loans.name: Gioconda Yamileth

texts.es: La  Sra. Gioconda Yamileth R. A.  ella  es trabajadora Activa de Distribuidora “R. S.A” desempeñándose como Ejecutiva de Venta , tiene  cinco años de trabajar para esta institución, tiene un niño en edad escolar. Ha tenido  tres créditos con CEPRODEL y los ha realizado para comprar materiales de construcción para mejorar su casa de habitación, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esa manera ella  ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Gioconda Yamileth R. A. has been employed by Distribuidora “R. S.A” for the last five years as a Sales Executive.  She has a school aged son.

She has had three previous loans with CEPRODEL that she’s used to buy building materials and supplies for home improvements.

Ceprodel loans have been of great benefit to her in that they have made possible improved living conditions for her and her family.

loans.use: For stone, cement, sand and gravel.

loans.name: Ozoda

texts.ru: Кобилова Озода жительница Шахритуского района. Возраст, 41 год. Замужем, имеет 3 детей. Образование среднее. Более 5 лет занимается торговлей на рынке. Арендует торговую точку, где продает вещи нужные для хозяйства (веревка, ремень). В бизнесе ей помогает дочь. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Ozoda K. lives in the Shahrituz region. 41 years of age. Married, with three children. Education: secondary. She has been a market vendor for over five years. She rents a stall where she sells households goods (string, belts etc). Her daughter helps her in this business. She is taking out a loan in order to increase her sales volume.

loans.use: Increasing sales volume

loans.name: Miriam Wanjiru

texts.en:
Miriam has been selling clothes in Naivasha town for the last six years.  She is 26 years old, married to Dedan Hure Irigaha, and they have three children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend and this will be her first loan.  She plans to use the money to buy more clothes for sale, targeting the coming holidays which are the  peak season for her business.

In future, Miriam hopes  to grow  her boutique and sell clothes for both genders and all ages of people.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for resale
